double coeff_rolling_drag () const
 coefficient of rolling resistance multiplied by velocity to get the variable part of rolling resistance drag in N multiplied by a constant to get the constant part of rolling resistance drag in N depends on wheel design, wheel number, and vehicle weight More...
 
double coeff_water_drag () const
 coefficient of water drag in kg/m multiplied by the square of speed to calculate water drag force in N proportional to cross sectional area of the vehicle, times the density of water, times a dimensional constant based on the vehicle's shape More...

Detailed Description

A vehicle as a whole with all its components.

This object can occupy multiple tiles, the objects actually visible on the map are of type vehicle_part.

Facts you need to know about implementation:

  • Vehicles belong to map. There's std::vector<vehicle> for each submap in grid. When requesting a reference to vehicle, keep in mind it can be invalidated by functions such as map::displace_vehicle().
  • To check if there's any vehicle at given map tile, call map::veh_at(), and check vehicle type (veh_null means there's no vehicle there).
  • Vehicle consists of parts (represented by vector). Parts have some constant info: see veh_type.h, vpart_info structure and vpart_list array – that is accessible through part_info() method. The second part is variable info, see vehicle_part structure.
  • Parts are mounted at some point relative to vehicle position (or starting part) (0, 0 in mount coordinates). There can be more than one part at given mount coordinates, and they are mounted in different slots. Check tileray.h file to see a picture of coordinate axes.
  • Vehicle can be rotated to arbitrary degree. This means that mount coordinates are rotated to match vehicle's face direction before their actual positions are known. For optimization purposes mount coordinates are precalculated for current vehicle face direction and stored in precalc[0]. precalc[1] stores mount coordinates for next move (vehicle can move and turn). Method map::displace_vehicle() assigns precalc[1] to precalc[0]. At any time (except map::vehmove() innermost cycle) you can get actual part coordinates relative to vehicle's position by reading precalc[0]. Vehicles rotate around a (possibly changing) pivot point, and the precalculated coordinates always put the pivot point at (0,0).
  • Vehicle keeps track of 3 directions:
    Direction Meaning
    face where it's facing currently
    move where it's moving, it's different from face if it's skidding
    turn_dir where it will turn at next move, if it won't stop due to collision
  • Some methods take part or p parameter. This is the index of a part in the parts list.
  • Driver doesn't know what vehicle he drives. There's only player::in_vehicle flag which indicates that he is inside vehicle. To figure out what, you need to ask a map if there's a vehicle at driver/passenger position.
  • To keep info consistent, always use map::board_vehicle() and map::unboard_vehicle() for boarding/unboarding player.
  • To add new predesigned vehicle, add an entry to data/raw/vehicles.json similar to the existing ones. Keep in mind, that positive x coordinate points forwards, negative x is back, positive y is to the right, and negative y to the left: 
    orthogonal dir left (-Y)
     ^
-X ------->  +X (forward)
     v
orthogonal dir right (+Y)
    When adding parts, function checks possibility to install part at given coordinates. If it shows debug messages that it can't add parts, when you start the game, you did something wrong. There are a few rules:
    1. Every mount point (tile) must begin with a part in the 'structure' location, usually a frame.
    2. No part can stack with itself.
    3. No part can stack with another part in the same location, unless that part is so small as to have no particular location (such as headlights). If you can't understand why installation fails, try to assemble your vehicle in game first.

Definition at line 674 of file vehicle.h.

1251 stop( false );
1252 of_turn = 0;
1253 is_falling = false;
1254 return this;
1255 }
1256 if( decrement_summon_timer() ) {
1257 return nullptr;
1258 }
1259 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
1260 const bool pl_ctrl = player_in_control( player_character );
1261 // TODO: Remove this hack, have vehicle sink a z-level
1262 if( is_floating && !can_float() ) {
1263 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Your %s sank." ), name );
1264 if( pl_ctrl ) {
1265 unboard_all();
1266 }
1267 if( g->remoteveh() == this ) {
1268 g->setremoteveh( nullptr );
1269 }
1270

1272 // Destroy vehicle (sank to nowhere)
1273 here.destroy_vehicle( this );
1274 return nullptr;
1275 }
1276
1277 // It needs to fall when it has no support OR was falling before
1278 // so that vertical collisions happen.
1279 const bool should_fall = is_falling || vertical_velocity != 0;
1280
1281 // TODO: Saner diagonal movement, so that you can jump off cliffs properly
1282 // The ratio of vertical to horizontal movement should be vertical_velocity/velocity
1283 // for as long as of_turn doesn't run out.
1284 if( should_fall ) {
1285 // Convert from 100*mph to m/s
1286 const float old_vel = vmiph_to_mps( vertical_velocity );
1287 // Formula is v_2 = sqrt( 2*d*g + v_1^2 )
1288 // Note: That drops the sign
1289 const float new_vel = -std::sqrt( 2 * tile_height * GRAVITY_OF_EARTH + old_vel * old_vel );
1290 vertical_velocity = mps_to_vmiph( new_vel );
1291 is_falling = true;
1292 } else {
1293 // Not actually falling, was just marked for fall test
1294 is_falling = false;
1295 }
1296
1297 // Low enough for bicycles to go in reverse.
1298 // If the movement is due to a change in z-level, i.e a helicopter then the lateral movement will often be zero.
1299 if( !should_fall && std::abs( velocity ) < 20 && requested_z_change == 0 ) {
1300 stop();
1301 of_turn -= .321f;
1302 return this;
1303 }
1304
1305 const float wheel_traction_area = here.vehicle_wheel_traction( *this );
1306 const float traction = k_traction( wheel_traction_area );
1307 if( traction < 0.001f ) {
1308 of_turn = 0;
1309 if( !should_fall ) {
1310 stop();
1311 if( floating.empty() ) {
1312 add_msg( m_info, _( "Your %s can't move on this terrain." ), name );
1313 } else {
1314 add_msg( m_info, _( "Your %s is beached." ), name );
1315 }
1316 return this;
1317 }
1318 }
1319 const float turn_cost = vehicles::vmiph_per_tile / std::max<float>( 0.0001f, std::abs( velocity ) );
1320
1321 // Can't afford it this turn?
1322 // Low speed shouldn't prevent vehicle from falling, though
1323 bool falling_only = false;
1324 if( turn_cost >= of_turn && ( ( !is_flying && requested_z_change == 0 ) || !is_rotorcraft() ) ) {
1325 if( !should_fall ) {
1326 of_turn_carry = of_turn;
1327 of_turn = 0;
1328 return this;
1329 }
1330 falling_only = true;
1331 }
1332
1333 // Decrease of_turn if falling+moving, but not when it's lower than move cost
1334 if( !falling_only ) {
1335 of_turn -= turn_cost;
1336 }
1337
1338 const bool can_use_rails = this->can_use_rails();
1339 const bool is_on_rails = vehicle_movement::is_on_rails( here, *this );
1340 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
1341 bool controlled = false;
1342 // It can even be a NPC, but must be at the controls
1343 for( int boarded : boarded_parts() ) {
1344 if( part_with_feature( boarded, VPFLAG_CONTROLS, true ) >= 0 ) {
1345 controlled = true;
1346 player *passenger = get_passenger( boarded );
1347 if( passenger != nullptr ) {
1348 passenger->practice( skill_driving, 1 );
1349 }
1350 }
1351 }
1352
1353 // Eventually send it skidding if no control
1354 // But not if it's remotely controlled, is in water or is on rails
1355 if( !controlled && !pl_ctrl && !is_floating && !is_on_rails && !is_flying &&
1356 requested_z_change == 0 ) {
1357 skidding = true;
1358 }
1359 }
1360
1361 if( skidding && one_in( 4 ) ) {
1362 // Might turn uncontrollably while skidding
1363 turn( one_in( 2 ) ? -15_degrees : 15_degrees );
1364 }
1365
1366 if( should_fall ) {
1367 // TODO: Insert a (hard) driving test to stop this from happening
1368 skidding = true;
1369 }
1370
1371 vehicle_movement::rail_processing_result rpres;
1372 if( can_use_rails && !falling_only ) {
1373 rpres = vehicle_movement::process_movement_on_rails( here, *this );
1374 }
1375 if( rpres.do_turn ) {
1376 turn_dir = rpres.turn_dir;
1377 }
1378
1379 // The direction we're moving
1380 tileray mdir;
1381 if( skidding || should_fall ) {
1382 // If skidding, it's the move vector
1383 // Same for falling - no air control
1384 mdir = move;
1385 } else if( turn_dir != face.dir() && ( !is_on_rails || rpres.do_turn ) ) {
1386 // Driver turned vehicle, get turn_dir
1387 mdir.init( turn_dir );
1388 } else {
1389 // Not turning, keep face.dir
1390 mdir = face;
1391 }
1392
1393 tripoint dp;
1394 if( std::abs( velocity ) >= 20 && !falling_only ) {
1395 mdir.advance( velocity < 0 ? -1 : 1 );
1396 if( rpres.do_shift ) {
1397 dp.x = rpres.shift_amount.x;
1398 dp.y = rpres.shift_amount.y;
1399 } else {
1400 dp.x = mdir.dx();
1401 dp.y = mdir.dy();
1402 }
1403 }
1404
1405 if( should_fall ) {
1406 dp.z = -1;
1407 is_flying = false;
1408 } else {
1409 dp.z = requested_z_change;
1410 requested_z_change = 0;
1411 if( dp.z > 0 && is_rotorcraft() ) {
1412 is_flying = true;
1413 }
1414 }
1415
1416 return here.move_vehicle( *this, dp, mdir );
1417}

◆ add_item() [1/2]

cata::optional< vehicle_stack::iterator > vehicle::add_item ( int  part,
const item &  itm 
)

Try to add an item to part's cargo.

Returns
cata::nullopt if it can't be put here (not a cargo part, adding this would violate the volume limit or item count limit, not all charges can fit, etc.) Otherwise, returns an iterator to the added item in the vehicle stack

5412 }

318{
319 static const vpart_id frame_id( "frame_vertical" );
320 //No need to check the same spot more than once

324 continue;
325 }

331 found = true;

◆ add_steerable_wheels()

void vehicle::add_steerable_wheels ( )
private

Definition at line 344 of file vehicle.cpp.

345{
346 int axle = INT_MIN;
347 std::vector< std::pair<int, vpart_id> > wheels;
348
349 // Find wheels that have steerable versions.
350 // Convert the wheel(s) with the largest x value.
351 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
352 if( vp.has_feature( "STEERABLE" ) || vp.has_feature( "TRACKED" ) ) {
353 // Has a wheel that is inherently steerable
354 // (e.g. unicycle, casters), this vehicle doesn't
355 // need conversion.
356 return;
357 }
358
359 if( vp.mount().x < axle ) {
360 // there is another axle in front of this
361 continue;
362 }
363
364 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_WHEEL ) ) {
365 vpart_id steerable_id( vp.info().get_id().str() + "_steerable" );
366 if( steerable_id.is_valid() ) {
367 // We can convert this.
368 if( vp.mount().x != axle ) {
369 // Found a new axle further forward than the
370 // existing one.
371 wheels.clear();
372 axle = vp.mount().x;
373 }
374
375 wheels.push_back( std::make_pair( static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() ), steerable_id ) );
376 }
377 }
378 }
379
380 // Now convert the wheels to their new types.
381 for( auto &wheel : wheels ) {
382 parts[ wheel.first ].id = wheel.second;
383 }
384}

106{
107 // fetch matching parts and abort early if none found
108 const auto found = get_avail_parts( flag );
109 if( empty( found ) ) {
110 return;
111 }
112
113 // can this menu option be selected by the user?
114 bool allow = true;
115
116 // determine target state - currently parts of similar type are all switched concurrently
117 bool state = std::none_of( found.begin(), found.end(), []( const vpart_reference & vp ) {
118 return vp.part().enabled;
119 } );
120
121 // if toggled part potentially usable check if could be enabled now (sufficient fuel etc.)
122 if( state ) {
123 allow = std::any_of( found.begin(), found.end(), []( const vpart_reference & vp ) {
124 return vp.vehicle().can_enable( vp.part() );
125 } );
126 }
127
128 auto msg = string_format( state ?
129 _( "Turn on %s" ) :
130 colorize( _( "Turn off %s" ), c_pink ),
131 name );
132 options.emplace_back( -1, allow, key, msg );
133
134 actions.push_back( [ = ] {
135 for( const vpart_reference &vp : found )
136 {
137 vehicle_part &e = vp.part();
138 if( e.enabled != state ) {
139 add_msg( state ? _( "Turned on %s" ) : _( "Turned off %s." ), e.name() );
140 e.enabled = state;
141 }
142 }
143 refresh();
144 } );
145}

◆ adjust_zlevel()

void vehicle::adjust_zlevel ( int  idir = 0,
const tripoint &  offset = tripoint_zero 
)

Definition at line 1454 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

1455{
1456 //We don't need to do anything if we're not on a ramp
1457 //unless position 0 is outside the vehicle then there may be a ramp in between
1458 if( part_at( point_zero ) != -1 && !check_on_ramp( idir, offset ) ) {
1459 return;
1460 }
1461
1462 // when a vehicle part enters the low end of a down ramp, or the high end of an up ramp,
1463 // it immediately translates down or up a z-level, respectively, ending up on the low
1464 // end of an up ramp or high end of a down ramp, respectively. The two ends are set
1465 // past each other, like so:
1466 // (side view) z+1 Rdh RDl
1467 // z+0 RUh Rul
1468 // A vehicle moving left to right on z+1 drives down to z+0 by entering the ramp down low end.
1469 // A vehicle moving right to left on z+0 drives up to z+1 by entering the ramp up high end.
1470 // A vehicle moving left to right on z+0 should ideally collide into a wall before entering
1471 // the ramp up high end, but even if it does, it briefly transitions to z+1 before returning
1472 // to z0 by entering the ramp down low end.
1473 // A vehicle moving right to left on z+1 drives down to z+0 by entering the ramp down low end,
1474 // then immediately returns to z+1 by entering the ramp up high end.
1475 // When a vehicle's central point transitions a z-level via a ramp, all other pre-calc points
1476 // make the opposite transition, so that points that were above an ascending pivot point are
1477 // now level with it, and parts that were level with an ascending pivot point are now below
1478 // it.
1479
1480 auto &m = get_map();
1481 tripoint global_pos = global_pos3();
1482
1483 tripoint new_center = global_pos + offset;
1484
1485 if( m.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, new_center ) ) {
1486 new_center.z--;
1487 } else if( m.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, new_center ) ) {
1488 new_center.z++;
1489 }
1490
1491 std::map<point, int> z_cache;
1492
1493 //Draw a line from the center to each part, going up and down ramps as we do
1494 for( auto &prt : get_all_parts() ) {
1495 tripoint part_point = global_pos + offset + prt.part().precalc[idir];
1496
1497 auto cache_entry = z_cache.find( part_point.xy() );
1498 if( cache_entry != z_cache.end() ) {
1499 prt.part().precalc[idir].z = cache_entry->second;
1500 continue;
1501 }
1502
1503 tripoint line = new_center;
1504 while( line.xy() != part_point.xy() ) {
1505 if( line.x < part_point.x ) {
1506 line.x++;
1507 } else if( line.x > part_point.x ) {
1508 line.x--;
1509 }
1510 if( line.y < part_point.y ) {
1511 line.y++;
1512 } else if( line.y > part_point.y ) {
1513 line.y--;
1514 }
1515 if( m.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_UP, line ) ) {
1516 line.z += 1;
1517 }
1518 if( m.has_flag( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, line ) ) {
1519 line.z -= 1;
1520 }
1521 }
1522 prt.part().precalc[idir].z = line.z - global_pos.z;
1523 z_cache[part_point.xy()] = line.z - global_pos.z;
1524 }
1525}
vehicle::check_on_ramp
bool check_on_ramp(int idir=0, const tripoint &offset=tripoint_zero) const
Definition: vehicle_move.cpp:1442
vehicle::part_at
int part_at(const point &dp) const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:2929

@ TFLAG_RAMP_UP
Definition: mapdata.h:313
TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN
@ TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN
Definition: mapdata.h:312

◆ all_parts_at_location()

std::vector< int > vehicle::all_parts_at_location ( const std::string &  location) const

Returns all parts in the vehicle that exist in the given location slot.

If the empty string is passed in, returns all parts with no slot.

Parameters
locationThe location slot to get parts for.
Returns
A list of indices to all parts with the specified location.

bool vehicle::assign_seat ( vehicle_part &  pt,

)

Try to assign a crew member (who must be a player ally) to a specific seat.

Note
enforces NPC's being assigned to only one seat (per-vehicle) at once

Definition at line 581 of file vehicle_part.cpp.

582{
583 if( !pt.is_seat() || !pt.set_crew( who ) ) {
584 return false;
585 }
586
587 // NPC's can only be assigned to one seat in the vehicle
588 for( auto &e : parts ) {
589 if( &e == &pt ) {
590 // skip this part
591 continue;
592 }
593
594 if( e.is_seat() ) {
595 const npc *n = e.crew();
596 if( n && n->getID() == who.getID() ) {
597 e.unset_crew();
598 }
599 }
600 }
601
602 return true;
603}

◆ automatic_fire_turret()

int vehicle::automatic_fire_turret ( vehicle_part &  pt)

Definition at line 542 of file turret.cpp.

543{
544 turret_data gun = turret_query( pt );
545
546 int shots = 0;
547
548 if( gun.query() != turret_data::status::ready ) {
549 return shots;
550 }
551
552 // The position of the vehicle part.
553 tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( pt );
554
555 // Create the targeting computer's npc
556 npc cpu = get_targeting_npc( pt );
557
558 int area = max_aoe_size( gun.ammo_effects() );
559 if( area > 0 ) {
560 // Pad a bit for less friendly fire
561 area += area == 1 ? 1 : 2;
562 }
563
564 const bool u_see = g->u.sees( pos );
565 const bool u_hear = !g->u.is_deaf();
566 // The current target of the turret.
567 auto &target = pt.target;
568 if( target.first == target.second ) {
569 // Manual target not set, find one automatically.
570 // BEWARE: Calling turret_data.fire on tripoint min coordinates starts a crash
571 // triggered at `trajectory.insert( trajectory.begin(), source )` at ranged.cpp:236
572 pt.reset_target( pos );
573 int boo_hoo;
574
575 // TODO: calculate chance to hit and cap range based upon this
576 int max_range = 20;
577 int range = std::min( gun.range(), max_range );
578 Creature *auto_target = cpu.auto_find_hostile_target( range, boo_hoo, area );
579 if( auto_target == nullptr ) {
580 if( boo_hoo ) {
581 cpu.name = string_format( pgettext( "vehicle turret", "The %s" ), pt.name() );
582 // check if the player can see or hear then print chooses a message accordingly
583 if( u_see && u_hear ) {
584 add_msg( m_warning, vgettext( "%s points in your direction and emits an IFF warning beep.",
585 "%s points in your direction and emits %d annoyed sounding beeps.",
586 boo_hoo ),
587 cpu.name, boo_hoo );
588 } else if( u_hear ) {
589 add_msg( m_warning, vgettext( "You hear a warning beep.",
590 "You hear %d annoyed sounding beeps.",
591 boo_hoo ), boo_hoo );
592 } else if( u_see ) {
593 add_msg( m_warning, _( "%s points in your direction." ), cpu.name );
594 }
595 }
596 return shots;
597 }
598
599 target.second = auto_target->pos();
600
601 } else {
602 // Target is already set, make sure we didn't move after aiming (it's a bug if we did).
603 if( pos != target.first ) {
604 target.second = target.first;
605 debugmsg( "%s moved after aiming but before it could fire.", cpu.name );
606 return shots;
607 }
608 }
609
610 // Get the turret's target and reset it
611 tripoint targ = target.second;
612 pt.reset_target( pos );
613
614 shots = gun.fire( cpu, targ );
615
616 if( shots && u_see && !g->u.sees( targ ) ) {
617 add_msg( _( "The %1$s fires its %2$s!" ), name, pt.name() );
618 }
619
620 return shots;
621}

◆ autopilot_patrol()

void vehicle::autopilot_patrol ( )

choose one single zone ( multiple zones too complex for now ) choose a point at the far edge of the zone the edge chosen is the edge that is smaller, therefore the longer side of the rectangle is the one the vehicle drives mostly parallel too. if its perfect square then choose a point that is on any edge that the vehicle is not currently at drive to that point. then once arrived, choose a random opposite point of the zone. this should ( in a simple fashion ) cause a patrolling behavior in a criss-cross fashion. in an auto-tractor, this would eventually cover the entire rectangle.

Definition at line 701 of file vehicle.cpp.

702{
703 /** choose one single zone ( multiple zones too complex for now )
704 * choose a point at the far edge of the zone
705 * the edge chosen is the edge that is smaller, therefore the longer side
706 * of the rectangle is the one the vehicle drives mostly parallel too.
707 * if its perfect square then choose a point that is on any edge that the
708 * vehicle is not currently at
709 * drive to that point.
710 * then once arrived, choose a random opposite point of the zone.
711 * this should ( in a simple fashion ) cause a patrolling behavior
712 * in a criss-cross fashion.
713 * in an auto-tractor, this would eventually cover the entire rectangle.
714 */
715 // if we are close to a waypoint, then return to come back to this function next turn.
716 if( autodrive_local_target != tripoint_zero ) {
717 if( rl_dist( global_square_location().raw(), autodrive_local_target ) <= 3 ) {
718 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
719 return;
720 }
721 if( !g->m.inbounds( g->m.getlocal( autodrive_local_target ) ) ) {
722 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
723 is_patrolling = false;
724 return;
725 }
726 drive_to_local_target( autodrive_local_target, false );
727 return;
728 }
729 zone_manager &mgr = zone_manager::get_manager();
730 const auto &zone_src_set = mgr.get_near( zone_type_id( "VEHICLE_PATROL" ),
731 global_square_location().raw(), 60 );
732 if( zone_src_set.empty() ) {
733 is_patrolling = false;
734 return;
735 }
736 // get corners.
737 tripoint min;
738 tripoint max;
739 for( const tripoint &box : zone_src_set ) {
740 if( min == tripoint_zero ) {
741 min = box;
742 max = box;
743 continue;
744 }
745 min.x = std::min( box.x, min.x );
746 min.y = std::min( box.y, min.y );
747 min.z = std::min( box.z, min.z );
748 max.x = std::max( box.x, max.x );
749 max.y = std::max( box.y, max.y );
750 max.z = std::max( box.z, max.z );
751 }
752 const bool x_side = ( max.x - min.x ) < ( max.y - min.y );
753 const int point_along = x_side ? rng( min.x, max.x ) : rng( min.y, max.y );
754 const tripoint max_tri = x_side ? tripoint( point_along, max.y, min.z ) : tripoint( max.x,
755 point_along,
756 min.z );
757 const tripoint min_tri = x_side ? tripoint( point_along, min.y, min.z ) : tripoint( min.x,
758 point_along,
759 min.z );
760 tripoint chosen_tri = min_tri;
761 if( rl_dist( max_tri, global_square_location().raw() ) >= rl_dist( min_tri,
762 global_square_location().raw() ) ) {
763 chosen_tri = max_tri;
764 }
765 autodrive_local_target = chosen_tri;
766 drive_to_local_target( autodrive_local_target, false );
767}
vehicle::global_square_location
tripoint_abs_ms global_square_location() const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:3271
vehicle::is_patrolling
bool is_patrolling
Definition: vehicle.h:1984
vehicle::drive_to_local_target
void drive_to_local_target(const tripoint &target, bool follow_protocol)
Definition: vehicle.cpp:816
vehicle::autodrive_local_target
tripoint autodrive_local_target
Definition: vehicle.h:1881

Definition: clzones.h:340

◆ basic_consumption()

3478{
3479 int fcon = 0;

3481 if( is_engine_type_on( e, ftype ) ) {
3482 if( parts[ engines[e] ].ammo_current() == fuel_type_battery &&

◆ beeper_sound()

void vehicle::beeper_sound ( )

Definition at line 1245 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

1246{
1247 // No power = no sound
1248 if( fuel_left( fuel_type_battery, true ) == 0 ) {
1249 return;
1250 }
1251
1252 const bool odd_turn = calendar::once_every( 2_turns );
1253 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "BEEPER" ) ) {

1255 ( !odd_turn && vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_ODDTURN ) ) ) {
1256 continue;
1257 }

1260 sounds::sound( vp.pos(), vp.info().bonus, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "beep!" ), false, "vehicle",

◆ break_off()

int vehicle::break_off ( int  p,
int  dmg 
)
private

Definition at line 6528 of file vehicle.cpp.

6529{
6530 /* Already-destroyed part - chance it could be torn off into pieces.
6531 * Chance increases with damage, and decreases with part max durability
6532 * (so lights, etc are easily removed; frames and plating not so much) */
6533 if( rng( 0, part_info( p ).durability / 10 ) >= dmg ) {
6534 return dmg;
6535 }
6536 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( p );
6537 const auto scatter_parts = [&]( const vehicle_part & pt ) {
6538 for( const item &piece : pt.pieces_for_broken_part() ) {
6539 // inside the loop, so each piece goes to a different place
6540 // TODO: this may spawn items behind a wall
6541 const tripoint where = random_entry( g->m.points_in_radius( pos, SCATTER_DISTANCE ) );
6542 // TODO: balance audit, ensure that less pieces are generated than one would need
6543 // to build the component (smash a vehicle box that took 10 lumps of steel,
6544 // find 12 steel lumps scattered after atom-smashing it with a tree trunk)
6545 if( !magic ) {
6546 g->m.add_item_or_charges( where, piece );
6547 }
6548 }
6549 };
6550 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
6551 // For structural parts, remove other parts first
6552 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
6553 for( int index = parts_in_square.size() - 1; index >= 0; index-- ) {
6554 // Ignore the frame being destroyed
6555 if( parts_in_square[index] == p ) {
6556 continue;
6557 }
6558
6559 if( parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].is_broken() ) {
6560 // Tearing off a broken part - break it up
6561 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6562 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %s's %s breaks into pieces!" ), name,
6563 parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].name() );
6564 }
6565 scatter_parts( parts[parts_in_square[index]] );
6566 } else {
6567 // Intact (but possibly damaged) part - remove it in one piece
6568 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6569 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is torn off!" ), name,
6570 parts[ parts_in_square[ index ] ].name() );
6571 }
6572 item part_as_item = parts[parts_in_square[index]].properties_to_item();
6573 if( !magic ) {
6574 g->m.add_item_or_charges( pos, part_as_item );
6575 }
6576 }
6577 remove_part( parts_in_square[index] );
6578 }
6579 // After clearing the frame, remove it.
6580 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6581 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is destroyed!" ), name, parts[ p ].name() );
6582 }
6583 scatter_parts( parts[p] );
6584 remove_part( p );
6585 find_and_split_vehicles( p );
6586 } else {
6587 //Just break it off
6588 if( g->u.sees( pos ) ) {
6589 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s is destroyed!" ), name, parts[ p ].name() );
6590 }
6591
6592 scatter_parts( parts[p] );
6593 remove_part( p );
6594 }
6595
6596 return dmg;
6597}

void vehicle::calc_mass_center ( bool  precalc) const
private

Definition at line 6984 of file vehicle.cpp.

6985{
6986 units::quantity<float, units::mass::unit_type> xf;
6987 units::quantity<float, units::mass::unit_type> yf;
6988 units::mass m_total = 0_gram;
6989 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6990 const size_t i = vp.part_index();
6991 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6992 continue;
6993 }
6994
6995 units::mass m_part = 0_gram;
6996 units::mass m_part_items = 0_gram;
6997 m_part += vp.part().base.weight();
6998 for( const auto &j : get_items( i ) ) {
6999 m_part_items += j.weight();
7000 }
7001 if( vp.part().info().cargo_weight_modifier != 100 ) {
7002 m_part_items *= static_cast<float>( vp.part().info().cargo_weight_modifier ) / 100.0f;
7003 }
7004 m_part += m_part_items;
7005
7006 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_BOARDABLE ) && vp.part().has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
7007 const player *p = get_passenger( i );
7008 // Sometimes flag is wrongly set, don't crash!
7009 m_part += p != nullptr ? p->get_weight() : 0_gram;
7010 }
7011
7012 if( use_precalc ) {
7013 xf += vp.part().precalc[0].x * m_part;
7014 yf += vp.part().precalc[0].y * m_part;
7015 } else {
7016 xf += vp.mount().x * m_part;
7017 yf += vp.mount().y * m_part;
7018 }
7019
7020 m_total += m_part;
7021 }
7022
7023 mass_cache = m_total;
7024 mass_dirty = false;
7025
7026 const float x = xf / mass_cache;
7027 const float y = yf / mass_cache;
7028 if( use_precalc ) {
7029 mass_center_precalc.x = std::round( x );
7030 mass_center_precalc.y = std::round( y );
7031 mass_center_precalc_dirty = false;
7032 } else {
7033 mass_center_no_precalc.x = std::round( x );
7034 mass_center_no_precalc.y = std::round( y );
7035 mass_center_no_precalc_dirty = false;
7036 }
7037}

◆ can_mount()

bool vehicle::can_mount ( const point &  dp,
const vpart_id &  id 
) const

Returns whether or not the vehicle part with the given id can be mounted in the specified square.

Parameters
dpThe local coordinate to mount in.
idThe id of the part to install.
Returns
true if the part can be mounted, false if not.

Definition at line 1271 of file vehicle.cpp.

1272{
1273 //The part has to actually exist.
1274 if( !id.is_valid() ) {
1275 return false;
1276 }
1277
1278 //It also has to be a real part, not the null part
1279 const vpart_info &part = id.obj();
1280 if( part.has_flag( "NOINSTALL" ) ) {
1281 return false;
1282 }
1283
1284 const std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( dp, false );
1285
1286 //First part in an empty square MUST be a structural part
1287 if( parts_in_square.empty() && part.location != part_location_structure ) {
1288 return false;
1289 }
1290 // If its a part that harnesses animals that don't allow placing on it.
1291 if( !parts_in_square.empty() && part_info( parts_in_square[0] ).has_flag( "ANIMAL_CTRL" ) ) {
1292 return false;
1293 }
1294 //No other part can be placed on a protrusion
1295 if( !parts_in_square.empty() && part_info( parts_in_square[0] ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1296 return false;
1297 }
1298
1299 //No part type can stack with itself, or any other part in the same slot
1300 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1301 const vpart_info &other_part = parts[elem].info();
1302
1303 //Parts with no location can stack with each other (but not themselves)
1304 if( part.get_id() == other_part.get_id() ||
1305 ( !part.location.empty() && part.location == other_part.location ) ) {
1306 return false;
1307 }
1308 // Until we have an interface for handling multiple components with CARGO space,
1309 // exclude them from being mounted in the same tile.
1310 if( part.has_flag( "CARGO" ) && other_part.has_flag( "CARGO" ) ) {
1311 return false;
1312 }
1313
1314 }
1315
1316 // All parts after the first must be installed on or next to an existing part
1317 // the exception is when a single tile only structural object is being repaired
1318 if( !parts.empty() ) {
1319 if( !is_structural_part_removed() &&
1320 !has_structural_part( dp ) &&
1321 !has_structural_part( dp + point_east ) &&
1322 !has_structural_part( dp + point_south ) &&
1323 !has_structural_part( dp + point_west ) &&
1324 !has_structural_part( dp + point_north ) ) {
1325 return false;
1326 }
1327 }
1328
1329 // only one exclusive engine allowed
1330 std::string empty;
1331 if( has_engine_conflict( &part, empty ) ) {
1332 return false;
1333 }
1334
1335 // Check all the flags of the part to see if they require other flags
1336 // If other flags are required check if those flags are present
1337 for( const std::string &flag : part.get_flags() ) {
1338 if( !json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag().empty() ) {
1339 bool anchor_found = false;
1340 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1341 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag() ) ) {
1342 anchor_found = true;
1343 }
1344 }
1345 if( !anchor_found ) {
1346 return false;
1347 }
1348 }
1349 }
1350
1351 //Mirrors cannot be mounted on OPAQUE parts
1352 if( part.has_flag( "VISION" ) && !part.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
1353 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1354 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "OPAQUE" ) ) {
1355 return false;
1356 }
1357 }
1358 }
1359 //Opaque parts cannot be mounted on mirrors parts
1360 if( part.has_flag( "OPAQUE" ) ) {
1361 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1362 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "VISION" ) &&
1363 !part_info( elem ).has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
1364 return false;
1365 }
1366 }
1367 }
1368
1369 //Turret mounts must NOT be installed on other (modded) turret mounts
1370 if( part.has_flag( "TURRET_MOUNT" ) ) {
1371 for( const auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1372 if( part_info( elem ).has_flag( "TURRET_MOUNT" ) ) {
1373 return false;
1374 }
1375 }
1376 }
1377
1378 //Anything not explicitly denied is permitted
1379 return true;
1380}

◆ can_unmount() [2/2]

bool vehicle::can_unmount ( int  p,
std::string &  reason 
) const

Definition at line 1388 of file vehicle.cpp.

1389{
1390 if( p < 0 || p > static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1391 return false;
1392 }
1393
1394 // Find all the flags on parts in this tile that require other flags
1395 const point pt = parts[p].mount;
1396 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( pt, false );
1397
1398 for( auto &elem : parts_here ) {
1399 for( const std::string &flag : part_info( elem ).get_flags() ) {
1400 if( part_info( p ).has_flag( json_flag::get( flag ).requires_flag() ) ) {
1401 reason = string_format( _( "Remove the attached %s first." ), part_info( elem ).name() );
1402 return false;
1403 }
1404 }
1405 }
1406
1407 //Can't remove an animal part if the animal is still contained
1408 if( parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag ) ) {
1409 reason = _( "Remove carried animal first." );
1410 return false;
1411 }
1412
1413 //Structural parts have extra requirements
1414 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
1415
1416 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, false );
1417 /* To remove a structural part, there can be only structural parts left
1418 * in that square (might be more than one in the case of wreckage) */
1419 for( auto &elem : parts_in_square ) {
1420 if( part_info( elem ).location != part_location_structure ) {
1421 reason = _( "Remove all other attached parts first." );
1422 return false;
1423 }
1424 }
1425
1426 //If it's the last part in the square...
1427 if( parts_in_square.size() == 1 ) {
1428
1429 /* This is the tricky part: We can't remove a part that would cause
1430 * the vehicle to 'break into two' (like removing the middle section
1431 * of a quad bike, for instance). This basically requires doing some
1432 * breadth-first searches to ensure previously connected parts are
1433 * still connected. */
1434
1435 //First, find all the squares connected to the one we're removing
1436 std::vector<vehicle_part> connected_parts;
1437
1438 for( int i = 0; i < 4; i++ ) {
1439 const point next = parts[p].mount + point( i < 2 ? ( i == 0 ? -1 : 1 ) : 0,
1440 i < 2 ? 0 : ( i == 2 ? -1 : 1 ) );
1441 std::vector<int> parts_over_there = parts_at_relative( next, false );
1442 //Ignore empty squares
1443 if( !parts_over_there.empty() ) {
1444 //Just need one part from the square to track the x/y
1445 connected_parts.push_back( parts[parts_over_there[0]] );
1446 }
1447 }
1448
1449 /* If size = 0, it's the last part of the whole vehicle, so we're OK
1450 * If size = 1, it's one protruding part (i.e., bicycle wheel), so OK
1451 * Otherwise, it gets complicated... */
1452 if( connected_parts.size() > 1 ) {
1453
1454 /* We'll take connected_parts[0] to be the target part.
1455 * Every other part must have some path (that doesn't involve
1456 * the part about to be removed) to the target part, in order
1457 * for the part to be legally removable. */
1458 for( const auto &next_part : connected_parts ) {
1459 if( !is_connected( connected_parts[0], next_part, parts[p] ) ) {
1460 //Removing that part would break the vehicle in two
1461 reason = _( "Removing this part would split the vehicle." );
1462 return false;
1463 }
1464 }
1465
1466 }
1467
1468 }
1469 }
1470 //Anything not explicitly denied is permitted
1471 return true;
1472}
vehicle::is_connected
bool is_connected(const vehicle_part &to, const vehicle_part &from, const vehicle_part &excluded) const
Performs a breadth-first search from one part to another, to see if a path exists between the two wit...
Definition: vehicle.cpp:1484
vehicle_part::animal_flag

◆ charge_battery()

int vehicle::charge_battery ( int  amount,
bool  include_other_vehicles = true 
)

Try to charge our (and, optionally, connected vehicles') batteries by the given amount.

Returns
amount of charge left over.

Definition at line 5106 of file vehicle.cpp.

5107{
5108 // Key parts by percentage charge level.
5109 std::multimap<int, vehicle_part *> chargeable_parts;
5110 for( vehicle_part &p : parts ) {
5111 if( p.is_available() && p.is_battery() && p.ammo_capacity() > p.ammo_remaining() ) {
5112 chargeable_parts.insert( { ( p.ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p.ammo_capacity(), &p } );
5113 }
5114 }
5115 while( amount > 0 && !chargeable_parts.empty() ) {
5116 // Grab first part, charge until it reaches the next %, then re-insert with new % key.
5117 auto iter = chargeable_parts.begin();
5118 int charge_level = iter->first;
5119 vehicle_part *p = iter->second;
5120 chargeable_parts.erase( iter );
5121 // Calculate number of charges to reach the next %, but insure it's at least
5122 // one more than current charge.
5123 int next_charge_level = ( ( charge_level + 1 ) * p->ammo_capacity() ) / 100;
5124 next_charge_level = std::max( next_charge_level, p->ammo_remaining() + 1 );
5125 int qty = std::min( amount, next_charge_level - p->ammo_remaining() );
5126 p->ammo_set( fuel_type_battery, p->ammo_remaining() + qty );
5127 amount -= qty;
5128 if( p->ammo_capacity() > p->ammo_remaining() ) {
5129 chargeable_parts.insert( { ( p->ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p->ammo_capacity(), p } );
5130 }
5131 }
5132
5133 if( amount > 0 && include_other_vehicles ) {
5134 // still a bit of charge we could send out...
5135 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
5136 auto charge_veh = [&amount]( vehicle & veh ) {
5137 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHv: %d", amount );
5138 amount = veh.charge_battery( amount, false );
5139 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5140 };
5141 auto charge_grid = [&amount]( distribution_grid & grid ) {
5142 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHg: %d", amount );
5143 amount = grid.mod_resource( amount, false );
5144 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5145 };
5146 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, charge_veh, charge_grid );
5147 }
5148
5149
5150 return amount;
5151}

1528{
1529 // TODO: Make the vehicle "slide" towards its center of weight
1530 // when it's not properly supported

1532 if( pts.empty() ) {
1533 // Dirty vehicle with no parts
1534 is_falling = false;
1535 is_floating = false;
1536 in_water = false;
1537 is_flying = false;
1538 return;
1539 }
1540
1541 map &here = get_map();
1542 is_falling = here.has_zlevels();
1543
1544 if( is_flying && is_rotorcraft() ) {
1545 is_falling = false;
1546 } else {
1547 is_flying = false;
1548 }
1549
1550 size_t deep_water_tiles = 0;
1551 size_t water_tiles = 0;
1552 for( const tripoint &p : pts ) {
1553 if( is_falling ) {
1554 tripoint below( p.xy(), p.z - 1 );
1555 is_falling &= here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) &&
1556 ( p.z > -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) && !here.supports_above( below );
1557 }
1558 deep_water_tiles += here.has_flag( TFLAG_DEEP_WATER, p ) ? 1 : 0;
1559 water_tiles += here.has_flag( TFLAG_SWIMMABLE, p ) ? 1 : 0;
1560 }
1561 // floating if 2/3rds of the vehicle is in deep water
1562 is_floating = 3 * deep_water_tiles >= 2 * pts.size();
1563 // in_water if 1/2 of the vehicle is in water at all
1564 in_water = 2 * water_tiles >= pts.size();
1565}

◆ check_heli_descend()

bool vehicle::check_heli_descend ( player &  p)

can the helicopter descend/ascend here?

Definition at line 997 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

998{
999 if( !is_rotorcraft() ) {
1000 debugmsg( "A vehicle is somehow flying without being an aircraft" );
1001 return true;
1002 }
1003 int count = 0;
1004 int air_count = 0;
1005 map &here = get_map();
1006 for( const tripoint &pt : get_points( true ) ) {
1007 tripoint below( pt.xy(), pt.z - 1 );
1008 if( here.has_zlevels() && ( pt.z < -OVERMAP_DEPTH ||
1009 !here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, pt ) ) ) {
1010 p.add_msg_if_player( _( "You are already landed!" ) );
1011 return false;
1012 }
1013 const optional_vpart_position ovp = here.veh_at( below );
1014 if( here.impassable_ter_furn( below ) || here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_RAMP_DOWN, below ) ||
1015 ovp || g->critter_at( below ) ) {
1016 p.add_msg_if_player( m_bad,
1017 _( "It would be unsafe to try and land when there are obstacles below you." ) );
1018 return false;
1019 }
1020 if( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, below ) ) {
1021 air_count++;
1022 }
1023 count++;
1024 }
1025 if( velocity > 0 && air_count != count ) {
1026 p.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "It would be unsafe to try and land while you are moving." ) );
1027 return false;
1028 }
1029 return true;
1030
1031}

3175{
3176 point delta = to - from;
3177 if( abs( delta.x ) <= 1 && abs( delta.y ) <= 1 ) { //Just a normal move
3178 return true;
3179 }
3180
3181 if( !( ( abs( delta.x ) == 2 && abs( delta.y ) == 1 ) || ( abs( delta.x ) == 1 &&
3182 abs( delta.y ) == 2 ) ) ) { //Check that we're moving like a knight
3183 debugmsg( "Unexpected movement in rotated vehicle vector:%d,%d", delta.x, delta.y );
3184 return false;
3185 }
3186
3187 if( abs( delta.x ) == 2 ) { //Mostly horizontal move
3188 point t1 = from + point( delta.x / 2, delta.y );
3189 if( check( this, t1 ) ) {
3190 return true;
3191 }
3192
3193 point t2 = from + point( delta.x / 2, 0 );
3194 if( check( this, t2 ) ) {
3195 return true;
3196 }
3197
3198 } else { //Mostly vertical move
3199 point t1 = from + point( delta.x, delta.y / 2 );
3200 if( check( this, t1 ) ) {
3201 return true;
3202 }
3203
3204 point t2 = from + point( 0, delta.y / 2 );
3205 if( check( this, t2 ) ) {
3206 return true;
3207 }
3208 }
3209
3210 return false;
3211}

◆ coeff_air_drag()

double vehicle::coeff_air_drag ( ) const

Physical coefficients used for vehicle calculations.

coefficient of air drag in kg/m multiplied by the square of speed to calculate air drag force in N proportional to cross sectional area of the vehicle, times the density of air, times a dimensional constant based on the vehicle's shape

Definition at line 3969 of file vehicle.cpp.

3970{
3971 if( !coeff_air_dirty ) {
3972 return coefficient_air_resistance;
3973 }
3974 constexpr double c_air_base = 0.25;
3975 constexpr double c_air_mod = 0.1;
3976 constexpr double base_height = 1.4;
3977 constexpr double aisle_height = 0.6;
3978 constexpr double fullboard_height = 0.5;
3979 constexpr double roof_height = 0.1;
3980 constexpr double windmill_height = 0.7;
3981 constexpr double sail_height = 0.8;
3982 constexpr double rotor_height = 0.6;
3983
3984 std::vector<int> structure_indices = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
3985 int width = mount_max.y - mount_min.y + 1;
3986
3987 // a mess of lambdas to make the next bit slightly easier to read
3988 const auto d_exposed = [&]( const vehicle_part & p ) {
3989 // if it's not inside, it's a center location, and it doesn't need a roof, it's exposed
3990 if( p.info().location != part_location_center ) {
3991 return false;
3992 }
3993 return !( p.inside || p.info().has_flag( "NO_ROOF_NEEDED" ) ||
3994 p.info().has_flag( "WINDSHIELD" ) ||
3995 p.info().has_flag( "OPENABLE" ) );
3996 };
3997
3998 const auto d_protrusion = [&]( std::vector<int> parts_at ) {
3999 if( parts_at.size() > 1 ) {
4000 return false;
4001 } else {
4002 return parts[ parts_at.front() ].info().has_flag( "PROTRUSION" );
4003 }
4004 };
4005 const auto d_check_min = [&]( int &value, const vehicle_part & p, bool test ) {
4006 value = std::min( value, test ? p.mount.x - mount_min.x : maxrow );
4007 };
4008 const auto d_check_max = [&]( int &value, const vehicle_part & p, bool test ) {
4009 value = std::max( value, test ? p.mount.x - mount_min.x : minrow );
4010 };
4011
4012 // raycast down each column. the least drag vehicle has halfboard, windshield, seat with roof,
4013 // windshield, halfboard and is twice as long as it is wide.
4014 // find the first instance of each item and compare against the ideal configuration.
4015 std::vector<drag_column> drag( width );
4016 for( int p : structure_indices ) {
4017 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
4018 continue;
4019 }
4020 int col = parts[ p ].mount.y - mount_min.y;
4021 std::vector<int> parts_at = parts_at_relative( parts[ p ].mount, true );
4022 d_check_min( drag[ col ].pro, parts[ p ], d_protrusion( parts_at ) );
4023 for( int pa_index : parts_at ) {
4024 const vehicle_part &pa = parts[ pa_index ];
4025 d_check_max( drag[ col ].hboard, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "HALF_BOARD" ) );
4026 d_check_max( drag[ col ].fboard, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "FULL_BOARD" ) );
4027 d_check_max( drag[ col ].aisle, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "AISLE" ) );
4028 d_check_max( drag[ col ].shield, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WINDSHIELD" ) &&
4029 pa.is_available() );
4030 d_check_max( drag[ col ].seat, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "SEAT" ) ||
4031 pa.info().has_flag( "BED" ) );
4032 d_check_max( drag[ col ].turret, pa, pa.info().location == part_location_onroof &&
4033 !pa.info().has_flag( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) );
4034 d_check_max( drag[ col ].roof, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "ROOF" ) );
4035 d_check_max( drag[ col ].panel, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) );
4036 d_check_max( drag[ col ].windmill, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) );
4037 d_check_max( drag[ col ].rotor, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "ROTOR" ) );
4038 d_check_max( drag[ col ].sail, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "WIND_POWERED" ) );
4039 d_check_max( drag[ col ].exposed, pa, d_exposed( pa ) );
4040 d_check_min( drag[ col ].last, pa, pa.info().has_flag( "LOW_FINAL_AIR_DRAG" ) ||
4041 pa.info().has_flag( "HALF_BOARD" ) );
4042 }
4043 }
4044 double height = 0;
4045 double c_air_drag = 0;
4046 // tally the results of each row and prorate them relative to vehicle width
4047 for( drag_column &dc : drag ) {
4048 // even as m_debug you rarely want to see this
4049 // add_msg( m_debug, "veh %: pro %d, hboard %d, fboard %d, shield %d, seat %d, roof %d, aisle %d, turret %d, panel %d, exposed %d, last %d\n", name, dc.pro, dc.hboard, dc.fboard, dc.shield, dc.seat, dc.roof, dc.aisle, dc.turret, dc.panel, dc.exposed, dc.last );
4050
4051 double c_air_drag_c = c_air_base;
4052 // rams in front of the vehicle mildly worsens air drag
4053 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.pro > dc.hboard ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
4054 // not having halfboards in front of any windshields or fullboards moderately worsens
4055 // air drag
4056 c_air_drag_c += ( std::max( std::max( dc.hboard, dc.fboard ),
4057 dc.shield ) != dc.hboard ) ? 2 * c_air_mod : 0;
4058 // not having windshields in front of seats severely worsens air drag
4059 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.shield < dc.seat ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
4060 // missing roofs and open doors severely worsen air drag
4061 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.exposed > minrow ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
4062 // being twice as long as wide mildly reduces air drag
4063 c_air_drag_c -= ( 2 * ( mount_max.x - mount_min.x ) > width ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
4064 // trunk doors and halfboards at the tail mildly reduce air drag
4065 c_air_drag_c -= ( dc.last == mount_min.x ) ? c_air_mod : 0;
4066 // turrets severely worsen air drag
4067 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.turret > minrow ) ? 3 * c_air_mod : 0;
4068 // having a windmill is terrible for your drag
4069 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.windmill > minrow ) ? 5 * c_air_mod : 0;
4070 // rotors are not great for drag!
4071 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.rotor > minrow ) ? 6 * c_air_mod : 0;
4072 // having a sail is terrible for your drag
4073 c_air_drag_c += ( dc.sail > minrow ) ? 7 * c_air_mod : 0;
4074 c_air_drag += c_air_drag_c;
4075 // vehicles are 1.4m tall
4076 double c_height = base_height;
4077 // plus a bit for a roof
4078 c_height += ( dc.roof > minrow ) ? roof_height : 0;
4079 // plus a lot for an aisle
4080 c_height += ( dc.aisle > minrow ) ? aisle_height : 0;
4081 // or fullboards
4082 c_height += ( dc.fboard > minrow ) ? fullboard_height : 0;
4083 // and a little for anything on the roof
4084 c_height += ( dc.turret > minrow ) ? 2 * roof_height : 0;
4085 // solar panels are better than turrets or floodlights, though
4086 c_height += ( dc.panel > minrow ) ? roof_height : 0;
4087 // windmills are tall, too
4088 c_height += ( dc.windmill > minrow ) ? windmill_height : 0;
4089 c_height += ( dc.rotor > minrow ) ? rotor_height : 0;
4090 // sails are tall, too
4091 c_height += ( dc.sail > minrow ) ? sail_height : 0;
4092 height += c_height;
4093 }
4094 constexpr double air_density = 1.29; // kg/m^3
4095 // prorate per row height and c_air_drag
4096 height /= width;
4097 c_air_drag /= width;
4098 double cross_area = height * tile_to_width( width );
4099 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: height %3.2fm, width %3.2fm (%d tiles), c_air %3.2f\n", name, height,
4100 tile_to_width( width ), width, c_air_drag );
4101 // F_air_drag = c_air_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * air_density * v^2
4102 // coeff_air_resistance = c_air_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * air_density
4103 coefficient_air_resistance = std::max( 0.1, c_air_drag * cross_area * 0.5 * air_density );
4104 coeff_air_dirty = false;
4105 return coefficient_air_resistance;
4106}
achievement_comparison::last
@ last
vehicle::coefficient_air_resistance

◆ coeff_rolling_drag()

double vehicle::coeff_rolling_drag ( ) const

coefficient of rolling resistance multiplied by velocity to get the variable part of rolling resistance drag in N multiplied by a constant to get the constant part of rolling resistance drag in N depends on wheel design, wheel number, and vehicle weight

Definition at line 4108 of file vehicle.cpp.

4109{
4110 if( !coeff_rolling_dirty ) {
4111 return coefficient_rolling_resistance;
4112 }
4113 constexpr double wheel_ratio = 1.25;
4114 constexpr double base_wheels = 4.0;
4115 // SAE J2452 measurements are in F_rr = N * C_rr * 0.000225 * ( v + 33.33 )
4116 // Don't ask me why, but it's the numbers we have. We want N * C_rr * 0.000225 here,
4117 // and N is mass * accel from gravity (aka weight)
4118 constexpr double sae_ratio = 0.000225;
4119 constexpr double newton_ratio = GRAVITY_OF_EARTH * sae_ratio;
4120 double wheel_factor = 0;
4121 if( wheelcache.empty() ) {
4122 wheel_factor = 50;
4123 } else {
4124 // should really sum the each wheel's c_rolling_resistance * it's share of vehicle mass
4125 for( auto wheel : wheelcache ) {
4126 wheel_factor += parts[ wheel ].info().wheel_rolling_resistance();
4127 }
4128 // mildly increasing rolling resistance for vehicles with more than 4 wheels and mildly
4129 // decrease it for vehicles with less
4130 wheel_factor *= wheel_ratio /
4131 ( base_wheels * wheel_ratio - base_wheels + wheelcache.size() );
4132 }
4133 coefficient_rolling_resistance = newton_ratio * wheel_factor * to_kilogram( total_mass() );
4134 coeff_rolling_dirty = false;
4135 return coefficient_rolling_resistance;
4136}
vehicle::coefficient_rolling_resistance
double coefficient_rolling_resistance
Definition: vehicle.h:1784
vehicle::coeff_rolling_dirty
bool coeff_rolling_dirty
Definition: vehicle.h:1961

units::mass total_mass() const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:3306
units::to_kilogram
constexpr value_type to_kilogram(const quantity< value_type, mass_in_milligram_tag > &v)

◆ coeff_water_drag()

double vehicle::coeff_water_drag ( ) const

coefficient of water drag in kg/m multiplied by the square of speed to calculate water drag force in N proportional to cross sectional area of the vehicle, times the density of water, times a dimensional constant based on the vehicle's shape

Definition at line 4227 of file vehicle.cpp.

4228{
4229 if( !coeff_water_dirty ) {
4230 return coefficient_water_resistance;
4231 }
4232 std::vector<int> structure_indices = all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
4233 if( structure_indices.empty() ) {
4234 // huh?
4235 coeff_water_dirty = false;
4236 hull_height = 0.3;
4237 draft_m = 1.0;
4238 return 1250.0;
4239 }
4240 double hull_coverage = static_cast<double>( floating.size() ) / structure_indices.size();
4241
4242 int tile_width = mount_max.y - mount_min.y + 1;
4243 double width_m = tile_to_width( tile_width );
4244
4245 // actual area of the hull in m^2 (handles non-rectangular shapes)
4246 // footprint area in tiles = tile width * tile length
4247 // effective footprint percent = # of structure tiles / footprint area in tiles
4248 // actual hull area in m^2 = footprint percent * length in meters * width in meters
4249 // length in meters = length in tiles
4250 // actual area in m = # of structure tiles * length in tiles * width in meters /
4251 // ( length in tiles * width in tiles )
4252 // actual area in m = # of structure tiles * width in meters / width in tiles
4253 double actual_area_m = width_m * structure_indices.size() / tile_width;
4254
4255 // effective hull area is actual hull area * hull coverage
4256 double hull_area_m = actual_area_m * std::max( 0.1, hull_coverage );
4257 // Treat the hullform as a simple cuboid to calculate displaced depth of
4258 // water.
4259 // Apply Archimedes' principle (mass of water displaced is mass of vehicle).
4260 // area * depth = hull_volume = water_mass / water density
4261 // water_mass = vehicle_mass
4262 // area * depth = vehicle_mass / water_density
4263 // depth = vehicle_mass / water_density / area
4264 constexpr double water_density = 1000.0; // kg/m^3
4265 draft_m = to_kilogram( total_mass() ) / water_density / hull_area_m;
4266 // increase the streamlining as more of the boat is covered in boat boards
4267 double c_water_drag = 1.25 - hull_coverage;
4268 // hull height starts at 0.3m and goes up as you add more boat boards
4269 hull_height = 0.3 + 0.5 * hull_coverage;
4270 // F_water_drag = c_water_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * water_density * v^2
4271 // coeff_water_resistance = c_water_drag * cross_area * 1/2 * water_density
4272 coefficient_water_resistance = c_water_drag * width_m * draft_m * 0.5 * water_density;
4273 coeff_water_dirty = false;
4274 return coefficient_water_resistance;
4275}
vehicle::coefficient_water_resistance
double coefficient_water_resistance
Definition: vehicle.h:1785

◆ collision()

bool vehicle::collision ( std::vector< veh_collision > &  colls,
const tripoint &  dp,
bool  just_detect,
bool  bash_floor = false 
)

Definition at line 355 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

358{
359
360 /*
361 * Big TODO:
362 * Rewrite this function so that it has "pre-collision" phase (detection)
363 * and "post-collision" phase (applying damage).
364 * Then invoke the functions cyclically (pre-post-pre-post-...) until
365 * velocity == 0 or no collision happens.
366 * Make all post-collisions in a given phase use the same momentum.
367 *
368 * How it works right now: find the first obstacle, then ram it over and over
369 * until either the obstacle is removed or the vehicle stops.
370 * Bug: when ramming a critter without enough force to send it flying,
371 * the vehicle will phase into it.
372 */
373
374 if( dp.z != 0 && ( dp.x != 0 || dp.y != 0 ) ) {
375 // Split into horizontal + vertical
376 return collision( colls, tripoint( dp.xy(), 0 ), just_detect, bash_floor ) ||
377 collision( colls, tripoint( 0, 0, dp.z ), just_detect, bash_floor );
378 }
379
380 if( dp.z == -1 && !bash_floor ) {
381 // First check current level, then the one below if current had no collisions
382 // Bash floors on the current one, but not on the one below.
383 if( collision( colls, tripoint_zero, just_detect, true ) ) {
384 return true;
385 }
386 }
387
388 const bool vertical = bash_floor || dp.z != 0;
389 const int &coll_velocity = vertical ? vertical_velocity : velocity;
390 // Skip collisions when there is no apparent movement, except verticially moving rotorcraft.
391 if( coll_velocity == 0 && !is_rotorcraft() ) {
392 just_detect = true;
393 }
394
395 const int velocity_before = coll_velocity;
396 int lowest_velocity = coll_velocity;
397 const int sign_before = sgn( velocity_before );
398 bool empty = true;
399 for( int p = 0; static_cast<size_t>( p ) < parts.size(); p++ ) {
400 const vpart_info &info = part_info( p );
401 if( ( info.location != part_location_structure && info.rotor_diameter() == 0 ) ||
402 parts[ p ].removed ) {
403 continue;
404 }
405 empty = false;
406 // Coordinates of where part will go due to movement (dx/dy/dz)
407 // and turning (precalc[1])
408 const tripoint dsp = global_pos3() + dp + parts[p].precalc[1];
409 veh_collision coll = part_collision( p, dsp, just_detect, bash_floor );
410 if( coll.type == veh_coll_nothing ) {
411 continue;
412 }
413
414 colls.push_back( coll );
415
416 if( just_detect ) {
417 // DO insert the first collision so we can tell what was it
418 return true;
419 }
420
421 const int velocity_after = coll_velocity;
422 // A hack for falling vehicles: restore the velocity so that it hits at full force everywhere
423 // TODO: Make this more elegant
424 if( vertical ) {
425 if( velocity_before < 0 ) {
426 lowest_velocity = std::max( lowest_velocity, coll_velocity );
427 } else {
428 lowest_velocity = std::min( lowest_velocity, coll_velocity );
429 }
430 vertical_velocity = velocity_before;
431 } else if( sgn( velocity_after ) != sign_before ) {
432 // Sign of velocity inverted, collisions would be in wrong direction
433 break;
434 }
435 }
436
437 if( vertical ) {
438 vertical_velocity = lowest_velocity;
439 if( vertical_velocity == 0 ) {
440 is_falling = false;
441 }
442 }
443
444 if( empty ) {
445 // HACK: Hack for dirty vehicles that didn't yet get properly removed
446 veh_collision fake_coll;
447 fake_coll.type = veh_coll_other;
448 colls.push_back( fake_coll );
449 velocity = 0;
450 vertical_velocity = 0;
451 add_msg( m_debug, "Collision check on a dirty vehicle %s", name );
452 return true;
453 }
454
455 return !colls.empty();
456}

4605 // But only if the player is actually there!

4615 // more pedaling = more power
4616 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( muscle.fuel_energy() ) * bid->fuel_efficiency *
4617 ( load / 1000 ) );
4618 mod += eff_load / 5;
4619 } else { // passive power gen
4620 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( muscle.fuel_energy() ) * bid->passive_fuel_efficiency *
4621 ( load / 1000 ) );
4622 mod += eff_load / 10;
4623 }
4624 }
4625 // decreased stamina burn scalable with load
4626 if( g->u.has_active_bionic( bio_jointservo ) ) {
4627 g->u.mod_power_level( units::from_kilojoule( -std::max( eff_load / 20, 1 ) ) );
4628 mod -= std::max( eff_load / 5, 5 );
4629 }
4630 if( one_in( 1000 / load ) && one_in( 10 ) ) {
4631 g->u.mod_stored_kcal( -10 );
4632 g->u.mod_thirst( 1 );
4633 g->u.mod_fatigue( 1 );
4634 }
4635 g->u.mod_stamina( -( base_burn + mod ) );
4636 add_msg( m_debug, "Load: %d", load );
4637 add_msg( m_debug, "Mod: %d", mod );
4638 add_msg( m_debug, "Burn: %d", -( base_burn + mod ) );

177{
178 const auto door_motors = get_avail_parts( "DOOR_MOTOR" );
179 // Indices of doors
180 std::vector< int > doors_with_motors;
181 // Locations used to display the doors
182 std::vector< tripoint > locations;
183 // it is possible to have one door to open and one to close for single motor
184 if( empty( door_motors ) ) {
185 debugmsg( "vehicle::control_doors called but no door motors found" );
186 return;
187 }
188
189 uilist pmenu;
190 pmenu.title = _( "Select door to toggle" );
191 for( const vpart_reference &vp : door_motors ) {
192 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
193 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ) {
194 continue;
195 }
196 const std::array<int, 2> doors = { { next_part_to_open( p ), next_part_to_close( p ) } };
197 for( int door : doors ) {
198 if( door == -1 ) {
199 continue;
200 }
201
202 int val = doors_with_motors.size();
203 doors_with_motors.push_back( door );
204 locations.push_back( global_part_pos3( p ) );
205 const char *actname = parts[door].open ? _( "Close" ) : _( "Open" );
206 pmenu.addentry( val, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN, "%s %s", actname, parts[ door ].name() );
207 }
208 }
209
210 pmenu.addentry( doors_with_motors.size() + OPENCURTAINS, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN,
211 _( "Open all curtains" ) );
212 pmenu.addentry( doors_with_motors.size() + OPENBOTH, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN,
213 _( "Open all curtains and doors" ) );
214 pmenu.addentry( doors_with_motors.size() + CLOSEDOORS, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN,
215 _( "Close all doors" ) );
216 pmenu.addentry( doors_with_motors.size() + CLOSEBOTH, true, MENU_AUTOASSIGN,
217 _( "Close all curtains and doors" ) );
218
219 pointmenu_cb callback( locations );
220 pmenu.callback = &callback;
221 // Move the menu so that we can see our vehicle
222 pmenu.w_y_setup = 0;
223 pmenu.query();
224
225 if( pmenu.ret >= 0 ) {
226 if( pmenu.ret < static_cast<int>( doors_with_motors.size() ) ) {
227 int part = doors_with_motors[pmenu.ret];
228 open_or_close( part, !( parts[part].open ) );
229 } else if( pmenu.ret < ( static_cast<int>( doors_with_motors.size() ) + CANCEL ) ) {
230 int option = pmenu.ret - static_cast<int>( doors_with_motors.size() );
231 bool open = option == OPENBOTH || option == OPENCURTAINS;
232 for( const vpart_reference &vp : door_motors ) {
233 const size_t motor = vp.part_index();
234 int next_part = -1;
235 if( open ) {
236 int part = next_part_to_open( motor );
237 if( part != -1 ) {
238 if( !part_flag( part, "CURTAIN" ) && option == OPENCURTAINS ) {
239 continue;
240 }
241 open_or_close( part, open );
242 if( option == OPENBOTH ) {
243 next_part = next_part_to_open( motor );
244 }
245 if( next_part != -1 ) {
246 open_or_close( next_part, open );
247 }
248 }
249 } else {
250 int part = next_part_to_close( motor );
251 if( part != -1 ) {
252 if( part_flag( part, "CURTAIN" ) && option == CLOSEDOORS ) {
253 continue;
254 }
255 open_or_close( part, open );
256 if( option == CLOSEBOTH ) {
257 next_part = next_part_to_close( motor );
258 }
259 if( next_part != -1 ) {
260 open_or_close( next_part, open );
261 }
262 }
263 }
264 }
265 }
266 }

◆ control_electronics()

◆ control_engines()

void vehicle::control_engines ( )

Definition at line 372 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

373{
374 int e_toggle = 0;
375 //count active engines
376 const int fuel_count = std::accumulate( engines.begin(), engines.end(), int{0},
377 [&]( int acc, int e ) {
378 return acc + static_cast<int>( part_info( e ).engine_fuel_opts().size() );
379 } );
380
381 const auto adjust_engine = [this]( int e_toggle ) {
382 int i = 0;
383 for( int e : engines ) {
384 for( const itype_id &fuel : part_info( e ).engine_fuel_opts() ) {
385 if( i == e_toggle ) {
386 if( parts[ e ].fuel_current() == fuel ) {
387 toggle_specific_part( e, !is_part_on( e ) );
388 } else {
389 parts[ e ].fuel_set( fuel );
390 }
391 return;
392 }
393 i++;
394 }
395 }
396 };
397
398 //show menu until user finishes
399 bool dirty = false;
400 do {
401 e_toggle = select_engine();
402 if( e_toggle < 0 || e_toggle >= fuel_count ) {
403 break;
404 }
405 dirty = true;
406 adjust_engine( e_toggle );
407 } while( e_toggle < fuel_count );
408
409 if( !dirty ) {
410 return;
411 }
412
413 const bool engines_were_on = engine_on;
414 for( int e : engines ) {
415 engine_on |= is_part_on( e );
416 }
417
418 // if current velocity greater than new configuration safe speed
419 // drop down cruise velocity.
420 int safe_vel = safe_velocity();
421 if( velocity > safe_vel ) {
422 cruise_velocity = safe_vel;
423 }
424
425 if( engines_were_on && !engine_on ) {
426 add_msg( _( "You turn off the %s's engines to change their configurations." ), name );
427 } else if( !g->u.controlling_vehicle ) {
428 add_msg( _( "You change the %s's engine configuration." ), name );
429 }
430
431 if( engine_on ) {
432 start_engines();
433 }
434}

◆ cruise_thrust()

void vehicle::cruise_thrust ( int  amount)

Definition at line 286 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

287{
288 if( amount == 0 ) {
289 return;
290 }
291 int safe_vel = safe_velocity();
292 int max_vel = autopilot_on ? safe_velocity() : max_velocity();
293 int max_rev_vel = max_reverse_velocity();
294
295 //if the safe velocity is between the cruise velocity and its next value, set to safe velocity
296 if( ( cruise_velocity < safe_vel && safe_vel < ( cruise_velocity + amount ) ) ||
297 ( cruise_velocity > safe_vel && safe_vel > ( cruise_velocity + amount ) ) ) {
298 cruise_velocity = safe_vel;
299 } else {
300 if( amount < 0 && ( cruise_velocity == safe_vel || cruise_velocity == max_vel ) ) {
301 // If coming down from safe_velocity or max_velocity decrease by one so
302 // the rounding below will drop velocity to a multiple of amount.
303 cruise_velocity += -1;
304 } else if( amount > 0 && cruise_velocity == max_rev_vel ) {
305 // If increasing from max_rev_vel, do the opposite.
306 cruise_velocity += 1;
307 } else {
308 // Otherwise just add the amount.
309 cruise_velocity += amount;
310 }
311 // Integer round to lowest multiple of amount.
312 // The result is always equal to the original or closer to zero,
313 // even if negative
314 cruise_velocity = ( cruise_velocity / std::abs( amount ) ) * std::abs( amount );
315 }
316 // Can't have a cruise speed faster than max speed
317 // or reverse speed faster than max reverse speed.
318 if( cruise_velocity > max_vel ) {
319 cruise_velocity = max_vel;
320 } else if( cruise_velocity < max_rev_vel ) {
321 cruise_velocity = max_rev_vel;
322 }
323}
vehicle::max_velocity
int max_velocity(bool fueled=true) const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:3723

bool autopilot_on
Definition: vehicle.h:1997
vehicle::max_reverse_velocity

6364{
6365 if( dmg < 1 ) {
6366 return dmg;
6367 }
6368
6369 std::vector<int> pl = parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
6370 if( pl.empty() ) {
6371 // We ran out of non removed parts at this location already.
6372 return dmg;
6373 }
6374
6375 if( !aimed ) {
6376 bool found_obs = false;
6377 for( auto &i : pl ) {
6378 if( part_flag( i, "OBSTACLE" ) &&
6379 ( !part_flag( i, "OPENABLE" ) || !parts[i].open ) ) {
6380 found_obs = true;
6381 break;
6382 }
6383 }
6384
6385 if( !found_obs ) { // not aimed at this tile and no obstacle here -- fly through
6386 return dmg;
6387 }
6388 }
6389
6390 int target_part = part_info( p ).rotor_diameter() ? p : random_entry( pl );
6391
6392 // door motor mechanism is protected by closed doors
6393 if( part_flag( target_part, "DOOR_MOTOR" ) ) {
6394 // find the most strong openable that is not open
6395 int strongest_door_part = -1;
6396 int strongest_door_durability = INT_MIN;
6397 for( int part : pl ) {
6398 if( part_flag( part, "OPENABLE" ) && !parts[part].open ) {
6399 int door_durability = part_info( part ).durability;
6400 if( door_durability > strongest_door_durability ) {
6401 strongest_door_part = part;
6402 strongest_door_durability = door_durability;
6403 }
6404 }
6405 }
6406
6407 // if we found a closed door, target it instead of the door_motor
6408 if( strongest_door_part != -1 ) {
6409 target_part = strongest_door_part;
6410 }
6411 }
6412
6413 int damage_dealt;
6414
6415 int armor_part = part_with_feature( p, "ARMOR", true );
6416 if( armor_part < 0 ) {
6417 // Not covered by armor -- damage part
6418 damage_dealt = damage_direct( target_part, dmg, type );
6419 } else {
6420 // Covered by armor -- hit both armor and part, but reduce damage by armor's reduction
6421 int protection = part_info( armor_part ).damage_reduction[ type ];
6422 // Parts on roof aren't protected
6423 bool overhead = part_flag( target_part, "ROOF" ) || part_info( target_part ).location == "on_roof";
6424 // Calling damage_direct may remove the damaged part
6425 // completely, therefore the other index (target_part) becomes
6426 // wrong if target_part > armor_part.
6427 // Damaging the part with the higher index first is save,
6428 // as removing a part only changes indices after the
6429 // removed part.
6430 if( armor_part < target_part ) {
6431 damage_direct( target_part, overhead ? dmg : dmg - protection, type );
6432 damage_dealt = damage_direct( armor_part, dmg, type );
6433 } else {
6434 damage_dealt = damage_direct( armor_part, dmg, type );
6435 damage_direct( target_part, overhead ? dmg : dmg - protection, type );
6436 }
6437 }
6438
6439 return damage_dealt;
6440}

2633 move.init( units::from_degrees( mdir ) );
2634 data.read( "name", name );
2635 std::string temp_id;
2636 std::string temp_old_id;
2637 data.read( "owner", temp_id );
2638 data.read( "old_owner", temp_old_id );
2639 // for savegames before the change to faction_id for ownership.
2640 if( temp_id.empty() ) {
2641 owner = faction_id::NULL_ID();
2642 } else {
2643 owner = faction_id( temp_id );
2644 }
2645 if( temp_old_id.empty() ) {
2646 old_owner = faction_id::NULL_ID();
2647 } else {
2648 old_owner = faction_id( temp_old_id );
2649 }
2650 data.read( "theft_time", theft_time );
2651
2652 data.read( "parts", parts );
2653 // we persist the pivot anchor so that if the rules for finding
2654 // the pivot change, existing vehicles do not shift around.
2655 // Loading vehicles that predate the pivot logic is a special
2656 // case of this, they will load with an anchor of (0,0) which
2657 // is what they're expecting.
2658 data.read( "pivot", pivot_anchor[0] );
2659 pivot_anchor[1] = pivot_anchor[0];
2660 pivot_rotation[1] = pivot_rotation[0] = fdir_angle;
2661 data.read( "is_following", is_following );
2662 data.read( "is_patrolling", is_patrolling );
2663 data.read( "autodrive_local_target", autodrive_local_target );
2664 data.read( "summon_time_limit", summon_time_limit );
2665 data.read( "magic", magic );
2666
2667 // Loose items -> count-by-charges migration
2668 for( vehicle_part &part : parts ) {
2669 to_cbc_migration::migrate( part.items );
2670 }
2671
2672 // Need to manually backfill the active item cache since the part loader can't call its vehicle.
2673 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_any_parts( VPFLAG_CARGO ) ) {
2674 auto it = vp.part().items.begin();
2675 auto end = vp.part().items.end();
2676 for( ; it != end; ++it ) {
2677 if( it->needs_processing() ) {
2678 active_items.add( *it, vp.mount() );
2679 }
2680 }
2681 }
2682
2683 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_any_parts( "TURRET" ) ) {
2684 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "turret_mount" ), false );
2685
2686 //Forcibly set turrets' targeting mode to manual if no turret control unit is present on turret's tile on loading save
2687 if( !has_part( global_part_pos3( vp.part() ), "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
2688 vp.part().enabled = false;
2689 }
2690 //Set turret control unit's state equal to turret's targeting mode on loading save
2691 for( const vpart_reference &turret_part : get_any_parts( "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
2692 turret_part.part().enabled = vp.part().enabled;
2693 }
2694 }
2695
2696 // Add vehicle mounts to cars that are missing them.
2697 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_any_parts( "NEEDS_WHEEL_MOUNT_LIGHT" ) ) {
2698 if( vp.info().has_flag( "STEERABLE" ) ) {
2699 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "wheel_mount_light_steerable" ), false );
2700 } else {
2701 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "wheel_mount_light" ), false );
2702 }
2703 }
2704 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_any_parts( "NEEDS_WHEEL_MOUNT_MEDIUM" ) ) {
2705 if( vp.info().has_flag( "STEERABLE" ) ) {
2706 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "wheel_mount_medium_steerable" ), false );
2707 } else {
2708 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "wheel_mount_medium" ), false );
2709 }
2710 }
2711 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_any_parts( "NEEDS_WHEEL_MOUNT_HEAVY" ) ) {
2712 if( vp.info().has_flag( "STEERABLE" ) ) {
2713 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "wheel_mount_heavy_steerable" ), false );
2714 } else {
2715 install_part( vp.mount(), vpart_id( "wheel_mount_heavy" ), false );
2716 }
2717 }
2718
2719 /* After loading, check if the vehicle is from the old rules and is missing
2720 * frames. */
2721 if( savegame_loading_version < 11 ) {
2722 add_missing_frames();
2723 }
2724
2725 // Handle steering changes
2726 if( savegame_loading_version < 25 ) {
2727 add_steerable_wheels();
2728 }
2729
2730 refresh();
2731
2732 data.read( "tags", tags );
2733 data.read( "labels", labels );
2734
2735 point p;
2736 zone_data zd;
2737 for( JsonObject sdata : data.get_array( "zones" ) ) {
2738 sdata.allow_omitted_members();
2739 sdata.read( "point", p );
2740 sdata.read( "zone", zd );
2741 loot_zones.emplace( p, zd );
2742 }
2743 data.read( "other_tow_point", tow_data.other_towing_point );
2744 // Note that it's possible for a vehicle to be loaded midway
2745 // through a turn if the player is driving REALLY fast and their
2746 // own vehicle motion takes them in range. An undefined value for
2747 // on_turn caused occasional weirdness if the undefined value
2748 // happened to be positive.
2749 //
2750 // Setting it to zero means it won't get to move until the start
2751 // of the next turn, which is what happens anyway if it gets
2752 // loaded anywhere but midway through a driving cycle.
2753 //
2754 // Something similar to vehicle::gain_moves() would be ideal, but
2755 // that can't be used as it currently stands because it would also
2756 // make it instantly fire all its turrets upon load.
2757 of_turn = 0;
2758
2759 /** Legacy saved games did not store part enabled status within parts */
2760 const auto set_legacy_state = [&]( const std::string & var, const std::string & flag ) {
2761 if( data.get_bool( var, false ) ) {
2762 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_any_parts( flag ) ) {
2763 vp.part().enabled = true;
2764 }
2765 }
2766 };
2767
2768 set_legacy_state( "stereo_on", "STEREO" );
2769 set_legacy_state( "chimes_on", "CHIMES" );
2770 set_legacy_state( "fridge_on", "FRIDGE" );
2771 set_legacy_state( "reaper_on", "REAPER" );
2772 set_legacy_state( "planter_on", "PLANTER" );
2773 set_legacy_state( "recharger_on", "RECHARGE" );
2774 set_legacy_state( "scoop_on", "SCOOP" );
2775 set_legacy_state( "plow_on", "PLOW" );
2776 set_legacy_state( "reactor_on", "REACTOR" );
2777}

◆ discharge_battery()

int vehicle::discharge_battery ( int  amount,
bool  recurse = true 
)

Try to discharge our (and, optionally, connected vehicles') batteries by the given amount.

Returns
amount of request unfulfilled (0 if totally successful).

Definition at line 5153 of file vehicle.cpp.

5154{
5155 // Key parts by percentage charge level.
5156 std::multimap<int, vehicle_part *> dischargeable_parts;
5157 for( vehicle_part &p : parts ) {
5158 if( p.is_available() && p.is_battery() && p.ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
5159 dischargeable_parts.insert( { ( p.ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p.ammo_capacity(), &p } );
5160 }
5161 }
5162 while( amount > 0 && !dischargeable_parts.empty() ) {
5163 // Grab first part, discharge until it reaches the next %, then re-insert with new % key.
5164 auto iter = std::prev( dischargeable_parts.end() );
5165 int charge_level = iter->first;
5166 vehicle_part *p = iter->second;
5167 dischargeable_parts.erase( iter );
5168 // Calculate number of charges to reach the previous %.
5169 int prev_charge_level = ( ( charge_level - 1 ) * p->ammo_capacity() ) / 100;
5170 prev_charge_level = std::max( 0, prev_charge_level );
5171 int amount_to_discharge = std::min( p->ammo_remaining() - prev_charge_level, amount );
5172 p->ammo_consume( amount_to_discharge, global_part_pos3( *p ) );
5173 amount -= amount_to_discharge;
5174 if( p->ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
5175 dischargeable_parts.insert( { ( p->ammo_remaining() * 100 ) / p->ammo_capacity(), p } );
5176 }
5177 }
5178
5179 if( amount > 0 && recurse ) {
5180 // need more power!
5181 using tvr = distribution_graph::traverse_visitor_result;
5182 auto discharge_vehicle = [&amount]( vehicle & veh ) {
5183 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHv: %d", amount );
5184 amount = veh.discharge_battery( amount, false );
5185 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5186 };
5187 auto discharge_grid = [&amount]( distribution_grid & grid ) {
5188 g->u.add_msg_if_player( m_debug, "CHg: %d", amount );
5189 amount = -grid.mod_resource( -amount, false );
5190 return amount > 0 ? tvr::continue_further : tvr::stop;
5191 };
5192 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, discharge_vehicle, discharge_grid );
5193 }
5194
5195 return amount; // non-zero if we weren't able to fulfill demand.
5196}

int ammo_consume(int qty, const tripoint &pos)
Consume fuel, charges or ammunition (if available)

◆ do_autodrive()

autodrive_result vehicle::do_autodrive ( Character &  driver)

Definition at line 1205 of file vehicle_autodrive.cpp.

1206{
1207 if( !is_autodriving ) {
1208 return autodrive_result::abort;
1209 }
1210 if( !player_in_control( driver ) || skidding ) {
1211 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You lose control as the vehicle starts skidding." ) );
1212 stop_autodriving( false );
1213 return autodrive_result::abort;
1214 }
1215 const tripoint_abs_ms veh_pos = global_square_location();
1216 const tripoint_abs_omt veh_omt = project_to<coords::omt>( veh_pos );
1217 std::vector<tripoint_abs_omt> &omt_path = driver.omt_path;
1218 if( !omt_path.empty() && veh_omt == omt_path.back() ) {
1219 omt_path.pop_back();
1220 }
1221 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
1222 stop_autodriving( false );
1223 return autodrive_result::finished;
1224 }
1225 if( !active_autodrive_controller ) {
1226 active_autodrive_controller = std::make_shared<autodrive_controller>( *this, driver );
1227 }
1228 if( &active_autodrive_controller->get_driver() != &driver ) {
1229 debugmsg( "Driver changed while auto-driving" );
1230 stop_autodriving();
1231 return autodrive_result::abort;
1232 }
1233 active_autodrive_controller->check_safe_speed();
1234 cata::optional<navigation_step> next_step = active_autodrive_controller->compute_next_step();
1235 if( !next_step ) {
1236 // message handles pathfinding failure either due to obstacles or inability to see
1237 driver.add_msg_if_player( _( "Can't see a path forward." ) );
1238 stop_autodriving( false );
1239 return autodrive_result::abort;
1240 }
1241 if( next_step->pos != veh_pos ) {
1242 debugmsg( "compute_next_step returned an invalid result" );
1243 stop_autodriving();
1244 return autodrive_result::abort;
1245 }
1246 if( next_step->target_speed_tps == 0 && velocity == 0 ) {
1247 stop_autodriving( false );
1248 return autodrive_result::finished;
1249 }
1250 cruise_on = true;
1251 cruise_velocity = next_step->target_speed_tps * VMIPH_PER_TPS;
1252
1253 // check for collisions before we steer, since steering may end our turn
1254 // which would cause the vehicle to move and maybe crash
1255 switch( active_autodrive_controller->check_collision_zone( next_step->steering_dir ) ) {
1256 case collision_check_result::no_visibility:
1257 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You can't see anything in front of your vehicle!" ) );
1258 stop_autodriving();
1259 return autodrive_result::abort;
1260 case collision_check_result::close_obstacle:
1261 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You're about to crash into something!" ) );
1262 stop_autodriving( false );
1263 return autodrive_result::abort;
1264 case collision_check_result::slow_down:
1265 active_autodrive_controller->reduce_speed();
1266 if( cruise_velocity > VMIPH_PER_TPS ) {
1267 cruise_velocity = VMIPH_PER_TPS;
1268 }
1269 break;
1270 case collision_check_result::ok:
1271 break;
1272 }
1273
1274 int turn_delta = orientation_diff( next_step->steering_dir, to_orientation( turn_dir ) );
1275 // pldrive() does not handle steering multiple times in one call correctly
1276 // call it multiple times, matching how a player controls the vehicle
1277 for( int i = 0; i < std::abs( turn_delta ); i++ ) {
1278 if( driver.moves <= 0 ) {
1279 // we couldn't steer as many times as we wanted to but there's
1280 // nothing we can do about it now, hope we don't crash!
1281 break;
1282 }
1283 pldrive( driver, { signum( turn_delta ), 0 } );
1284 }
1285 // Don't do anything else below; the driver's turn may be over (moves <= 0) so
1286 // any extra actions would be "cheating".
1287
1288 return autodrive_result::ok;
1289}
