◆ do_towing_move()

void vehicle::do_towing_move ( )

Definition at line 5935 of file vehicle.cpp.

5936{
5937 if( !no_towing_slack() || velocity <= 0 ) {
5938 return;
5939 }
5940 bool invalidate = false;
5941 if( !tow_data.get_towed() ) {
5942 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but no towed vehicle!" );
5943 invalidate = true;
5944 }
5945 const int tow_index = get_tow_part();
5946 if( tow_index == -1 ) {
5947 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but no tow part" );
5948 invalidate = true;
5949 }
5950 vehicle *towed_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
5951 if( !towed_veh ) {
5952 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move, but towed vehicle dosnt exist." );
5953 invalidate_towing();
5954 return;
5955 }
5956 const int other_tow_index = towed_veh->get_tow_part();
5957 if( other_tow_index == -1 ) {
5958 debugmsg( "tried to do towing move but towed vehicle has no towing part" );
5959 invalidate = true;
5960 }
5961 if( towed_veh->global_pos3().z != global_pos3().z ) {
5962 // how the hellicopter did this happen?
5963 // yes, this can happen when towing over a bridge (see #47293)
5964 invalidate = true;
5965 add_msg( m_info, _( "A towing cable snaps off of %s." ), tow_data.get_towed()->disp_name() );
5966 }
5967 if( invalidate ) {
5968 invalidate_towing( true );
5969 return;
5970 }
5971 const tripoint tower_tow_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( tow_index ) );
5972 const tripoint towed_tow_point = g->m.getabs( towed_veh->global_part_pos3( other_tow_index ) );
5973 // same as above, but where the pulling vehicle is pulling from
5974 units::angle towing_veh_angle = towed_veh->get_angle_from_targ( tower_tow_point );
5975 const bool reverse = towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_BACK;
5976 int accel_y = 0;
5977 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
5978 int turn_x = get_turn_from_angle( towing_veh_angle, vehpos, tower_tow_point, reverse );
5979 if( rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) < 6 ) {
5980 accel_y = reverse ? -1 : 1;
5981 }
5982 if( towed_veh->velocity <= velocity && rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) >= 7 ) {
5983 accel_y = reverse ? 1 : -1;
5984 }
5985 if( rl_dist( towed_tow_point, tower_tow_point ) >= 12 ) {
5986 towed_veh->velocity = velocity * 1.8;
5987 if( reverse ) {
5988 towed_veh->velocity = -towed_veh->velocity;
5989 }
5990 } else {
5991 towed_veh->velocity = reverse ? -velocity : velocity;
5992 }
5993 if( towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_FRONT ) {
5994 towed_veh->selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
5995 } else if( towed_veh->tow_data.tow_direction == TOW_BACK ) {
5996 accel_y = 10;
5997 towed_veh->selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
5998 } else {
5999 towed_veh->skidding = true;
6000 std::vector<tripoint> lineto = line_to( g->m.getlocal( towed_tow_point ),
6001 g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ) );
6002 tripoint nearby_destination;
6003 if( lineto.size() >= 2 ) {
6004 nearby_destination = lineto[1];
6005 } else {
6006 nearby_destination = tower_tow_point;
6007 }
6008 const int destination_delta_x = g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ).x - nearby_destination.x;
6009 const int destination_delta_y = g->m.getlocal( tower_tow_point ).y - nearby_destination.y;
6010 const int destination_delta_z = towed_veh->global_pos3().z;
6011 const tripoint move_destination( clamp( destination_delta_x, -1, 1 ),
6012 clamp( destination_delta_y, -1, 1 ),
6013 clamp( destination_delta_z, -1, 1 ) );
6014 g->m.move_vehicle( *towed_veh, move_destination, towed_veh->face );
6015 towed_veh->move = tileray( point( destination_delta_x, destination_delta_y ) );
6016 }
6017
6018}

◆ drain() [1/2]

int vehicle::drain ( const itype_id &  ftype,
int  amount 
)

Definition at line 3426 of file vehicle.cpp.

3427{
3428 if( ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
3429 // Batteries get special handling to take advantage of jumper
3430 // cables -- discharge_battery knows how to recurse properly
3431 // (including taking cable power loss into account).
3432 int remnant = discharge_battery( amount, true );
3433
3434 // discharge_battery returns amount of charges that were not
3435 // found anywhere in the power network, whereas this function
3436 // returns amount of charges consumed; simple subtraction.
3437 return amount - remnant;
3438 }
3439
3440 int drained = 0;
3441 for( auto &p : parts ) {
3442 if( amount <= 0 ) {
3443 break;
3444 }
3445 if( p.ammo_current() == ftype ) {
3446 int qty = p.ammo_consume( amount, global_part_pos3( p ) );
3447 drained += qty;
3448 amount -= qty;
3449 }
3450 }
3451
3452 invalidate_mass();
3453 return drained;
3454}

◆ drain_energy()

double vehicle::drain_energy ( const itype_id &  ftype,
double  energy_j 
)

Consumes enough fuel by energy content.

Does not support cable draining.

Parameters
ftypeType of fuel
energy_jDesired amount of energy of fuel to consume
Returns
Amount of energy actually consumed. May be more or less than energy.

Definition at line 4551 of file vehicle.cpp.

4552{
4553 // Consumption of battery power is done differently.
4554 // From all batteries at once and doesn't change mass.
4555 if( ftype == fuel_type_battery ) {
4556 // Batteries stored in kilojoules
4557 const int total_kj_to_drain = static_cast<int>( energy_j / 1000.0 );
4558 if( total_kj_to_drain <= 0 ) {
4559 return 0.0;
4560 }
4561 const int not_fulfilled = discharge_battery( total_kj_to_drain );
4562 return static_cast<double>( total_kj_to_drain - not_fulfilled ) * 1000.0;
4563 }
4564
4565 double drained = 0.0f;
4566 for( auto &p : parts ) {
4567 if( energy_j <= 0.0f ) {
4568 break;
4569 }
4570
4571 const double consumed = p.consume_energy( ftype, energy_j );
4572 drained += consumed;
4573 energy_j -= consumed;
4574 }
4575
4576 invalidate_mass();
4577 return drained;
4578}

817{
818 if( follow_protocol && g->u.in_vehicle ) {
819 stop_autodriving();
820 return;
821 }
822 refresh();
823 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
824 units::angle angle = get_angle_from_targ( target );
825 // now we got the angle to the target, we can work out when we are heading towards disaster.
826 // Check the tileray in the direction we need to head towards.
827 std::set<point> points_to_check = immediate_path( angle );
828 bool stop = false;
829 for( const point &pt_elem : points_to_check ) {
830 point elem = g->m.getlocal( pt_elem );
831 if( stop ) {
832 break;
833 }
834 const optional_vpart_position ovp = g->m.veh_at( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) );
835 if( g->m.impassable_ter_furn( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) ) || ( ovp &&
836 &ovp->vehicle() != this ) ) {
837 stop = true;
838 break;
839 }
840 if( elem == g->u.pos().xy() ) {
841 if( follow_protocol || g->u.in_vehicle ) {
842 continue;
843 } else {
844 stop = true;
845 break;
846 }
847 }
848 bool its_a_pet = false;
849 if( g->critter_at( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) ) ) {
850 npc *guy = g->critter_at<npc>( tripoint( elem, sm_pos.z ) );
851 if( guy && !guy->in_vehicle ) {
852 stop = true;
853 break;
854 }
855 for( const auto &p : parts ) {
856 monster *mon = get_pet( index_of_part( &p ) );
857 if( mon && mon->pos().xy() == elem ) {
858 its_a_pet = true;
859 break;
860 }
861 }
862 if( !its_a_pet ) {
863 stop = true;
864 break;
865 }
866 }
867 }
868 if( stop ) {
869 if( autopilot_on ) {
870 sounds::sound( global_pos3(), 30, sounds::sound_t::alert,
871 string_format( _( "the %s emitting a beep and saying \"Obstacle detected!\"" ),
872 name ) );
873 }
874 stop_autodriving();
875 return;
876 }
877 int turn_x = get_turn_from_angle( angle, vehpos, target );
878 int accel_y = 0;
879 // best to cruise around at a safe velocity or 40mph, whichever is lowest
880 // accelerate when it dosnt need to turn.
881 // when following player, take distance to player into account.
882 // we really want to avoid running the player over.
883 // If its a helicopter, we dont need to worry about airborne obstacles so much
884 // And fuel efficiency is terrible at low speeds.
885 int safe_player_follow_speed = 400;
886 if( g->u.movement_mode_is( CMM_RUN ) ) {
887 safe_player_follow_speed = 800;
888 } else if( g->u.movement_mode_is( CMM_CROUCH ) ) {
889 safe_player_follow_speed = 200;
890 }
891 if( follow_protocol ) {
892 if( ( ( turn_x > 0 || turn_x < 0 ) && velocity > safe_player_follow_speed ) ||
893 rl_dist( vehpos, g->m.getabs( g->u.pos() ) ) < 7 + ( ( mount_max.y * 3 ) + 4 ) ) {
894 accel_y = 1;
895 }
896 if( ( velocity < std::min( safe_velocity(), safe_player_follow_speed ) && turn_x == 0 &&
897 rl_dist( vehpos, g->m.getabs( g->u.pos() ) ) > 8 + ( ( mount_max.y * 3 ) + 4 ) ) ||
898 velocity < 100 ) {
899 accel_y = -1;
900 }
901 } else {
902 if( ( turn_x > 0 || turn_x < 0 ) && velocity > 1000 ) {
903 accel_y = 1;
904 }
905 if( ( velocity < std::min( safe_velocity(), is_rotorcraft() &&
906 is_flying_in_air() ? 12000 : 32 * 100 ) && turn_x == 0 ) || velocity < 500 ) {
907 accel_y = -1;
908 }
909 if( is_patrolling && velocity > 400 ) {
910 accel_y = 1;
911 }
912 }
913 selfdrive( point( turn_x, accel_y ) );
914}

◆ engine_start_time()

int vehicle::engine_start_time ( int  e) const

Definition at line 947 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

948{
949 if( !is_engine_on( e ) || part_info( engines[e] ).has_flag( "E_STARTS_INSTANTLY" ) ||
950 !engine_fuel_left( e ) ) {
951 return 0;
952 }
953
954 const double dmg = parts[engines[e]].damage_percent();
955
956 // non-linear range [100-1000]; f(0.0) = 100, f(0.6) = 250, f(0.8) = 500, f(0.9) = 1000
957 // diesel engines with working glow plugs always start with f = 0.6 (or better)
958 const double cold = 100 / tanh( 1 - std::min( engine_cold_factor( e ), 0.9 ) );
959
960 // watts to old vhp = watts / 373
961 // divided by magic 16 = watts / 6000
962 const double watts_per_time = 6000;
963 return part_vpower_w( engines[ e ], true ) / watts_per_time + 100 * dmg + cold;

Use grid traversal to enumerate all connected vehicles.

2121 checked_parts.insert( exclude );
2122
2123 std::vector<std::vector <int>> all_vehicles;
2124
2125 for( size_t cnt = 0 ; cnt < 4 ; cnt++ ) {
2126 int test_part = -1;
2127 for( auto p : valid_parts ) {
2128 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
2129 continue;
2130 }
2131 if( checked_parts.find( p ) == checked_parts.end() ) {
2132 test_part = p;
2133 break;
2134 }
2135 }
2136 if( test_part == -1 || static_cast<size_t>( test_part ) > parts.size() ) {
2137 break;
2138 }
2139
2140 std::queue<std::pair<int, std::vector<int>>> search_queue;
2141
2142 const auto push_neighbor = [&]( int p, const std::vector<int> &with_p ) {
2143 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> data( p, with_p );
2144 search_queue.push( data );
2145 };
2146 auto pop_neighbor = [&]() {
2147 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> result = search_queue.front();
2148 search_queue.pop();
2149 return result;
2150 };
2151
2152 std::vector<int> veh_parts;
2153 push_neighbor( test_part, parts_at_relative( parts[ test_part ].mount, true ) );
2154 while( !search_queue.empty() ) {
2155 std::pair<int, std::vector<int>> test_set = pop_neighbor();
2156 test_part = test_set.first;
2157 if( checked_parts.find( test_part ) != checked_parts.end() ) {
2158 continue;
2159 }
2160 for( auto p : test_set.second ) {
2161 veh_parts.push_back( p );
2162 }
2163 checked_parts.insert( test_part );
2164 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
2165 const point dp = parts[test_part].mount + offset;
2166 std::vector<int> all_neighbor_parts = parts_at_relative( dp, true );
2167 int neighbor_struct_part = -1;
2168 for( int p : all_neighbor_parts ) {
2169 if( parts[ p ].removed ) {
2170 continue;
2171 }
2172 if( part_info( p ).location == part_location_structure ) {
2173 neighbor_struct_part = p;
2174 break;
2175 }
2176 }
2177 if( neighbor_struct_part != -1 ) {
2178 push_neighbor( neighbor_struct_part, all_neighbor_parts );
2179 }
2180 }
2181 }
2182 // don't include the first vehicle's worth of parts
2183 if( cnt > 0 ) {
2184 all_vehicles.push_back( veh_parts );
2185 }
2186 }
2187
2188 if( !all_vehicles.empty() ) {
2189 bool success = split_vehicles( all_vehicles );
2190 if( success ) {
2191 // update the active cache
2192 shift_parts( point_zero );
2193 return true;
2194 }
2195 }
2196 return false;
2197}

◆ find_lines_of_parts()

std::vector< std::vector< int > > vehicle::find_lines_of_parts ( int  part,
const std::string &  flag 
)

Returns all parts in the vehicle that have the specified flag in their vpinfo and are on the same X-axis or Y-axis as the input part and are contiguous with each other.

Parameters
partThe part to find adjacent parts to
flagThe flag to match
Returns
A list of lists of indices of all parts sharing the flag and contiguous with the part on the X or Y axis. Returns 0, 1, or 2 lists of indices.

Definition at line 2825 of file vehicle.cpp.

2826{
2827 const auto possible_parts = get_avail_parts( flag );
2828 std::vector<std::vector<int>> ret_parts;
2829 if( empty( possible_parts ) ) {
2830 return ret_parts;
2831 }
2832
2833 std::vector<int> x_parts;
2834 std::vector<int> y_parts;
2835 vpart_id part_id = part_info( part ).get_id();
2836 // create vectors of parts on the same X or Y axis
2837 point target = parts[ part ].mount;
2838 for( const vpart_reference &vp : possible_parts ) {
2839 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ||
2840 !vp.has_feature( "MULTISQUARE" ) ||
2841 vp.info().get_id() != part_id ) {
2842 continue;
2843 }
2844 if( vp.mount().x == target.x ) {
2845 x_parts.push_back( vp.part_index() );
2846 }
2847 if( vp.mount().y == target.y ) {
2848 y_parts.push_back( vp.part_index() );
2849 }
2850 }
2851
2852 if( x_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2853 std::vector<int> x_ret;
2854 // sort by Y-axis, since they're all on the same X-axis
2855 const auto x_sorter = [&]( const int lhs, const int rhs ) {
2856 return( parts[lhs].mount.y > parts[rhs].mount.y );
2857 };
2858 std::sort( x_parts.begin(), x_parts.end(), x_sorter );
2859 int first_part = 0;
2860 int prev_y = parts[ x_parts[ 0 ] ].mount.y;
2861 int i;
2862 bool found_part = x_parts[ 0 ] == part;
2863 for( i = 1; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < x_parts.size(); i++ ) {
2864 // if the Y difference is > 1, there's a break in the run
2865 if( std::abs( parts[ x_parts[ i ] ].mount.y - prev_y ) > 1 ) {
2866 // if we found the part, this is the run we wanted
2867 if( found_part ) {
2868 break;
2869 }
2870 first_part = i;
2871 }
2872 found_part |= x_parts[ i ] == part;
2873 prev_y = parts[ x_parts[ i ] ].mount.y;
2874 }
2875 for( size_t j = first_part; j < static_cast<size_t>( i ); j++ ) {
2876 x_ret.push_back( x_parts[ j ] );
2877 }
2878 ret_parts.push_back( x_ret );
2879 }
2880 if( y_parts.size() > 1 ) {
2881 std::vector<int> y_ret;
2882 const auto y_sorter = [&]( const int lhs, const int rhs ) {
2883 return( parts[lhs].mount.x > parts[rhs].mount.x );
2884 };
2885 std::sort( y_parts.begin(), y_parts.end(), y_sorter );
2886 int first_part = 0;
2887 int prev_x = parts[ y_parts[ 0 ] ].mount.x;
2888 int i;
2889 bool found_part = y_parts[ 0 ] == part;
2890 for( i = 1; static_cast<size_t>( i ) < y_parts.size(); i++ ) {
2891 if( std::abs( parts[ y_parts[ i ] ].mount.x - prev_x ) > 1 ) {
2892 if( found_part ) {
2893 break;
2894 }
2895 first_part = i;
2896 }
2897 found_part |= y_parts[ i ] == part;
2898 prev_x = parts[ y_parts[ i ] ].mount.x;
2899 }
2900 for( size_t j = first_part; j < static_cast<size_t>( i ); j++ ) {
2901 y_ret.push_back( y_parts[ j ] );
2902 }
2903 ret_parts.push_back( y_ret );
2904 }
2905 if( y_parts.size() == 1 && x_parts.size() == 1 ) {
2906 ret_parts.push_back( x_parts );
2907 }
2908 return ret_parts;
2909}

◆ find_vehicle() [1/2]

vehicle * vehicle::find_vehicle ( const tripoint &  where)
static

Find a possibly off-map vehicle.

If necessary, loads up its submap through the global MAPBUFFER and pulls it from there. For this reason, you should only give it the coordinates of the origin tile of a target vehicle.

Parameters
whereLocation of the other vehicle's origin tile.

Definition at line 4900 of file vehicle.cpp.

4905 return &vp->vehicle();
4906 }
4907
4908 // Nope. Load up its submap...
4909 tripoint veh_in_sm = where;
4910 tripoint veh_sm = ms_to_sm_remain( veh_in_sm );
4911
4912 auto sm = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( veh_sm );
4913 if( sm == nullptr ) {
4914 return nullptr;
4915 }
4916
4917 for( auto &elem : sm->vehicles ) {
4918 vehicle *found_veh = elem.get();
4919 if( veh_in_sm.xy() == found_veh->pos ) {
4920 return found_veh;
4921 }
4922 }
4923
4924 return nullptr;
4925}

◆ fuels_left()

std::map< itype_id, int > vehicle::fuels_left ( ) const

All the fuels that are in all the tanks in the vehicle, nicely summed up.

Note that empty tanks don't count at all. The value is the amount as it would be reported by fuel_left, it is always greater than 0. The key is the fuel item type.

Definition at line 6716 of file vehicle.cpp.

6721 result[ p.ammo_current() ] += p.ammo_remaining();
6722 }
6723 }
6724 return result;
6725}

◆ gain_moves()

void vehicle::gain_moves ( )

Definition at line 5541 of file vehicle.cpp.

5542{
5543 fuel_used_last_turn.clear();
5544 check_falling_or_floating();
5545 const bool pl_control = player_in_control( g->u );
5546 if( is_moving() || is_falling ) {
5547 if( !loose_parts.empty() ) {
5548 shed_loose_parts();
5549 }
5550 of_turn = 1 + of_turn_carry;
5551 const int vslowdown = slowdown( velocity );
5552 if( vslowdown > std::abs( velocity ) ) {
5553 if( cruise_on && cruise_velocity && pl_control ) {
5554 velocity = velocity > 0 ? 1 : -1;
5555 } else {
5556 stop();
5557 }
5558 } else if( velocity < 0 ) {
5559 velocity += vslowdown;
5560 } else {
5561 velocity -= vslowdown;
5562 }
5563 } else {
5564 of_turn = .001;
5565 }
5566 of_turn_carry = 0;
5567 // cruise control TODO: enable for NPC?
5568 if( ( pl_control || is_following || is_patrolling ) && cruise_on && cruise_velocity != velocity ) {
5569 thrust( ( cruise_velocity ) > velocity ? 1 : -1 );
5570 }
5571
5572 // Force off-map vehicles to load by visiting them every time we gain moves.
5573 // Shouldn't be too expensive if there aren't fifty trillion vehicles in the graph...
5574 // ...and if there are, it's the player's fault for putting them there.
5575 distribution_graph::traverse( *this, distribution_graph::noop_visitor_veh,
5576 distribution_graph::noop_visitor_grid );
5577
5578 if( check_environmental_effects ) {
5579 check_environmental_effects = do_environmental_effects();
5580 }
5581
5582 // turrets which are enabled will try to reload and then automatically fire
5583 // Turrets which are disabled but have targets set are a special case
5584 for( auto e : turrets() ) {
5585 if( e->enabled || e->target.second != e->target.first ) {
5586 automatic_fire_turret( *e );
5587 }
5588 }

5592 }

917{
918 tripoint vehpos = global_square_location().raw();
919 rl_vec2d facevec = face_vec();
920 point rel_pos_target = targ.xy() - vehpos.xy();
921 rl_vec2d targetvec = rl_vec2d( rel_pos_target.x, rel_pos_target.y );
922 // cross product
923 double crossy = ( facevec.x * targetvec.y ) - ( targetvec.x * facevec.y );
924 // dot product.

7040{
7041 int min_x = INT_MAX;
7042 int max_x = INT_MIN;
7043 int min_y = INT_MAX;
7044 int max_y = INT_MIN;
7045
7046 set_facing( turn_dir );
7047
7048 int i_use = 0;
7049 for( const tripoint &p : get_points( true ) ) {
7050 const point pt = parts[part_at( p.xy() )].precalc[i_use].xy();
7051 if( pt.x < min_x ) {
7052 min_x = pt.x;
7053 }
7054 if( pt.x > max_x ) {
7055 max_x = pt.x;
7056 }
7057 if( pt.y < min_y ) {
7058 min_y = pt.y;
7059 }
7060 if( pt.y > max_y ) {
7061 max_y = pt.y;
7062 }
7063 }
7064 bounding_box b;
7065 b.p1 = point( min_x, min_y );
7066 b.p2 = point( max_x, max_y );
7067 return b;

1132 ret.emplace_back( pt_elem - veh_pos.raw().xy(), catacurses::yellow, "C" );
1133 }
1134
1135 if( !active_autodrive_controller ) {
1136 return ret;
1137 }
1138 const auto_navigation_data &data = active_autodrive_controller->get_data();
1139
1140 const orientation dir = to_orientation( face.dir() );
1141 for( const std::string &debug_str : debug_what ) {
1142 if( debug_str == "profiles" ) {
1143 const vehicle_profile &profile = data.profile( dir );
1144 for( const point &p : profile.occupied_zone ) {
1145 if( p.x == 0 && p.y == 0 ) {
1146 ret.emplace_back( p, catacurses::cyan, to_string( dir ) );
1147 } else {
1148 ret.emplace_back( p, catacurses::green, "x" );
1149 }
1150 }
1151 for( const point &p : profile.collision_points ) {
1152 ret.emplace_back( p, catacurses::red, "o" );
1153 }
1154 } else if( debug_str == "is_obstacle" ) {
1155 for( int dx = 0; dx < NAV_VIEW_SIZE_X; dx++ ) {
1156 for( int dy = 0; dy < NAV_VIEW_SIZE_Y; dy++ ) {
1157 const bool obstacle = data.is_obstacle[dx][dy];
1158 const int color = obstacle ? catacurses::red : catacurses::green;
1159 const point pt = data.view_to_map.transform( point( dx, dy ) ) - veh_pos.raw().xy();
1160 ret.emplace_back( pt, color, obstacle ? "o" : "x" );
1161 }
1162 }
1163 } else if( debug_str == "valid_position" ) {
1164 const orientation tdir = data.nav_to_map.inverse().transform( dir );
1165 for( int dx = 0; dx < NAV_MAP_SIZE_X; dx++ ) {
1166 for( int dy = 0; dy < NAV_MAP_SIZE_Y; dy++ ) {
1167 const point nav_pt( dx, dy );
1168 const bool valid = data.valid_position( tdir, nav_pt );
1169 const int color = valid ? catacurses::green : catacurses::red;
1170 const point pt = data.nav_to_map.transform( nav_pt ) - veh_pos.raw().xy();
1171 ret.emplace_back( pt, color, to_string( dir ) );
1172 }
1173 }
1174 } else if( debug_str == "goal_zone" ) {
1175 std::unordered_map<point, bool> goal_map;
1176 for( const node_address &addr : data.goal_zone ) {
1177 goal_map[addr.get_point()] |= data.nav_to_map.transform( addr.facing_dir ) == dir;
1178 }
1179 for( const auto &entry : goal_map ) {
1180 const point pt = data.nav_to_map.transform( entry.first ) - veh_pos.raw().xy();
1181 const int color = entry.second ? catacurses::green : catacurses::yellow + 8;
1182 ret.emplace_back( pt, color, "g" );
1183 }
1184 } else if( debug_str == "goal_points" ) {
1185 for( point p : data.goal_points ) {
1186 const point pt = data.nav_to_map.transform( p ) - veh_pos.raw().xy();
1187 ret.emplace_back( pt, catacurses::white, "G" );
1188 }
1189 } else if( debug_str == "path" ) {
1190 for( const auto &step : data.path ) {
1191 ret.emplace_back( ( step.pos - veh_pos ).raw().xy(), 8 + catacurses::yellow,
1192 to_string( step.steering_dir ) );
1193 }
1194 } else if( debug_str == "omt" ) {
1195 const point offset = ( project_to<coords::ms>( data.current_omt ) - veh_pos ).raw().xy();
1196 static const std::vector<point> corners = {point_zero, {0, OMT_SIZE - 1}, {OMT_SIZE - 1, 0}, {OMT_SIZE - 1, OMT_SIZE - 1}};
1197 for( point corner : corners ) {
1198 ret.emplace_back( corner + offset, catacurses::cyan, "+" );

1200 }
1201 }
1202 return ret;

2804 break;
2805 }

)

Get all enabled, available, unbroken vehicle parts at specified position.

Parameters
posposition to check
flagif set only flags with this part will be considered
conditionenum to include unabled, unavailable, and broken parts

Definition at line 2616 of file vehicle.cpp.

2618{
2619 const tripoint relative_pos = pos - global_pos3();
2620 std::vector<vehicle_part *> res;
2621 for( auto &e : parts ) {
2622 if( e.precalc[ 0 ] != relative_pos ) {
2623 continue;
2624 }
2625 if( !e.removed &&
2626 ( flag.empty() || e.info().has_flag( flag ) ) &&
2627 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::enabled ) || e.enabled ) &&
2628 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::working ) || !e.is_broken() ) ) {

2630 }
2631 }

2648 ( !( condition & part_status_flag::working ) || !e.is_broken() ) ) {
2649 res.push_back( &e );
2650 }
2651 }
2652 return res;
2653}

References enabled, global_pos3(), parts, pos, and working.

int vehicle::ground_acceleration ( bool  fueled = true,

3556{
3557 if( !( engine_on || skidding ) ) {
3558 return 0;
3559 }
3560 int target_vmiph = std::max( at_vel_in_vmi, std::max( 1000, max_velocity( fueled ) / 4 ) );
3561 int cmps = vmiph_to_cmps( target_vmiph );
3562 double weight = to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3563 if( is_towing() ) {
3564 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
3565 if( other_veh ) {
3566 weight = weight + to_kilogram( other_veh->total_mass() );
3567 }
3568 }
3569 int engine_power_ratio = total_power_w( fueled ) / weight;
3570 int accel_at_vel = 100 * 100 * engine_power_ratio / cmps;
3571 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: accel at %d vimph is %d", name, target_vmiph,
3572 cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel ) );
3573 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );

◆ handle_potential_theft()

bool vehicle::handle_potential_theft ( player &  p,
bool  check_only = false,
bool  prompt = true 
)

Definition at line 4377 of file vehicle.cpp.

4378{
4379 const bool is_owned_by_player = is_owned_by( p );
4380 std::vector<npc *> witnesses;
4381 for( npc &elem : g->all_npcs() ) {
4382 if( rl_dist( elem.pos(), p.pos() ) < MAX_VIEW_DISTANCE && has_owner() &&
4383 !is_owned_by_player && elem.sees( p.pos() ) ) {
4384 witnesses.push_back( &elem );
4385 }
4386 }
4387 // the vehicle is yours, that's fine.
4388 if( is_owned_by_player ) {
4389 return true;
4390 // if There is no owner
4391 // handle transfer of ownership
4392 } else if( !has_owner() ) {
4393 set_owner( p.get_faction()->id );
4394 remove_old_owner();
4395 return true;
4396 // if there is a marker for having been stolen, but 15 minutes have passed, then officially transfer ownership
4397 } else if( witnesses.empty() && has_old_owner() && !is_old_owner( p ) && theft_time &&
4398 calendar::turn - *theft_time > 15_minutes ) {
4399 set_owner( p.get_faction()->id );
4400 remove_old_owner();
4401 return true;
4402 // No witnesses? then don't need to prompt, we assume the player is in process of stealing it.
4403 // Ownership transfer checking is handled above, and warnings handled below.
4404 // This is just to perform interaction with the vehicle without a prompt.
4405 // It will prompt first-time, even with no witnesses, to inform player it is owned by someone else
4406 // subsequently, no further prompts, the player should know by then.
4407 } else if( witnesses.empty() && old_owner ) {
4408 return true;
4409 }
4410 // if we are just checking if we could continue without problems, then the rest is assumed false
4411 if( check_only ) {
4412 return false;
4413 }
4414 // if we got here, there's some theft occurring
4415 if( prompt ) {
4416 if( !query_yn(
4417 _( "This vehicle belongs to: %s, there may be consequences if you are observed interacting with it, continue?" ),
4418 _( get_owner_name() ) ) ) {
4419 return false;
4420 }
4421 }
4422 // set old owner so that we can restore ownership if there are witnesses.
4423 set_old_owner( get_owner() );
4424 for( npc *elem : witnesses ) {
4425 elem->say( "<witnessed_thievery>", 7 );
4426 }
4427 if( !witnesses.empty() ) {
4428 if( p.add_faction_warning( get_owner() ) ) {
4429 for( npc *elem : witnesses ) {
4430 elem->make_angry();
4431 }
4432 }
4433 // remove the temporary marker for a successful theft, as it was witnessed.
4434 remove_old_owner();
4435 }
4436 // if we got here, then the action will proceed after the previous warning
4437 return true;
4438}

◆ handle_trap()

void vehicle::handle_trap ( const tripoint &  p,
int  part 
)

Definition at line 846 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

847{
848 int pwh = part_with_feature( part, VPFLAG_WHEEL, true );
849 if( pwh < 0 ) {
850 return;
851 }
852 map &here = get_map();
853 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
854
855 const trap &tr = here.tr_at( p );
856 const trap_id t = tr.loadid;
857
858 if( t == tr_null ) {
859 // If the trap doesn't exist, we can't interact with it, so just return
860 return;
861 }
862 vehicle_handle_trap_data veh_data = tr.vehicle_data;
863
864 if( veh_data.is_falling ) {
865 return;
866 }
867
868 const bool seen = player_character.sees( p );
869 const bool known = player_character.knows_trap( p );
870 if( seen ) {
871 if( known ) {
872 //~ %1$s: name of the vehicle; %2$s: name of the related vehicle part; %3$s: trap name
873 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s runs over %3$s." ), name, parts[ part ].name(), tr.name() );
874 } else {
875 add_msg( m_bad, _( "The %1$s's %2$s runs over something." ), name, parts[ part ].name() );
876 }
877 }
878
879 if( veh_data.chance >= rng( 1, 100 ) ) {
880 if( veh_data.sound_volume > 0 ) {
881 sounds::sound( p, veh_data.sound_volume, sounds::sound_t::combat, veh_data.sound, false,
882 veh_data.sound_type, veh_data.sound_variant );
883 }
884 if( veh_data.do_explosion ) {
885 explosion_handler::explosion( p, nullptr, veh_data.damage, 0.5f, false, veh_data.shrapnel );
886 } else {
887 // Hit the wheel directly since it ran right over the trap.
888 damage_direct( pwh, veh_data.damage );
889 }
890 bool still_has_trap = true;
891 if( veh_data.remove_trap || veh_data.do_explosion ) {
892 here.remove_trap( p );
893 still_has_trap = false;
894 }
895 for( const auto &it : veh_data.spawn_items ) {
896 int cnt = roll_remainder( it.second );
897 if( cnt > 0 ) {
898 here.spawn_item( p, it.first, cnt );
899 }
900 }
901 if( veh_data.set_trap ) {
902 here.trap_set( p, veh_data.set_trap.id() );
903 still_has_trap = true;
904 }
905 if( still_has_trap ) {
906 const trap &tr = here.tr_at( p );
907 if( seen || known ) {
908 // known status has been reset by map::trap_set()
909 player_character.add_known_trap( p, tr );
910 }
911 if( seen && !known ) {
912 // hard to miss!
913 const std::string direction = direction_name( direction_from( player_character.pos(), p ) );
914 add_msg( _( "You've spotted a %1$s to the %2$s!" ), tr.name(), direction );
915 }
916 }
917 }
918}

◆ handling_difficulty()

float vehicle::handling_difficulty ( ) const

Returns roughly driving skill level at which there is no chance of fumbling.

Definition at line 4505 of file vehicle.cpp.

4506{
4507 const float steer = std::max( 0.0f, steering_effectiveness() );
4508 const float ktraction = k_traction( g->m.vehicle_wheel_traction( *this ) );
4509 const float aligned = std::max( 0.0f, 1.0f - ( face_vec() - dir_vec() ).magnitude() );
4510
4511 // TestVehicle: perfect steering, moving on road at 100 mph (25 tiles per turn) = 0.0
4512 // TestVehicle but on grass (0.75 friction) = 2.5
4513 // TestVehicle but with bad steering (0.5 steer) = 5
4514 // TestVehicle but on fungal bed (0.5 friction) and bad steering = 10
4515 // TestVehicle but turned 90 degrees during this turn (0 align) = 10
4516 const float diff_mod = ( ( 1.0f - steer ) + ( 1.0f - ktraction ) + ( 1.0f - aligned ) );
4517 return velocity * diff_mod / vehicles::vmiph_per_tile;
4518}

1056 return false;

1058
1059 bool has_conflict = false;
1060

1065 install_excludes.end(), back_inserter( conflicts ) );

1067 has_conflict = true;
1068 conflict_type = conflicts.front();

1168{
1169 const bool no_power = !fuel_left( fuel_type_battery, true );
1170 bool honked = false;
1171
1172 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "HORN" ) ) {
1173 //Only bicycle horn doesn't need electricity to work
1174 const vpart_info &horn_type = vp.info();
1175 if( ( horn_type.get_id() != vpart_id( "horn_bicycle" ) ) && no_power ) {
1176 continue;
1177 }
1178 if( !honked ) {
1179 add_msg( _( "You honk the horn!" ) );
1180 honked = true;
1181 }
1182 //Get global position of horn
1183 const tripoint horn_pos = vp.pos();
1184 //Determine sound
1185 if( horn_type.bonus >= 110 ) {
1186 //~ Loud horn sound
1187 sounds::sound( horn_pos, horn_type.bonus, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "HOOOOORNK!" ), false,
1188 "vehicle", "horn_loud" );
1189 } else if( horn_type.bonus >= 80 ) {
1190 //~ Moderate horn sound
1191 sounds::sound( horn_pos, horn_type.bonus, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "BEEEP!" ), false, "vehicle",
1192 "horn_medium" );
1193 } else {
1194 //~ Weak horn sound
1195 sounds::sound( horn_pos, horn_type.bonus, sounds::sound_t::alarm, _( "honk." ), false, "vehicle",
1196 "horn_low" );
1197 }
1198 }
1199
1200 if( !honked ) {
1201 add_msg( _( "You honk the horn, but nothing happens." ) );
1202 }
1203}

5214{
5215 power_parts();
5216 if( engine_on && total_power_w() > 0 ) {
5217 int idle_rate = alternator_load;
5218 if( idle_rate < 10 ) {
5219 idle_rate = 10; // minimum idle is 1% of full throttle
5220 }
5221 // Helicopters use extra power just to stay in the air
5222 // 100 means 10% of power
5223 if( is_rotorcraft() && is_flying_in_air() ) {
5224 idle_rate = 100;
5225 }
5226 if( has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
5227 consume_fuel( idle_rate, to_turns<int>( 1_turns ), true );

770{
771 std::set<point> points_to_check;
772 const int distance_to_check = 10 + ( velocity / 800 );
773 units::angle adjusted_angle = normalize( face.dir() + rotate );
774 // clamp to multiples of 15.
775 adjusted_angle = round_to_multiple_of( adjusted_angle, 15_degrees );
776 tileray collision_vector;
777 collision_vector.init( adjusted_angle );
778 point top_left_actual = global_pos3().xy() + coord_translate( front_left );
779 point top_right_actual = global_pos3().xy() + coord_translate( front_right );
780 std::vector<point> front_row = line_to( g->m.getabs( top_left_actual ),
781 g->m.getabs( top_right_actual ) );
782 for( const point &elem : front_row ) {
783 for( int i = 0; i < distance_to_check; ++i ) {
784 collision_vector.advance( i );
785 point point_to_add = elem + point( collision_vector.dx(), collision_vector.dy() );
786 points_to_check.emplace( point_to_add );
787 }
788 }
789 collision_check_points = points_to_check;
790 return points_to_check;
791}

◆ index_of_part()

int vehicle::index_of_part ( const vehicle_part *  part,
bool  check_removed = false 
) const

Given a vehicle part which is inside of this vehicle, returns the index of that part.

This exists solely because activities relating to vehicle editing require the index of the vehicle part to be passed around.

Parameters
partThe part to find.
check_removedCheck whether this part can be removed
Returns
The part index, -1 if it is not part of this vehicle.

Definition at line 2947 of file vehicle.cpp.

2948{
2949 if( part != nullptr ) {
2950 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
2951 const vehicle_part &next_part = vp.part();
2952 if( !check_removed && next_part.removed ) {
2953 continue;
2954 }
2955 if( part->id == next_part.id && part->mount == vp.mount() ) {

◆ init_state()

void vehicle::init_state ( int  init_veh_fuel,
int  init_veh_status 
)

Definition at line 386 of file vehicle.cpp.

387{
388 // vehicle parts excluding engines are by default turned off
389 for( auto &pt : parts ) {
390 pt.enabled = pt.base.is_engine();
391 }
392
393 bool destroySeats = false;
394 bool destroyControls = false;
395 bool destroyTank = false;
396 bool destroyEngine = false;
397 bool destroyTires = false;
398 bool blood_covered = false;
399 bool blood_inside = false;
400 bool has_no_key = false;
401 bool destroyAlarm = false;
402
403 // More realistically it should be -5 days old
404 last_update = calendar::start_of_cataclysm;
405
406 // veh_fuel_multiplier is percentage of fuel
407 // 0 is empty, 100 is full tank, -1 is random 7% to 35%
408 int veh_fuel_mult = init_veh_fuel;
409 if( init_veh_fuel == - 1 ) {
410 veh_fuel_mult = rng( 1, 7 );
411 }
412 if( init_veh_fuel > 100 ) {
413 veh_fuel_mult = 100;
414 }
415
416 // veh_status is initial vehicle damage
417 // -1 = light damage (DEFAULT)
418 // 0 = undamaged
419 // 1 = disabled, destroyed tires OR engine
420 int veh_status = -1;
421 if( init_veh_status == 0 ) {
422 veh_status = 0;
423 }
424 if( init_veh_status == 1 ) {
425 int rand = rng( 1, 100 );
426 veh_status = 1;
427
428 if( rand <= 5 ) { // seats are destroyed 5%
429 destroySeats = true;
430 } else if( rand <= 15 ) { // controls are destroyed 10%
431 destroyControls = true;
432 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 0, 7 ); // add 0-7% more fuel if controls are destroyed
433 } else if( rand <= 23 ) { // battery, minireactor or gasoline tank are destroyed 8%
434 destroyTank = true;
435 } else if( rand <= 29 ) { // engine are destroyed 6%
436 destroyEngine = true;
437 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 3, 12 ); // add 3-12% more fuel if engine is destroyed
438 } else if( rand <= 66 ) { // tires are destroyed 37%
439 destroyTires = true;
440 veh_fuel_mult += rng( 0, 18 ); // add 0-18% more fuel if tires are destroyed
441 } else { // vehicle locked 34%
442 has_no_key = true;
443 }
444 }
445 // if locked, 16% chance something damaged
446 if( one_in( 6 ) && has_no_key ) {
447 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
448 destroyTank = true;
449 } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
450 destroyEngine = true;
451 } else {
452 destroyTires = true;
453 }
454 } else if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
455 //most cars should have a destroyed alarm
456 destroyAlarm = true;
457 }
458
459 //Provide some variety to non-mint vehicles
460 if( veh_status != 0 ) {
461 //Leave engine running in some vehicles, if the engine has not been destroyed
462 //chance decays from 1 in 4 vehicles on day 0 to 1 in (day + 4) in the future.
463 int current_day = std::max( to_days<int>( calendar::turn - calendar::turn_zero ), 0 );
464 if( veh_fuel_mult > 0 && !empty( get_avail_parts( "ENGINE" ) ) &&
465 one_in( current_day + 4 ) && !destroyEngine && !has_no_key &&
466 has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
467 engine_on = true;
468 }
469
470 auto light_head = one_in( 20 );
471 auto light_whead = one_in( 20 ); // wide-angle headlight
472 auto light_dome = one_in( 16 );
473 auto light_aisle = one_in( 8 );
474 auto light_hoverh = one_in( 4 ); // half circle overhead light
475 auto light_overh = one_in( 4 );
476 auto light_atom = one_in( 2 );
477 for( auto &pt : parts ) {
478 if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_CONE_LIGHT ) ) {
479 pt.enabled = light_head;
480 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_WIDE_CONE_LIGHT ) ) {
481 pt.enabled = light_whead;
482 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_DOME_LIGHT ) ) {
483 pt.enabled = light_dome;
484 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_AISLE_LIGHT ) ) {
485 pt.enabled = light_aisle;
486 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_HALF_CIRCLE_LIGHT ) ) {
487 pt.enabled = light_hoverh;
488 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_CIRCLE_LIGHT ) ) {
489 pt.enabled = light_overh;
490 } else if( pt.has_flag( VPFLAG_ATOMIC_LIGHT ) ) {
491 pt.enabled = light_atom;
492 }
493 }
494
495 if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
496 blood_covered = true;
497 }
498
499 if( one_in( 8 ) ) {
500 blood_inside = true;
501 }
502
503 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "FRIDGE" ) ) {
504 vp.part().enabled = true;
505 }
506
507 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "FREEZER" ) ) {
508 vp.part().enabled = true;
509 }
510
511 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_parts_including_carried( "WATER_PURIFIER" ) ) {
512 vp.part().enabled = true;
513 }
514 }
515
516 cata::optional<point> blood_inside_pos;
517 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
518 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
519 vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
520
521 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_REACTOR ) ) {
522 // De-hardcoded reactors. Should always start active
523 pt.enabled = true;
524 }
525
526 if( pt.is_reactor() ) {
527 if( veh_fuel_mult == 100 ) { // Mint condition vehicle
528 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() );
529 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) { // Randomize charge a bit
530 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult + rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
531 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) {
532 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult - rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
533 } else {
534 pt.ammo_set( itype_plut_cell, pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100 );
535 }
536 }
537
538 if( pt.is_battery() ) {
539 if( veh_fuel_mult == 100 ) { // Mint condition vehicle
540 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() );
541 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) { // Randomize battery ammo a bit
542 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult + rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
543 } else if( one_in( 2 ) && veh_fuel_mult > 0 ) {
544 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * ( veh_fuel_mult - rng( 0, 10 ) ) / 100 );
545 } else {
546 pt.ammo_set( itype_battery, pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100 );
547 }
548 }
549
550 if( pt.is_tank() && !type->parts[p].fuel.is_null() ) {
551 int qty = pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100;
552 qty *= std::max( type->parts[p].fuel->stack_size, 1 );
553 qty /= to_milliliter( units::legacy_volume_factor );
554 pt.ammo_set( type->parts[ p ].fuel, qty );
555 } else if( pt.is_fuel_store() && !type->parts[p].fuel.is_null() ) {
556 int qty = pt.ammo_capacity() * veh_fuel_mult / 100;
557 pt.ammo_set( type->parts[ p ].fuel, qty );
558 }
559
560 if( vp.has_feature( "OPENABLE" ) ) { // doors are closed
561 if( !pt.open && one_in( 4 ) ) {
562 open( p );
563 }
564 }
565 if( vp.has_feature( "BOARDABLE" ) ) { // no passengers
566 pt.remove_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag );
567 }
568
569 // initial vehicle damage
570 if( veh_status == 0 ) {
571 // Completely mint condition vehicle
572 set_hp( pt, vp.info().durability );
573 } else {
574 //a bit of initial damage :)
575 //clamp 4d8 to the range of [8,20]. 8=broken, 20=undamaged.
576 int broken = 8;
577 int unhurt = 20;
578 int roll = dice( 4, 8 );
579 if( roll < unhurt ) {
580 if( roll <= broken ) {
581 set_hp( pt, 0 );
582 pt.ammo_unset(); //empty broken batteries and fuel tanks
583 } else {
584 set_hp( pt, ( roll - broken ) / static_cast<double>( unhurt - broken ) * vp.info().durability );
585 }
586 } else {
587 set_hp( pt, vp.info().durability );
588 }
589
590 if( vp.has_feature( VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
591 // If possible set an engine fault rather than destroying the engine outright
592 if( destroyEngine && pt.faults_potential().empty() ) {
593 set_hp( pt, 0 );
594 } else if( destroyEngine || one_in( 3 ) ) {
595 do {
596 pt.fault_set( random_entry( pt.faults_potential() ) );
597 } while( one_in( 3 ) );
598 }
599
600 } else if( ( destroySeats && ( vp.has_feature( "SEAT" ) || vp.has_feature( "SEATBELT" ) ) ) ||
601 ( destroyControls && ( vp.has_feature( "CONTROLS" ) || vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) ) ) ||
602 ( destroyAlarm && vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) ) ) {
603 set_hp( pt, 0 );
604 }
605
606 // Fuel tanks should be emptied as well
607 if( destroyTank && pt.is_fuel_store() ) {
608 set_hp( pt, 0 );
609 pt.ammo_unset();
610 }
611
612 //Solar panels have 25% of being destroyed
613 if( vp.has_feature( "SOLAR_PANEL" ) && one_in( 4 ) ) {
614 set_hp( pt, 0 );
615 }
616
617 /* Bloodsplatter the front-end parts. Assume anything with x > 0 is
618 * the "front" of the vehicle (since the driver's seat is at (0, 0).
619 * We'll be generous with the blood, since some may disappear before
620 * the player gets a chance to see the vehicle. */
621 if( blood_covered && vp.mount().x > 0 ) {
622 if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
623 //Loads of blood. (200 = completely red vehicle part)
624 pt.blood = rng( 200, 600 );
625 } else {
626 //Some blood
627 pt.blood = rng( 50, 200 );
628 }
629 }
630
631 if( blood_inside ) {
632 // blood is splattered around (blood_inside_pos),
633 // coordinates relative to mount point; the center is always a seat
634 if( blood_inside_pos ) {
635 const int distSq = std::pow( blood_inside_pos->x - vp.mount().x, 2 ) +
636 std::pow( blood_inside_pos->y - vp.mount().y, 2 );
637 if( distSq <= 1 ) {
638 pt.blood = rng( 200, 400 ) - distSq * 100;
639 }
640 } else if( vp.has_feature( "SEAT" ) ) {
641 // Set the center of the bloody mess inside
642 blood_inside_pos.emplace( vp.mount() );
643 }
644 }
645 }
646 //sets the vehicle to locked, if there is no key and an alarm part exists
647 if( vp.has_feature( "SECURITY" ) && has_no_key && pt.is_available() ) {
648 is_locked = true;
649
650 if( one_in( 2 ) ) {
651 // if vehicle has immobilizer 50% chance to add additional fault
652 pt.fault_set( fault_immobiliser );
653 }
654 }
655 }
656 // destroy tires until the vehicle is not drivable
657 if( destroyTires && !wheelcache.empty() ) {
658 int tries = 0;
659 while( valid_wheel_config() && tries < 100 ) {
660 // wheel config is still valid, destroy the tire.
661 set_hp( parts[random_entry( wheelcache )], 0 );
662 tries++;
663 }
664 }
665
666 invalidate_mass();
667}
cata::optional::emplace
T & emplace(Args &&... args)
Definition: optional.h:146
vehicle::valid_wheel_config
bool valid_wheel_config() const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:4459
vehicle::get_parts_including_carried
vehicle_part_with_feature_range< std::string > get_parts_including_carried(std::string feature) const
Yields a range of parts of this vehicle that each have the given feature and are not broken or remove...
Definition: vehicle.cpp:2730
vehicle::set_hp

Set stat for part constrained by range [0,durability].
Definition: vehicle_part.cpp:528
broken
@ broken
Definition: enums.h:330

const time_point turn_zero
Represents time point 0.
Definition: calendar.cpp:26
calendar::start_of_cataclysm
const time_point & start_of_cataclysm
Definition: calendar.cpp:33
units::to_milliliter
constexpr value_type to_milliliter(const quantity< value_type, volume_in_milliliter_tag > &v)
Definition: units_volume.h:38

int dice(int number, int sides)
Definition: rng.cpp:85

Can this part store fuel of any type @skip_broke exclude broken parts.

Definition: vehicle_part.cpp:398

Try to set fault returning false if specified fault cannot occur with this item.

void ammo_unset()
Remove all fuel, charges or ammunition (if any) from this part.

int blood
how much blood covers part (in turns).

1575 enable = true;

1605 break;
1606 }
1607 }
1608 }
1609

1611 auto &pt = parts.back();

1614
1615 pt.mount = dp;
1616
1617 refresh();
1618 coeff_air_changed = true;
1619 return parts.size() - 1;
1620}

)

Installs a part into this vehicle.

Parameters
dpThe coordinate of where to install the part.
idThe string ID of the part to install. (see vehicle_parts.json)
forceSkip check of whether we can mount the part here.
Returns
false if the part could not be installed, true otherwise.

◆ interact_vehicle_locked()

bool vehicle::interact_vehicle_locked ( )
Mechanics speeds up vehicle hotwiring

Definition at line 489 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

490{
491 if( is_locked ) {
492 const inventory &crafting_inv = g->u.crafting_inventory();
493 add_msg( _( "You don't find any keys in the %s." ), name );
494 if( crafting_inv.has_quality( quality_id( "SCREW" ) ) ) {
495 if( query_yn( _( "You don't find any keys in the %s. Attempt to hotwire vehicle?" ),
496 name ) ) {
497 ///\EFFECT_MECHANICS speeds up vehicle hotwiring
498 int mechanics_skill = g->u.get_skill_level( skill_mechanics );
499 const int hotwire_time = 6000 / ( ( mechanics_skill > 0 ) ? mechanics_skill : 1 );
500 const int moves = to_moves<int>( time_duration::from_turns( hotwire_time ) );
501 //assign long activity
502 g->u.assign_activity( ACT_HOTWIRE_CAR, moves, -1, INT_MIN, _( "Hotwire" ) );
503 // use part 0 as the reference point
504 point q = coord_translate( parts[0].mount );
505 const tripoint abs_veh_pos = global_square_location().raw();
506 //[0]
507 g->u.activity.values.push_back( abs_veh_pos.x + q.x );
508 //[1]
509 g->u.activity.values.push_back( abs_veh_pos.y + q.y );
510 //[2]
511 g->u.activity.values.push_back( g->u.get_skill_level( skill_mechanics ) );
512 } else {
513 if( has_security_working() && query_yn( _( "Trigger the %s's Alarm?" ), name ) ) {
514 is_alarm_on = true;
515 } else {
516 add_msg( _( "You leave the controls alone." ) );
517 }
518 }
519 } else {
520 add_msg( _( "You could use a screwdriver to hotwire it." ) );
521 }
522 }
523
524 return !( is_locked );
525}

void vehicle::interact_with ( const tripoint &  pos,

1932 const bool items_are_sealed = here.has_flag( "SEALED", pos );
1933
1934 auto turret = turret_query( pos );
1935
1936 const int curtain_part = avail_part_with_feature( interact_part, "CURTAIN", true );
1937 const bool curtain_closed = ( curtain_part == -1 ) ? false : !parts[curtain_part].open;
1938 const bool has_kitchen = avail_part_with_feature( interact_part, "KITCHEN", true ) >= 0;
1939 const bool has_faucet = avail_part_with_feature( interact_part, "FAUCET", true ) >= 0;

1972 enum {
1973 EXAMINE, TRACK, HANDBRAKE, CONTROL, CONTROL_ELECTRONICS, GET_ITEMS, GET_ITEMS_ON_GROUND, FOLD_VEHICLE, UNLOAD_TURRET,
1974 RELOAD_TURRET, USE_HOTPLATE, FILL_CONTAINER, DRINK, USE_WELDER, USE_PURIFIER, PURIFY_TANK, USE_AUTOCLAVE, USE_AUTODOC, USE_WASHMACHINE,

1977 uilist selectmenu;
1978

1980 selectmenu.addentry( TRACK, true, keybind( "TOGGLE_TRACKING" ), tracking_toggle_string() );

1984 }

1988 }

1991 }
1992 if( has_autodoc ) {
1993 selectmenu.addentry( USE_AUTODOC, true, 'I', _( "Use autodoc" ) );
1994 }
1995 if( has_washmachine ) {
1996 selectmenu.addentry( USE_WASHMACHINE, true, 'W',
1997 washing_machine_on ? _( "Deactivate the washing machine" ) :
1998 _( "Activate the washing machine (1.5 hours)" ) );
1999 }
2000 if( has_dishwasher ) {
2001 selectmenu.addentry( USE_DISHWASHER, true, 'D',
2002 dishwasher_on ? _( "Deactivate the dishwasher" ) :
2003 _( "Activate the dishwasher (1.5 hours)" ) );
2004 }
2005 if( from_vehicle && !washing_machine_on && !dishwasher_on ) {
2006 selectmenu.addentry( GET_ITEMS, true, 'g', _( "Get items" ) );
2007 }
2008 if( has_items_on_ground && !items_are_sealed ) {
2009 selectmenu.addentry( GET_ITEMS_ON_GROUND, true, 'i', _( "Get items on the ground" ) );
2010 }
2011 if( ( can_be_folded || is_convertible ) && !remotely_controlled ) {
2012 selectmenu.addentry( FOLD_VEHICLE, true, 'f', _( "Fold vehicle" ) );
2013 }
2014 if( turret.can_unload() ) {
2015 selectmenu.addentry( UNLOAD_TURRET, true, 'u', _( "Unload %s" ), turret.name() );
2016 }
2017 if( turret.can_reload() ) {
2018 selectmenu.addentry( RELOAD_TURRET, true, 'r', _( "Reload %s" ), turret.name() );
2019 }
2020 if( curtain_part >= 0 && curtain_closed ) {
2021 selectmenu.addentry( PEEK_CURTAIN, true, 'p', _( "Peek through the closed curtains" ) );
2022 }
2023 if( ( has_kitchen || has_chemlab ) && fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) > 0 ) {
2024 selectmenu.addentry( USE_HOTPLATE, true, 'h', _( "Use the hotplate" ) );
2025 }
2026 if( has_faucet && fuel_left( itype_water_clean ) > 0 ) {
2027 selectmenu.addentry( FILL_CONTAINER, true, 'c', _( "Fill a container with water" ) );
2028 selectmenu.addentry( DRINK, true, 'd', _( "Have a drink" ) );
2029 }
2030 if( has_towel ) {
2031 selectmenu.addentry( USE_TOWEL, true, 't', _( "Use a towel" ) );
2032 }
2033 if( has_weldrig && fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) > 0 ) {
2034 selectmenu.addentry( USE_WELDER, true, 'w', _( "Use the welding rig" ) );
2035 }
2036 if( has_purify ) {
2037 bool can_purify = fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) >=
2038 itype_water_purifier->charges_to_use();
2039 selectmenu.addentry( USE_PURIFIER, can_purify,
2040 'p', _( "Purify water in carried container" ) );
2041 selectmenu.addentry( PURIFY_TANK, can_purify && fuel_left( itype_water ),
2042 'P', _( "Purify water in vehicle tank" ) );
2043 }
2044 if( has_monster_capture ) {
2045 selectmenu.addentry( USE_MONSTER_CAPTURE, true, 'G', _( "Capture or release a creature" ) );
2046 }
2047 if( has_bike_rack ) {
2048 selectmenu.addentry( USE_BIKE_RACK, true, 'R', _( "Load or unload a vehicle" ) );
2049 }
2050 if( has_harness ) {
2051 selectmenu.addentry( USE_HARNESS, true, 'H', _( "Harness an animal" ) );
2052 }
2053 if( has_planter ) {
2054 selectmenu.addentry( RELOAD_PLANTER, true, 's', _( "Reload seed drill with seeds" ) );
2055 }
2056
2057 int choice;
2058 if( selectmenu.entries.size() == 1 ) {
2059 choice = selectmenu.entries.front().retval;
2060 } else {
2061 selectmenu.text = _( "Select an action" );
2062 selectmenu.query();
2063 choice = selectmenu.ret;
2064 }
2065 if( choice != EXAMINE && choice != TRACK && choice != GET_ITEMS_ON_GROUND ) {
2066 if( !handle_potential_theft( you ) ) {
2067 return;
2068 }
2069 }
2070 auto veh_tool = [&]( const itype_id & obj ) {
2071 item pseudo( obj );
2072 if( fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) < pseudo.ammo_required() ) {
2073 return false;
2074 }
2075 auto capacity = pseudo.ammo_capacity( true );
2076 auto qty = capacity - discharge_battery( capacity );
2077 pseudo.ammo_set( itype_battery, qty );
2078 you.invoke_item( &pseudo );
2079 charge_battery( pseudo.ammo_remaining() );
2080 return true;
2081 };
2082
2083 switch( choice ) {
2084 case USE_BIKE_RACK: {
2085 use_bike_rack( bike_rack_part );
2086 return;
2087 }
2088 case USE_HARNESS: {
2089 use_harness( harness_part, pos );
2090 return;
2091 }
2092 case USE_MONSTER_CAPTURE: {
2093 use_monster_capture( monster_capture_part, pos );
2094 return;
2095 }
2096 case PEEK_CURTAIN: {
2097 add_msg( _( "You carefully peek through the curtains." ) );
2098 g->peek( pos );
2099 return;
2100 }
2101 case USE_HOTPLATE: {
2102 veh_tool( itype_hotplate );
2103 return;
2104 }
2105 case USE_TOWEL: {
2106 iuse::towel_common( &you, nullptr, false );
2107 return;
2108 }
2109 case USE_AUTOCLAVE: {
2110 iexamine::autoclave_empty( you, pos );
2111 return;
2112 }
2113 case USE_AUTODOC: {
2114 iexamine::autodoc( you, pos );
2115 return;
2116 }
2117 case USE_WASHMACHINE: {
2118 use_washing_machine( washing_machine_part );
2119 return;
2120 }
2121 case USE_DISHWASHER: {
2122 use_dishwasher( dishwasher_part );
2123 return;
2124 }
2125 case FILL_CONTAINER: {
2126 character_funcs::siphon( you, *this, itype_water_clean );
2127 return;
2128 }
2129 case DRINK: {
2130 item water( itype_water_clean, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
2131 if( you.eat( water ) ) {
2132 drain( itype_water_clean, 1 );
2133 you.moves -= 250;
2134 }
2135 return;
2136 }
2137 case USE_WELDER: {
2138 if( veh_tool( itype_welder ) ) {
2139 // HACK: Evil hack incoming
2140 activity_handlers::repair_activity_hack::patch_activity_for_vehicle_welder(
2141 you.activity,
2142 pos, *this, interact_part
2143 );
2144 }
2145 return;
2146 }
2147 case USE_PURIFIER: {
2148 veh_tool( itype_water_purifier );
2149 return;
2150 }
2151 case PURIFY_TANK: {
2152 auto sel = []( const vehicle_part & pt ) {
2153 return pt.is_tank() && pt.ammo_current() == itype_water;
2154 };
2155 auto title = string_format(
2156 _( "Purify <color_%s>water</color> in tank" ),
2157 get_all_colors().get_name( itype_water->color ) );
2158 auto &tank = veh_interact::select_part( *this, sel, title );
2159 if( tank ) {
2160 double cost = itype_water_purifier->charges_to_use();
2161 if( fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) < tank.ammo_remaining() * cost ) {
2162 //~ $1 - vehicle name, $2 - part name
2163 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Insufficient power to purify the contents of the %1$s's %2$s" ),
2164 name, tank.name() );
2165 } else {
2166 //~ $1 - vehicle name, $2 - part name
2167 add_msg( m_good, _( "You purify the contents of the %1$s's %2$s" ), name, tank.name() );
2168 discharge_battery( tank.ammo_remaining() * cost );
2169 tank.ammo_set( itype_water_clean, tank.ammo_remaining() );
2170 }
2171 }
2172 return;
2173 }
2174 case UNLOAD_TURRET: {
2175 item_location loc = turret.base();
2176 you.unload( loc );
2177 return;
2178 }
2179 case RELOAD_TURRET: {
2180 item::reload_option opt = you.select_ammo( *turret.base(), true );
2181 if( opt ) {
2182 you.assign_activity( ACT_RELOAD, opt.moves(), opt.qty() );
2183 you.activity.targets.emplace_back( turret.base() );
2184 you.activity.targets.push_back( std::move( opt.ammo ) );
2185 }
2186 return;
2187 }
2188 case FOLD_VEHICLE: {
2189 fold_up();
2190 return;
2191 }
2192 case HANDBRAKE: {
2193 handbrake();
2194 return;
2195 }
2196 case CONTROL: {
2197 use_controls( pos );
2198 return;
2199 }
2200 case CONTROL_ELECTRONICS: {
2201 control_electronics();
2202 return;
2203 }
2204 case EXAMINE: {
2205 g->exam_vehicle( *this );
2206 return;
2207 }
2208 case TRACK: {
2209 toggle_tracking( );
2210 return;
2211 }
2212 case GET_ITEMS_ON_GROUND: {
2213 pickup::pick_up( pos, 0, pickup::from_ground );
2214 return;
2215 }
2216 case GET_ITEMS: {
2217 if( from_vehicle ) {
2218 pickup::pick_up( pos, 0, pickup::from_cargo );
2219 } else {
2220 pickup::pick_up( pos, 0, pickup::from_ground );
2221 }
2222 return;
2223 }
2224 case RELOAD_PLANTER: {
2225 reload_seeds( pos );
2226 return;
2227 }
2228 }
2229 return;

◆ is_connected()

bool vehicle::is_connected ( const vehicle_part &  to,
const vehicle_part &  from,
const vehicle_part &  excluded_part 
) const
private

Performs a breadth-first search from one part to another, to see if a path exists between the two without going through the excluded part.

Used to see if a part can be legally removed.

Parameters
toThe part to reach.
fromThe part to start the search from.
excluded_partThe part that is being removed and, therefore, should not be included in the path.
Returns
true if a path exists without the excluded part, false otherwise.

Definition at line 1484 of file vehicle.cpp.

1486{
1487 const auto target = to.mount;
1488 const auto excluded = excluded_part.mount;
1489
1490 //Breadth-first-search components
1491 std::list<vehicle_part> discovered;
1492 std::list<vehicle_part> searched;
1493
1494 //We begin with just the start point
1495 discovered.push_back( from );
1496
1497 while( !discovered.empty() ) {
1498 vehicle_part current_part = discovered.front();
1499 discovered.pop_front();
1500 auto current = current_part.mount;
1501
1502 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
1503 point next = current + offset;
1504
1505 if( next == target ) {
1506 //Success!
1507 return true;
1508 } else if( next == excluded ) {
1509 //There might be a path, but we're not allowed to go that way
1510 continue;
1511 }
1512
1513 std::vector<int> parts_there = parts_at_relative( next, true );
1514
1515 if( !parts_there.empty() && !parts[ parts_there[ 0 ] ].removed &&
1516 part_info( parts_there[ 0 ] ).location == "structure" &&
1517 !part_info( parts_there[ 0 ] ).has_flag( "PROTRUSION" ) ) {
1518 //Only add the part if we haven't been here before
1519 bool found = false;
1520 for( auto &elem : discovered ) {
1521 if( elem.mount == next ) {
1522 found = true;
1523 break;
1524 }
1525 }
1526 if( !found ) {
1527 for( auto &elem : searched ) {
1528 if( elem.mount == next ) {
1529 found = true;
1530 break;
1531 }
1532 }
1533 }
1534 if( !found ) {
1535 vehicle_part next_part = parts[parts_there[0]];
1536 discovered.push_back( next_part );
1537 }
1538 }
1539 }
1540 //Now that that's done, we've finished exploring here
1541 searched.push_back( current_part );
1542 }
1543 //If we completely exhaust the discovered list, there's no path
1544 return false;
1545}

References four_adjacent_offsets, vehicle_part::mount, part_info(), parts, and parts_at_relative().

Referenced by can_unmount().

◆ k_traction()

float vehicle::k_traction ( float  wheel_traction_area) const

Traction coefficient of the vehicle.

1.0 on road. Outside roads, depends on mass divided by wheel area and the surface beneath wheels.

Affects safe velocity, acceleration and handling difficulty.

Definition at line 4277 of file vehicle.cpp.

4278{
4279 if( is_floating ) {
4280 return can_float() ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
4281 }
4282 if( is_flying ) {
4283 return is_rotorcraft() ? 1.0f : -1.0f;
4284 }
4285 if( is_watercraft() && can_float() ) {
4286 return 1.0f;
4287 }
4288
4289 const float fraction_without_traction = 1.0f - wheel_traction_area / wheel_area();
4290 if( fraction_without_traction == 0 ) {
4291 return 1.0f;
4292 }
4293 const float mass_penalty = fraction_without_traction * to_kilogram( total_mass() );
4294 float traction = std::min( 1.0f, wheel_traction_area / mass_penalty );
4295 add_msg( m_debug, "%s has traction %.2f", name, traction );
4296
4297 // For now make it easy until it gets properly balanced: add a low cap of 0.1
4298 return std::max( 0.1f, traction );
4299}
vehicle::wheel_area
int wheel_area() const
Calculates the sum of the area under the wheels of the vehicle.
Definition: vehicle.cpp:3917

◆ leak_fuel()

void vehicle::leak_fuel ( vehicle_part &  pt)
private

empty the contents of a tank, battery or turret spilling liquids randomly on the ground

Definition at line 6690 of file vehicle.cpp.

6691{
6692 // only liquid fuels from non-empty tanks can leak out onto map tiles
6693 if( !pt.is_tank() || pt.ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
6694 return;
6695 }
6696
6697 // leak in random directions but prefer closest tiles and avoid walls or other obstacles
6698 std::vector<tripoint> tiles = closest_points_first( global_part_pos3( pt ), 1 );
6699 tiles.erase( std::remove_if( tiles.begin(), tiles.end(), []( const tripoint & e ) {
6700 return !g->m.passable( e );
6701 } ), tiles.end() );
6702
6703 // leak up to 1/3 of remaining fuel per iteration and continue until the part is empty
6704 const itype *fuel = &*pt.ammo_current();
6705 while( !tiles.empty() && pt.ammo_remaining() ) {
6706 int qty = pt.ammo_consume( rng( 0, std::max( pt.ammo_remaining() / 3, 1 ) ),
6707 global_part_pos3( pt ) );
6708 if( qty > 0 ) {
6709 g->m.add_item_or_charges( random_entry( tiles ), item( fuel, calendar::turn, qty ) );
6710 }
6711 }
6712
6713 pt.ammo_unset();
6714}

◆ lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft()

double vehicle::lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft ( bool  fuelled,
bool  safe = false 
) const

Definition at line 4175 of file vehicle.cpp.

4176{
4177 constexpr double coefficient = 0.8642;
4178 constexpr double exponentiation = -0.3107;
4179
4180 const double rotor_area = total_rotor_area();
4181 // take off 15 % due to the imaginary tail rotor power?
4182 const int engine_power = total_power_w( fuelled, safe );
4183
4184 const double power_load = engine_power / rotor_area;
4185 const double lift_thrust = coefficient * engine_power * std::pow( power_load, exponentiation );
4186 add_msg( m_debug, "lift thrust(N) of %s: %f, rotor area (m^2): %f, engine power (w): %i",
4187 name, lift_thrust, rotor_area, engine_power );
4188 return lift_thrust;
4189}

◆ max_rotor_velocity()

3715{
3716 const double max_air_mps = std::sqrt( lift_thrust_of_rotorcraft( fueled ) / coeff_air_drag() );
3717 // helicopters just cannot go over 250mph at very maximum
3718 // weird things start happening to their rotors if they do.
3719 // due to the rotor tips going supersonic.

◆ merge_rackable_vehicle()

bool vehicle::merge_rackable_vehicle ( vehicle *  carry_veh,
const std::vector< int > &  rack_parts 
)

Definition at line 1654 of file vehicle.cpp.

1655{
1656 // Mapping between the old vehicle and new vehicle mounting points
1657 struct mapping {
1658 // All the parts attached to this mounting point
1659 std::vector<int> carry_parts_here;
1660
1661 // the index where the racking part is on the vehicle with the rack
1662 int rack_part;
1663
1664 // the mount point we are going to add to the vehicle with the rack
1665 point carry_mount;
1666
1667 // the mount point on the old vehicle (carry_veh) that will be destroyed
1668 point old_mount;
1669 };
1670 invalidate_towing( true );
1671 // By structs, we mean all the parts of the carry vehicle that are at the structure location
1672 // of the vehicle (i.e. frames)
1673 std::vector<int> carry_veh_structs = carry_veh->all_parts_at_location( part_location_structure );
1674 std::vector<mapping> carry_data;
1675 carry_data.reserve( carry_veh_structs.size() );
1676
1677 //X is forward/backward, Y is left/right
1678 std::string axis;
1679 if( carry_veh_structs.size() == 1 ) {
1680 axis = "X";
1681 } else {
1682 for( auto carry_part : carry_veh_structs ) {
1683 if( carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.x || carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.y ) {
1684 axis = carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount.x ? "X" : "Y";
1685 }
1686 }
1687 }
1688
1689 units::angle relative_dir = normalize( carry_veh->face.dir() - face.dir() );
1690 units::angle relative_180 = units::fmod( relative_dir, 180_degrees );
1691 units::angle face_dir_180 = normalize( face.dir(), 180_degrees );
1692
1693 // if the carrier is skewed N/S and the carried vehicle isn't aligned with
1694 // the carrier, force the carried vehicle to be at a right angle
1695 if( face_dir_180 >= 45_degrees && face_dir_180 <= 135_degrees ) {
1696 if( relative_180 >= 45_degrees && relative_180 <= 135_degrees ) {
1697 if( relative_dir < 180_degrees ) {
1698 relative_dir = 90_degrees;
1699 } else {
1700 relative_dir = 270_degrees;
1701 }
1702 }
1703 }
1704
1705 // We look at each of the structure parts (mount points, i.e. frames) for the
1706 // carry vehicle and then find a rack part adjacent to it. If we don't find a rack part,
1707 // then we can't merge.
1708 bool found_all_parts = true;
1709 for( auto carry_part : carry_veh_structs ) {
1710
1711 // The current position on the original vehicle for this part
1712 tripoint carry_pos = carry_veh->global_part_pos3( carry_part );
1713
1714 bool merged_part = false;
1715 for( int rack_part : rack_parts ) {
1716 size_t j = 0;
1717 // There's no mathematical transform from global pos3 to vehicle mount, so search for the
1718 // carry part in global pos3 after translating
1719 point carry_mount;
1720 for( const point &offset : four_cardinal_directions ) {
1721 carry_mount = parts[ rack_part ].mount + offset;
1722 tripoint possible_pos = mount_to_tripoint( carry_mount );
1723 if( possible_pos == carry_pos ) {
1724 break;
1725 }
1726 ++j;
1727 }
1728
1729 // We checked the adjacent points from the mounting rack and managed
1730 // to find the current structure part were looking for nearby. If the part was not
1731 // near this particular rack, we would look at each in the list of rack_parts
1732 const bool carry_part_next_to_this_rack = j < four_adjacent_offsets.size();
1733 if( carry_part_next_to_this_rack ) {
1734 mapping carry_map;
1735 point old_mount = carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ].mount;
1736 carry_map.carry_parts_here = carry_veh->parts_at_relative( old_mount, true );
1737 carry_map.rack_part = rack_part;
1738 carry_map.carry_mount = carry_mount;
1739 carry_map.old_mount = old_mount;
1740 carry_data.push_back( carry_map );
1741 merged_part = true;
1742 break;
1743 }
1744 }
1745
1746 // We checked all the racks and could not find a place for this structure part.
1747 if( !merged_part ) {
1748 found_all_parts = false;
1749 break;
1750 }
1751 }
1752
1753 // Now that we have mapped all the parts of the carry vehicle to the vehicle with the rack
1754 // we can go ahead and merge
1755 const point mount_zero{};
1756 if( found_all_parts ) {
1757 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
1758 for( auto carry_map : carry_data ) {
1759 std::string offset = string_format( "%s%3d", carry_map.old_mount == mount_zero ? axis : " ",
1760 axis == "X" ? carry_map.old_mount.x : carry_map.old_mount.y );
1761 std::string unique_id = string_format( "%s%3d%s", offset,
1762 static_cast<int>( to_degrees( relative_dir ) ),
1763 carry_veh->name );
1764 for( int carry_part : carry_map.carry_parts_here ) {
1765 parts.push_back( carry_veh->parts[ carry_part ] );
1766 vehicle_part &carried_part = parts.back();
1767 carried_part.mount = carry_map.carry_mount;
1768 carried_part.carry_names.push( unique_id );
1769 carried_part.enabled = false;
1770 carried_part.set_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag );
1771 //give each carried part a tracked_flag so that we can re-enable overmap tracking on unloading if necessary
1772 if( carry_veh->tracking_on ) {
1773 carried_part.set_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1774 }
1775 parts[ carry_map.rack_part ].set_flag( vehicle_part::carrying_flag );
1776 }
1777
1778 const std::pair<std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator, std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::iterator>
1779 zones_on_point = carry_veh->loot_zones.equal_range( carry_map.old_mount );
1780 for( std::unordered_multimap<point, zone_data>::const_iterator it = zones_on_point.first;
1781 it != zones_on_point.second; ++it ) {
1782 new_zones.emplace( carry_map.carry_mount, it->second );
1783 }
1784 }
1785
1786 for( auto &new_zone : new_zones ) {
1787 zone_manager::get_manager().create_vehicle_loot_zone(
1788 *this, new_zone.first, new_zone.second );
1789 }
1790
1791 // Now that we've added zones to this vehicle, we need to make sure their positions
1792 // update when we next interact with them
1793 zones_dirty = true;
1794
1795 //~ %1$s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
1796 add_msg( _( "You load the %1$s on the rack" ), carry_veh->name );
1797 map &here = get_map();
1798 here.destroy_vehicle( carry_veh );
1799 here.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( this );
1800 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1801 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );
1802 refresh();
1803 } else {
1804 //~ %1$s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
1805 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You can't get the %1$s on the rack" ), carry_veh->name );
1806 }
1807 return found_all_parts;
1808}

) const

Return the index of the next part to close at p

The next part to open is the first opened part in the list of parts at part p's coordinates. Returns -1 for no more to close.

Parameters
pPart who's coordinates provide the location to check
outsideIf true, give parts that can be closed from outside only
Returns
part index or -1 if no part

◆ noise_and_smoke()

void vehicle::noise_and_smoke ( int  load,
time_duration  time = 1_turns 
)

Generate noise or smoke from a vehicle with engines turned on load = how hard the engines are working, from 0.0 until 1.0 time = how many seconds to generated smoke for.

TODO: handle other engine types: muscle / animal / wind / coal / ...

Definition at line 3824 of file vehicle.cpp.

3825{
3826 static const std::array<std::pair<std::string, int>, 8> sounds = { {
3827 { translate_marker( "hmm" ), 0 }, { translate_marker( "hummm!" ), 15 },
3828 { translate_marker( "whirrr!" ), 30 }, { translate_marker( "vroom!" ), 60 },
3829 { translate_marker( "roarrr!" ), 100 }, { translate_marker( "ROARRR!" ), 140 },
3830 { translate_marker( "BRRROARRR!" ), 180 }, { translate_marker( "BRUMBRUMBRUMBRUM!" ), INT_MAX }
3831 }
3832 };
3833 const std::string heli_noise = translate_marker( "WUMPWUMPWUMP!" );
3834 double noise = 0.0;
3835 double mufflesmoke = 0.0;
3836 double muffle = 1.0;
3837 double m = 0.0;
3838 int exhaust_part = -1;
3839 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "MUFFLER" ) ) {
3840 m = 1.0 - ( 1.0 - vp.info().bonus / 100.0 ) * vp.part().health_percent();
3841 if( m < muffle ) {
3842 muffle = m;
3843 exhaust_part = static_cast<int>( vp.part_index() );
3844 }
3845 }
3846
3847 bool bad_filter = false;
3848 bool combustion = false;
3849
3850 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
3851 int p = engines[e];
3852 if( is_engine_on( e ) && engine_fuel_left( e ) ) {
3853 // convert current engine load to units of watts/40K
3854 // then spew more smoke and make more noise as the engine load increases
3855 int part_watts = part_vpower_w( p, true );
3856 double max_stress = static_cast<double>( part_watts / 40000.0 );
3857 double cur_stress = load / 1000.0 * max_stress;
3858 // idle stress = 1.0 resulting in nominal working engine noise = engine_noise_factor()
3859 // and preventing noise = 0
3860 cur_stress = std::max( cur_stress, 1.0 );
3861 double part_noise = cur_stress * part_info( p ).engine_noise_factor();
3862
3863 if( part_info( p ).has_flag( "E_COMBUSTION" ) ) {
3864 combustion = true;
3865 double health = parts[p].health_percent();
3866 if( parts[ p ].base.faults.count( fault_filter_fuel ) ) {
3867 health = 0.0;
3868 }
3869 if( health < part_info( p ).engine_backfire_threshold() && one_in( 50 + 150 * health ) ) {
3870 backfire( e );
3871 }
3872 double j = cur_stress * to_turns<int>( time ) * muffle * 1000;
3873
3874 if( parts[ p ].base.faults.count( fault_filter_air ) ) {
3875 bad_filter = true;
3876 j *= j;
3877 }
3878
3879 if( ( exhaust_part == -1 ) && engine_on ) {
3880 spew_field( j, p, fd_smoke, bad_filter ? fd_smoke.obj().get_max_intensity() : 1 );
3881 } else {
3882 mufflesmoke += j;
3883 }
3884 part_noise = ( part_noise + max_stress * 3 + 5 ) * muffle;
3885 }
3886 noise = std::max( noise, part_noise ); // Only the loudest engine counts.
3887 }
3888 }
3889 if( !combustion ) {
3890 return;
3891 }
3892 /// TODO: handle other engine types: muscle / animal / wind / coal / ...
3893
3894 if( exhaust_part != -1 && engine_on ) {
3895 spew_field( mufflesmoke, exhaust_part, fd_smoke,
3896 bad_filter ? fd_smoke.obj().get_max_intensity() : 1 );
3897 }
3898 if( is_rotorcraft() ) {
3899 noise *= 2;
3900 }
3901 // Cap engine noise to avoid deafening.
3902 noise = std::min( noise, 100.0 );
3903 // Even a vehicle with engines off will make noise traveling at high speeds
3904 noise = std::max( noise, static_cast<double>( std::fabs( velocity / 500.0 ) ) );
3905 int lvl = 0;
3906 if( one_in( 4 ) && rng( 0, 30 ) < noise ) {
3907 while( noise > sounds[lvl].second ) {
3908 lvl++;
3909 }
3910 }
3911 add_msg( m_debug, "VEH NOISE final: %d", static_cast<int>( noise ) );
3912 vehicle_noise = static_cast<unsigned char>( noise );
3913 sounds::sound( global_pos3(), noise, sounds::sound_t::movement,
3914 _( is_rotorcraft() ? heli_noise : sounds[lvl].first ), true );
3915}

◆ open_or_close()

void vehicle::open_or_close ( int  part_index,
bool  opening 
)
private

Opens or closes an openable part at the specified index based on the @opening value passed.

If it's a multipart, opens or closes all attached parts as well.

Parameters
part_indexThe index in the parts list of the part to open or close.

Definition at line 1586 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

1587{
1588 //find_lines_of_parts() doesn't return the part_index we passed, so we set it on it's own
1589 parts[part_index].open = opening;
1590 insides_dirty = true;
1591 map &here = get_map();
1592 here.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1593 const tripoint part_location = mount_to_tripoint( parts[part_index].mount );
1594 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( part_location );
1595 const int dist = rl_dist( get_player_character().pos(), part_location );
1596 if( dist < 20 ) {
1597 sfx::play_variant_sound( opening ? "vehicle_open" : "vehicle_close",
1598 parts[ part_index ].info().get_id().str(), 100 - dist * 3 );

void vehicle::operate_planter ( )

1398{
1399 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "PLANTER" ) ) {
1400 const size_t planter_id = vp.part_index();
1401 const tripoint loc = vp.pos();
1402 vehicle_stack v = get_items( planter_id );
1403 for( auto i = v.begin(); i != v.end(); i++ ) {
1404 if( i->is_seed() ) {
1405 // If it is an "advanced model" then it will avoid damaging itself or becoming damaged. It's a real feature.
1406 if( g->m.ter( loc ) != t_dirtmound && vp.has_feature( "ADVANCED_PLANTER" ) ) {
1407 //then don't put the item there.
1408 break;
1409 } else if( g->m.ter( loc ) == t_dirtmound ) {
1410 g->m.set( loc, t_dirt, f_plant_seed );
1411 } else if( !g->m.has_flag( "PLOWABLE", loc ) ) {
1412 //If it isn't plowable terrain, then it will most likely be damaged.
1413 damage( planter_id, rng( 1, 10 ), DT_BASH, false );
1414 sounds::sound( loc, rng( 10, 20 ), sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "Clink" ), false, "smash_success",
1415 "hit_vehicle" );
1416 }
1417 if( !i->count_by_charges() || i->charges == 1 ) {
1418 i->set_age( 0_turns );
1419 g->m.add_item( loc, *i );
1420 v.erase( i );
1421 } else {
1422 item tmp = *i;
1423 tmp.charges = 1;
1424 tmp.set_age( 0_turns );
1425 g->m.add_item( loc, tmp );
1426 i->charges--;
1427 }
1428 break;
1429 }
1430 }
1431 }

1355 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "REAPER" ) ) {
1356 const size_t reaper_id = vp.part_index();
1357 const tripoint reaper_pos = vp.pos();
1358 const int plant_produced = rng( 1, vp.info().bonus );
1359 const int seed_produced = rng( 1, 3 );
1360 const units::volume max_pickup_volume = vp.info().size / 20;
1361 if( g->m.furn( reaper_pos ) != f_plant_harvest ) {
1362 continue;
1363 }
1364 // Can't use item_stack::only_item() since there might be fertilizer
1365 map_stack items = g->m.i_at( reaper_pos );
1366 map_stack::iterator seed = std::find_if( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & it ) {
1367 return it.is_seed();
1368 } );
1369 if( seed == items.end() || seed->typeId() == itype_fungal_seeds ||
1370 seed->typeId() == itype_marloss_seed ) {
1371 // Otherworldly plants, the earth-made reaper can not handle those.
1372 continue;
1373 }
1374 g->m.furn_set( reaper_pos, f_null );
1375 // Secure the seed type before i_clear destroys the item.
1376 const itype &seed_type = *seed->type;
1377 g->m.i_clear( reaper_pos );
1378 for( auto &i : iexamine::get_harvest_items(
1379 seed_type, plant_produced, seed_produced, false ) ) {
1380 g->m.add_item_or_charges( reaper_pos, i );
1381 }
1382 sounds::sound( reaper_pos, rng( 10, 25 ), sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "Swish" ), false, "vehicle",
1383 "reaper" );
1384 if( vp.has_feature( "CARGO" ) ) {
1385 for( map_stack::iterator iter = items.begin(); iter != items.end(); ) {
1386 if( ( iter->volume() <= max_pickup_volume ) &&
1387 add_item( reaper_id, *iter ) ) {
1388 iter = items.erase( iter );
1389 } else {
1390 ++iter;
1391 }
1392 }
1393 }

void vehicle::operate_scoop ( )

1435{
1436 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "SCOOP" ) ) {
1437 const size_t scoop = vp.part_index();
1438 const int chance_to_damage_item = 9;
1439 const units::volume max_pickup_volume = vp.info().size / 10;
1440 const std::array<std::string, 4> sound_msgs = {{
1441 _( "Whirrrr" ), _( "Ker-chunk" ), _( "Swish" ), _( "Cugugugugug" )
1442 }
1443 };
1444 sounds::sound( global_part_pos3( scoop ), rng( 20, 35 ), sounds::sound_t::combat,
1445 random_entry_ref( sound_msgs ), false, "vehicle", "scoop" );
1446 std::vector<tripoint> parts_points;
1447 for( const tripoint &current :
1448 g->m.points_in_radius( global_part_pos3( scoop ), 1 ) ) {
1449 parts_points.push_back( current );
1450 }
1451 for( const tripoint &position : parts_points ) {
1452 g->m.mop_spills( position );
1453 if( !g->m.has_items( position ) ) {
1454 continue;
1455 }
1456 item *that_item_there = nullptr;
1457 map_stack items = g->m.i_at( position );
1458 if( g->m.has_flag( "SEALED", position ) ) {
1459 // Ignore it. Street sweepers are not known for their ability to harvest crops.
1460 continue;
1461 }
1462 for( item &it : items ) {
1463 if( it.volume() < max_pickup_volume ) {
1464 that_item_there = &it;
1465 break;
1466 }
1467 }
1468 if( !that_item_there ) {
1469 continue;
1470 }
1471 if( one_in( chance_to_damage_item ) && that_item_there->damage() < that_item_there->max_damage() ) {
1472 //The scoop will not destroy the item, but it may damage it a bit.
1473 that_item_there->inc_damage( DT_BASH );
1474 //The scoop gets a lot louder when breaking an item.
1475 sounds::sound( position, rng( 10,
1476 that_item_there->volume() / units::legacy_volume_factor * 2 + 10 ),
1477 sounds::sound_t::combat, _( "BEEEThump" ), false, "vehicle", "scoop_thump" );
1478 }
1479 //This attempts to add the item to the scoop inventory and if successful, removes it from the map.
1480 if( add_item( scoop, *that_item_there ) ) {
1481 g->m.i_rem( position, that_item_there );
1482 } else {
1483 break;
1484 }
1485 }
1486 }
1487}
