◆ part_collision()

veh_collision vehicle::part_collision ( int  part,
const tripoint &  p,
bool  just_detect,
bool  bash_floor 
)

Definition at line 471 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

473{
474 // Vertical collisions need to be handled differently
475 // All collisions have to be either fully vertical or fully horizontal for now
476 const bool vert_coll = bash_floor || p.z != sm_pos.z;
477 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
478 const bool pl_ctrl = player_in_control( player_character );
479 Creature *critter = g->critter_at( p, true );
480 player *ph = dynamic_cast<player *>( critter );
481
482 Creature *driver = pl_ctrl ? &player_character : nullptr;
483
484 // If in a vehicle assume it's this one
485 if( ph != nullptr && ph->in_vehicle ) {
486 critter = nullptr;
487 ph = nullptr;
488 }
489
490 map &here = get_map();
491 const optional_vpart_position ovp = here.veh_at( p );
492 // Disable vehicle/critter collisions when bashing floor
493 // TODO: More elegant code
494 const bool is_veh_collision = !bash_floor && ovp && &ovp->vehicle() != this;
495 const bool is_body_collision = !bash_floor && critter != nullptr;
496
497 veh_collision ret;
498 ret.type = veh_coll_nothing;
499 ret.part = part;
500
501 // Vehicle collisions are a special case. just return the collision.
502 // The map takes care of the dynamic stuff.
503 if( is_veh_collision ) {
504 ret.type = veh_coll_veh;
505 //"imp" is too simplistic for vehicle-vehicle collisions
506 ret.target = &ovp->vehicle();
507 ret.target_part = ovp->part_index();
508 ret.target_name = ovp->vehicle().disp_name();
509 return ret;
510 }
511
512 // Typical rotor tip speed in MPH * 100.
513 int rotor_velocity = 45600;
514 // Non-vehicle collisions can't happen when the vehicle is not moving
515 int &coll_velocity = ( part_info( part ).rotor_diameter() == 0 ) ?
516 ( vert_coll ? vertical_velocity : velocity ) :
517 rotor_velocity;
518 if( !just_detect && coll_velocity == 0 ) {
519 return ret;
520 }
521
522 if( is_body_collision ) {
523 // critters on a BOARDABLE part in this vehicle aren't colliding
524 if( ovp && ( &ovp->vehicle() == this ) && get_pet( ovp->part_index() ) ) {
525 return ret;
526 }
527 // we just ran into a fish, so move it out of the way
528 if( here.has_flag( "SWIMMABLE", critter->pos() ) ) {
529 tripoint end_pos = critter->pos();
530 tripoint start_pos;
531 const units::angle angle =
532 move.dir() + 45_degrees * ( parts[part].mount.x > pivot_point().x ? -1 : 1 );
533 std::set<tripoint> &cur_points = get_points( true );
534 // push the animal out of way until it's no longer in our vehicle and not in
535 // anyone else's position
536 while( g->critter_at( end_pos, true ) ||
537 cur_points.find( end_pos ) != cur_points.end() ) {
538 start_pos = end_pos;
539 calc_ray_end( angle, 2, start_pos, end_pos );
540 }
541 critter->setpos( end_pos );
542 return ret;
543 }
544 }
545
546 // Damage armor before damaging any other parts
547 // Actually target, not just damage - spiked plating will "hit back", for example
548 const int armor_part = part_with_feature( ret.part, VPFLAG_ARMOR, true );
549 if( armor_part >= 0 ) {
550 ret.part = armor_part;
551 }
552
553 int dmg_mod = part_info( ret.part ).dmg_mod;
554 // Let's calculate type of collision & mass of object we hit
555 float mass2 = 0;
556 // e = 0 -> plastic collision
557 float e = 0.3;
558 // e = 1 -> inelastic collision
559 //part density
560 float part_dens = 0;
561
562 if( is_body_collision ) {
563 // Check any monster/NPC/player on the way
564 // body
565 ret.type = veh_coll_body;
566 ret.target = critter;
567 e = 0.30;
568 part_dens = 15;
569 mass2 = units::to_kilogram( critter->get_weight() );
570 ret.target_name = critter->disp_name();
571 } else if( ( bash_floor && here.is_bashable_ter_furn( p, true ) ) ||
572 ( here.is_bashable_ter_furn( p, false ) && here.move_cost_ter_furn( p ) != 2 &&
573 // Don't collide with tiny things, like flowers, unless we have a wheel in our space.
574 ( part_with_feature( ret.part, VPFLAG_WHEEL, true ) >= 0 ||
575 !here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "TINY", p ) ) &&
576 // Protrusions don't collide with short terrain.
577 // Tiny also doesn't, but it's already excluded unless there's a wheel present.
578 !( part_with_feature( ret.part, "PROTRUSION", true ) >= 0 &&
579 here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "SHORT", p ) ) &&
580 // These are bashable, but don't interact with vehicles.
581 !here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( "NOCOLLIDE", p ) &&
582 // Do not collide with track tiles if we can use rails
583 !( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( TFLAG_RAIL, p ) && this->can_use_rails() ) ) ) {
584 // Movecost 2 indicates flat terrain like a floor, no collision there.
585 ret.type = veh_coll_bashable;
586 terrain_collision_data( p, bash_floor, mass2, part_dens, e );
587 ret.target_name = here.disp_name( p );
588 } else if( here.impassable_ter_furn( p ) ||
589 ( bash_floor && !here.has_flag( TFLAG_NO_FLOOR, p ) ) ) {
590 // not destructible
591 ret.type = veh_coll_other;
592 mass2 = 1000;
593 e = 0.10;
594 part_dens = 80;
595 ret.target_name = here.disp_name( p );
596 }
597
598 if( ret.type == veh_coll_nothing || just_detect ) {
599 // Hit nothing or we aren't actually hitting
600 return ret;
601 }
602 stop_autodriving();
603 // Calculate mass AFTER checking for collision
604 // because it involves iterating over all cargo
605 // Rotors only use rotor mass in calculation.
606 const float mass = ( part_info( part ).rotor_diameter() > 0 ) ?
607 to_kilogram( parts[ part ].base.weight() ) : to_kilogram( total_mass() );
608
609 //Calculate damage resulting from d_E
610 const material_id_list &mats = part_info( ret.part ).item->materials;
611 float vpart_dens = 0;
612 if( !mats.empty() ) {
613 for( auto &mat_id : mats ) {
614 vpart_dens += mat_id.obj().density();
615 }
616 // average
617 vpart_dens /= mats.size();
618 }
619
620 //k=100 -> 100% damage on part
621 //k=0 -> 100% damage on obj
622 float material_factor = ( part_dens - vpart_dens ) * 0.5;
623 material_factor = std::max( -25.0f, std::min( 25.0f, material_factor ) );
624 // factor = -25 if mass is much greater than mass2
625 // factor = +25 if mass2 is much greater than mass
626 const float weight_factor = mass >= mass2 ?
627 -25 * ( std::log( mass ) - std::log( mass2 ) ) / std::log( mass ) :
628 25 * ( std::log( mass2 ) - std::log( mass ) ) / std::log( mass2 );
629
630 float k = 50 + material_factor + weight_factor;
631 k = std::max( 10.0f, std::min( 90.0f, k ) );
632
633 bool smashed = true;
634 const std::string snd = _( "smash!" );
635 float dmg = 0.0f;
636 float part_dmg = 0.0f;
637 // Calculate Impulse of car
638 time_duration time_stunned = 0_turns;
639
640 const int prev_velocity = coll_velocity;
641 const int vel_sign = sgn( coll_velocity );
642 // Velocity of the object we're hitting
643 // Assuming it starts at 0, but we'll probably hit it many times
644 // in one collision, so accumulate the velocity gain from each hit.
645 float vel2 = 0.0f;
646 do {
647 smashed = false;
648 // Impulse of vehicle
649 const float vel1 = coll_velocity / 100.0f;
650 // Velocity of car after collision
651 const float vel1_a = ( mass * vel1 + mass2 * vel2 + e * mass2 * ( vel2 - vel1 ) ) /
652 ( mass + mass2 );
653 // Velocity of object after collision
654 const float vel2_a = ( mass * vel1 + mass2 * vel2 + e * mass * ( vel1 - vel2 ) ) / ( mass + mass2 );
655 // Lost energy at collision -> deformation energy -> damage
656 const float E_before = 0.5f * ( mass * vel1 * vel1 ) + 0.5f * ( mass2 * vel2 * vel2 );
657 const float E_after = 0.5f * ( mass * vel1_a * vel1_a ) + 0.5f * ( mass2 * vel2_a * vel2_a );
658 const float d_E = E_before - E_after;
659 if( d_E <= 0 ) {
660 // Deformation energy is signed
661 // If it's negative, it means something went wrong
662 // But it still does happen sometimes...
663 if( std::fabs( vel1_a ) < std::fabs( vel1 ) ) {
664 // Lower vehicle's speed to prevent infinite loops
665 coll_velocity = vel1_a * 90;
666 }
667 if( std::fabs( vel2_a ) > std::fabs( vel2 ) ) {
668 vel2 = vel2_a;
669 }
670 // this causes infinite loop
671 if( mass2 == 0 ) {
672 mass2 = 1;
673 }
674 continue;
675 }
676
677 add_msg( m_debug, "Deformation energy: %.2f", d_E );
678 // Damage calculation
679 // Damage dealt overall
680 dmg += d_E / 400;
681 // Damage for vehicle-part
682 // Always if no critters, otherwise if critter is real
683 if( critter == nullptr || !critter->is_hallucination() ) {
684 part_dmg = dmg * k / 100;
685 add_msg( m_debug, "Part collision damage: %.2f", part_dmg );
686 }
687 // Damage for object
688 const float obj_dmg = dmg * ( 100 - k ) / 100;
689
690 if( ret.type == veh_coll_bashable ) {
691 // Something bashable -- use map::bash to determine outcome
692 // NOTE: Floor bashing disabled for balance reasons
693 // Floor values are still used to set damage dealt to vehicle
694 smashed = here.is_bashable_ter_furn( p, false ) &&
695 here.bash_resistance( p, bash_floor ) <= obj_dmg &&
696 here.bash( p, obj_dmg, false, false, false, this ).success;
697 if( smashed ) {
698 if( here.is_bashable_ter_furn( p, bash_floor ) ) {
699 // There's new terrain there to smash
700 smashed = false;
701 terrain_collision_data( p, bash_floor, mass2, part_dens, e );
702 ret.target_name = here.disp_name( p );
703 } else if( here.impassable_ter_furn( p ) ) {
704 // There's new terrain there, but we can't smash it!
705 smashed = false;
706 ret.type = veh_coll_other;
707 mass2 = 1000;
708 e = 0.10;
709 part_dens = 80;
710 ret.target_name = here.disp_name( p );
711 }
712 }
713 } else if( ret.type == veh_coll_body ) {
714 int dam = obj_dmg * dmg_mod / 100;
715
716 // We know critter is set for this type. Assert to inform static
717 // analysis.
718 assert( critter );
719
720 // No blood from hallucinations
721 if( !critter->is_hallucination() ) {
722 if( part_flag( ret.part, "SHARP" ) ) {
723 parts[ret.part].blood += ( 20 + dam ) * 5;
724 } else if( dam > rng( 10, 30 ) ) {
725 parts[ret.part].blood += ( 10 + dam / 2 ) * 5;
726 }
727
728 check_environmental_effects = true;
729 }
730
731 time_stunned = time_duration::from_turns( ( rng( 0, dam ) > 10 ) + ( rng( 0, dam ) > 40 ) );
732 if( time_stunned > 0_turns ) {
733 critter->add_effect( effect_stunned, time_stunned );
734 }
735
736 if( ph != nullptr ) {
737 ph->hitall( dam, 40, driver );
738 } else {
739 const int armor = part_flag( ret.part, "SHARP" ) ?
740 critter->get_armor_cut( bodypart_id( "torso" ) ) :
741 critter->get_armor_bash( bodypart_id( "torso" ) );
742 dam = std::max( 0, dam - armor );
743 critter->apply_damage( driver, bodypart_id( "torso" ), dam );
744 add_msg( m_debug, "Critter collision damage: %d", dam );
745 }
746
747 // Don't fling if vertical - critter got smashed into the ground
748 if( !vert_coll ) {
749 if( std::fabs( vel2_a ) > 10.0f ||
750 std::fabs( e * mass * vel1_a ) > std::fabs( mass2 * ( 10.0f - vel2_a ) ) ) {
751 const units::angle angle = rng_float( -60_degrees, 60_degrees );
752 // Also handle the weird case when we don't have enough force
753 // but still have to push (in such case compare momentum)
754 const float push_force = std::max<float>( std::fabs( vel2_a ), 10.1f );
755 // move.dir is where the vehicle is facing. If velocity is negative,
756 // we're moving backwards and have to adjust the angle accordingly.
757 const units::angle angle_sum =
758 angle + move.dir() + ( vel2_a > 0 ? 0_degrees : 180_degrees );
759 g->fling_creature( critter, angle_sum, push_force );
760 } else if( std::fabs( vel2_a ) > std::fabs( vel2 ) ) {
761 vel2 = vel2_a;
762 } else {
763 // Vehicle's momentum isn't big enough to push the critter
764 velocity = 0;
765 break;
766 }
767
768 if( critter->is_dead_state() ) {
769 smashed = true;
770 } else if( critter != nullptr ) {
771 // Only count critter as pushed away if it actually changed position
772 smashed = critter->pos() != p;
773 }
774 }
775 }
776
777 if( critter == nullptr || !critter->is_hallucination() ) {
778 coll_velocity = vel1_a * ( smashed ? 100 : 90 );
779 }
780 // Stop processing when sign inverts, not when we reach 0
781 } while( !smashed && sgn( coll_velocity ) == vel_sign );
782
783 // Apply special effects from collision.
784 if( critter != nullptr ) {
785 if( !critter->is_hallucination() ) {
786 if( pl_ctrl ) {
787 if( time_stunned > 0_turns ) {
788 //~ 1$s - vehicle name, 2$s - part name, 3$s - NPC or monster
789 add_msg( m_warning, _( "Your %1$s's %2$s rams into %3$s and stuns it!" ),
790 name, parts[ ret.part ].name(), ret.target_name );
791 } else {
792 //~ 1$s - vehicle name, 2$s - part name, 3$s - NPC or monster
793 add_msg( m_warning, _( "Your %1$s's %2$s rams into %3$s!" ),
794 name, parts[ ret.part ].name(), ret.target_name );
795 }
796 }
797
798 if( part_flag( ret.part, "SHARP" ) ) {
799 critter->bleed();
800 } else {
801 sounds::sound( p, 20, sounds::sound_t::combat, snd, false, "smash_success", "hit_vehicle" );
802 }
803 }
804 } else {
805 if( pl_ctrl ) {
806 if( !snd.empty() ) {
807 //~ 1$s - vehicle name, 2$s - part name, 3$s - collision object name, 4$s - sound message
808 add_msg( m_warning, _( "Your %1$s's %2$s rams into %3$s with a %4$s" ),
809 name, parts[ ret.part ].name(), ret.target_name, snd );
810 } else {
811 //~ 1$s - vehicle name, 2$s - part name, 3$s - collision object name
812 add_msg( m_warning, _( "Your %1$s's %2$s rams into %3$s." ),
813 name, parts[ ret.part ].name(), ret.target_name );
814 }
815 }
816
817 sounds::sound( p, smashed ? 80 : 50, sounds::sound_t::combat, snd, false, "smash_success",
818 "hit_vehicle" );
819 }
820
821 if( smashed && !vert_coll ) {
822 int turn_amount = rng( 1, 3 ) * std::sqrt( static_cast<double>( part_dmg ) );
823 turn_amount /= 15;
824 if( turn_amount < 1 ) {
825 turn_amount = 1;
826 }
827 turn_amount *= 15;
828 if( turn_amount > 120 ) {
829 turn_amount = 120;
830 }
831 int turn_roll = rng( 0, 100 );
832 // Probability of skidding increases with higher delta_v
833 if( turn_roll < std::abs( ( prev_velocity - coll_velocity ) / 100.0f * 2.0f ) ) {
834 //delta_v = vel1 - vel1_a
835 //delta_v = 50 mph -> 100% probability of skidding
836 //delta_v = 25 mph -> 50% probability of skidding
837 skidding = true;
838 turn( units::from_degrees( one_in( 2 ) ? turn_amount : -turn_amount ) );
839 }
840 }
841
842 ret.imp = part_dmg;
843 return ret;
844}
bodypart_id
int_id< body_part_type > bodypart_id
Definition: bodypart.h:23

◆ part_displayed_at()

int vehicle::part_displayed_at ( const point &  dp) const

Returns which part (as an index into the parts list) is the one that will be displayed for the given square.

Returns -1 if there are no parts in that square.

Parameters
dpThe local coordinate.
Returns
The index of the part that will be displayed.

◆ part_vpower_w()

int vehicle::part_vpower_w ( int  index,
bool  at_full_hp = false 
) const
private
Strength increases power produced for MUSCLE_* vehicles

wind-powered vehicles have differing power depending on wind direction

Definition at line 1149 of file vehicle.cpp.

1150{
1151 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ index ];
1152 int pwr = vp.info().power;
1153 if( part_flag( index, VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
1154 if( pwr == 0 ) {
1155 pwr = vhp_to_watts( vp.base.engine_displacement() );
1156 }
1157 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
1158 monster *mon = get_pet( index );
1159 if( mon != nullptr && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
1160 // An animal that can carry twice as much weight, can pull a cart twice as hard.
1161 pwr = mon->get_speed() * mon->get_size() * 3
1162 * ( mon->get_mountable_weight_ratio() * 5 );
1163 } else {
1164 pwr = 0;
1165 }
1166 }
1167 ///\EFFECT_STR increases power produced for MUSCLE_* vehicles
1168 pwr += ( g->u.str_cur - 8 ) * part_info( index ).engine_muscle_power_factor();
1169 /// wind-powered vehicles have differing power depending on wind direction
1170 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_wind ) {
1171 const weather_manager &weather = get_weather();
1172 int windpower = weather.windspeed;
1173 rl_vec2d windvec;
1174 double raddir = ( ( weather.winddirection + 180 ) % 360 ) * ( M_PI / 180 );
1175 windvec = windvec.normalized();
1176 windvec.y = -std::cos( raddir );
1177 windvec.x = std::sin( raddir );
1178 rl_vec2d fv = face_vec();
1179 double dot = windvec.dot_product( fv );
1180 if( dot <= 0 ) {
1181 dot = std::min( -0.1, dot );
1182 } else {
1183 dot = std::max( 0.1, dot );
1184 }
1185 int windeffectint = static_cast<int>( ( windpower * dot ) * 200 );
1186 pwr = std::max( 1, pwr + windeffectint );
1187 }
1188 }
1189
1190 if( pwr < 0 ) {
1191 return pwr; // Consumers always draw full power, even if broken
1192 }
1193 if( at_full_hp ) {
1194 return pwr; // Assume full hp
1195 }
1196 // Damaged engines give less power, but some engines handle it better
1197 double health = parts[index].health_percent();
1198 // dpf is 0 for engines that scale power linearly with damage and
1199 // provides a floor otherwise
1200 float dpf = part_info( index ).engine_damaged_power_factor();
1201 double effective_percent = dpf + ( ( 1 - dpf ) * health );
1202 return static_cast<int>( pwr * effective_percent );
1203}

virtual int get_speed() const
Definition: creature.cpp:1504

for combustion engines the displacement (cc)

◆ pivot_displacement()

point vehicle::pivot_displacement ( ) const

Definition at line 3344 of file vehicle.cpp.

3345{
3346 // precalc_mounts always produces a result that puts the pivot point at (0,0).
3347 // If the pivot point changes, this artificially moves the vehicle, as the position
3348 // of the old pivot point will appear to move from (posx+0, posy+0) to some other point
3349 // (posx+dx,posy+dy) even if there is no change in vehicle position or rotation.
3350 // This method finds that movement so it can be canceled out when actually moving
3351 // the vehicle.
3352
3353 // rotate the old pivot point around the new pivot point with the old rotation angle
3354 tripoint dp;
3355 coord_translate( pivot_rotation[0], pivot_anchor[1], pivot_anchor[0], dp );
3356 return dp.xy();
3357}

References coord_translate(), pivot_anchor, pivot_rotation, and tripoint::xy().

Referenced by map::move_vehicle().

◆ pldrive()

void vehicle::pldrive ( Character &  driver,
const point &  p,
int  z = 0 
)

Player is driving the vehicle.

Parameters
pdirection player is steering
zfor vertical movement - e.g helicopters
Dexterity reduces chance of losing control of vehicle when turning Perception reduces chance of losing control of vehicle when turning Driving reduces chance of losing control of vehicle when turning Dexterity increases chance of regaining control of a vehicle Driving increases chance of regaining control of a vehicle

Definition at line 1067 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

1068{
1069 if( z != 0 && is_rotorcraft() ) {
1070 driver.moves = std::min( driver.moves, 0 );
1071 thrust( 0, z );
1072 }
1073 units::angle turn_delta = 15_degrees * p.x;
1074 const float handling_diff = handling_difficulty();
1075 if( turn_delta != 0_degrees ) {
1076 float eff = steering_effectiveness();
1077 if( eff == -2 ) {
1078 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_info,
1079 _( "You cannot steer an animal-drawn vehicle with no animal harnessed." ) );
1080 return;
1081 }
1082
1083 if( eff < 0 ) {
1084 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_info,
1085 _( "This vehicle has no steering system installed, you can't turn it." ) );
1086 return;
1087 }
1088
1089 if( eff == 0 ) {
1090 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_bad, _( "The steering is completely broken!" ) );
1091 return;
1092 }
1093
1094 // If you've got more moves than speed, it's most likely time stop
1095 // Let's get rid of that
1096 driver.moves = std::min( driver.moves, driver.get_speed() );
1097
1098 ///\EFFECT_DEX reduces chance of losing control of vehicle when turning
1099
1100 ///\EFFECT_PER reduces chance of losing control of vehicle when turning
1101
1102 ///\EFFECT_DRIVING reduces chance of losing control of vehicle when turning
1103 float skill = std::min( 10.0f, driver.get_skill_level( skill_driving ) +
1104 ( driver.get_dex() + driver.get_per() ) / 10.0f );
1105 float penalty = rng_float( 0.0f, handling_diff ) - skill;
1106 int cost;
1107 if( penalty > 0.0f ) {
1108 // At 10 penalty (rather hard to get), we're taking 4 turns per turn
1109 cost = 100 * ( 1.0f + penalty / 2.5f );
1110 } else {
1111 // At 10 skill, with a perfect vehicle, we could turn up to 3 times per turn
1112 cost = std::max( driver.get_speed(), 100 ) * ( 1.0f - ( -penalty / 10.0f ) * 2 / 3 );
1113 }
1114
1115 if( penalty > skill || cost > 400 ) {
1116 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "You fumble with the %s's controls." ), name );
1117 // Anything from a wasted attempt to 2 turns in the intended direction
1118 turn_delta *= rng( 0, 2 );
1119 // Also wastes next turn
1120 cost = std::max( cost, driver.moves + 100 );
1121 } else if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
1122 // Don't warn all the time or it gets spammy
1123 if( cost >= driver.get_speed() * 2 ) {
1124 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "It takes you a very long time to steer that vehicle!" ) );
1125 } else if( cost >= driver.get_speed() * 1.5f ) {
1126 driver.add_msg_if_player( m_warning, _( "It takes you a long time to steer that vehicle!" ) );
1127 }
1128 }
1129
1130 turn( turn_delta );
1131
1132 // At most 3 turns per turn, because otherwise it looks really weird and jumpy
1133 driver.moves -= std::max( cost, driver.get_speed() / 3 + 1 );
1134 }
1135
1136 if( p.y != 0 ) {
1137 int thr_amount = 100 * ( std::abs( velocity ) < 2000 ? 4 : 5 );
1138 if( cruise_on ) {
1139 cruise_thrust( -p.y * thr_amount );
1140 } else {
1141 thrust( -p.y );
1142 driver.moves = std::min( driver.moves, 0 );
1143 }
1144 }
1145
1146 // TODO: Actually check if we're on land on water (or disable water-skidding)
1147 // Only check for recovering from a skid if we did active steering (not cruise control).
1148 if( skidding && ( p.x != 0 || ( p.y != 0 && !cruise_on ) ) && valid_wheel_config() ) {
1149 ///\EFFECT_DEX increases chance of regaining control of a vehicle
1150
1151 ///\EFFECT_DRIVING increases chance of regaining control of a vehicle
1152 if( handling_diff * rng( 1, 10 ) <
1153 driver.dex_cur + driver.get_skill_level( skill_driving ) * 2 ) {
1154 driver.add_msg_if_player( _( "You regain control of the %s." ), name );
1155 driver.as_player()->practice( skill_driving, velocity / 5 );
1156 velocity = static_cast<int>( forward_velocity() );
1157 skidding = false;
1158 move.init( turn_dir );
1159 }
1160 }
1161}

◆ possibly_recover_from_skid()

void vehicle::possibly_recover_from_skid ( )

Definition at line 1164 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

1165{
1166 if( last_turn > 13_degrees ) {
1167 // Turning on the initial skid is delayed, so move==face, initially. This filters out that case.
1168 return;
1169 }
1170
1171 rl_vec2d mv = move_vec();
1172 rl_vec2d fv = face_vec();
1173 float dot = mv.dot_product( fv );
1174 // Threshold of recovery is Gaussianesque.
1175
1176 if( std::fabs( dot ) * 100 > dice( 9, 20 ) ) {
1177 add_msg( _( "The %s recovers from its skid." ), name );
1178 // face_vec takes over.
1179 skidding = false;
1180 // Wheels absorb horizontal velocity.
1181 velocity *= dot;
1182 if( dot < -.8 ) {
1183 // Pointed backwards, velo-wise.
1184 // Move backwards.
1185 velocity *= -1;
1186 }
1187
1188 move = face;
1189 }
1190}

◆ power_parts()

void vehicle::power_parts ( )

Definition at line 4799 of file vehicle.cpp.

4800{
4801 update_alternator_load();
4802 // Things that drain energy: engines and accessories.
4803 int engine_epower = total_engine_epower_w();
4804 int epower = engine_epower + total_accessory_epower_w() + total_alternator_epower_w();
4805
4806 int delta_energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower, 1_turns );
4807 int storage_deficit_bat = std::max( 0, fuel_capacity( fuel_type_battery ) -
4808 fuel_left( fuel_type_battery ) - delta_energy_bat );
4809 // Reactors trigger only on demand. If we'd otherwise run out of power, see
4810 // if we can spin up the reactors.
4811 if( !reactors.empty() && storage_deficit_bat > 0 ) {
4812 // Still not enough surplus epower to fully charge battery
4813 // Produce additional epower from any reactors
4814 bool reactor_working = false;
4815 bool reactor_online = false;
4816 for( auto &elem : reactors ) {
4817 // Check whether the reactor is on. If not, move on.
4818 if( !is_part_on( elem ) ) {
4819 continue;
4820 }
4821 // Keep track whether or not the vehicle has any reactors activated
4822 reactor_online = true;
4823 // the amount of energy the reactor generates each turn
4824 const int gen_energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( part_epower_w( elem ), 1_turns );
4825 if( parts[ elem ].is_unavailable() ) {
4826 continue;
4827 } else if( parts[ elem ].info().has_flag( flag_PERPETUAL ) ) {
4828 reactor_working = true;
4829 delta_energy_bat += std::min( storage_deficit_bat, gen_energy_bat );
4830 } else if( parts[elem].ammo_remaining() > 0 ) {
4831 // Efficiency: one unit of fuel is this many units of battery
4832 // Note: One battery is 1 kJ
4833 const int efficiency = part_info( elem ).power;
4834 const int avail_fuel = parts[elem].ammo_remaining() * efficiency;
4835 const int elem_energy_bat = std::min( gen_energy_bat, avail_fuel );
4836 // Cap output at what we can achieve and utilize
4837 const int reactors_output_bat = std::min( elem_energy_bat, storage_deficit_bat );
4838 // Fuel consumed in actual units of the resource
4839 int fuel_consumed = reactors_output_bat / efficiency;
4840 // Remainder has a chance of resulting in more fuel consumption
4841 fuel_consumed += x_in_y( reactors_output_bat % efficiency, efficiency ) ? 1 : 0;
4842 parts[ elem ].ammo_consume( fuel_consumed, global_part_pos3( elem ) );
4843 reactor_working = true;
4844 delta_energy_bat += reactors_output_bat;
4845 }
4846 }
4847
4848 if( !reactor_working && reactor_online ) {
4849 // All reactors out of fuel or destroyed
4850 for( auto &elem : reactors ) {
4851 parts[ elem ].enabled = false;
4852 }
4853 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4854 add_msg( _( "The %s's reactor dies!" ), name );
4855 }
4856 }
4857 }
4858
4859 int battery_deficit = 0;
4860 if( delta_energy_bat > 0 ) {
4861 // store epower surplus in battery
4862 charge_battery( delta_energy_bat );
4863 } else if( epower < 0 ) {
4864 // draw epower deficit from battery
4865 battery_deficit = discharge_battery( std::abs( delta_energy_bat ) );
4866 }
4867
4868 if( battery_deficit != 0 ) {
4869 // Scoops need a special case since they consume power during actual use
4870 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "SCOOP" ) ) {
4871 vp.part().enabled = false;
4872 }
4873 // Rechargers need special case since they consume power on demand
4874 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( "RECHARGE" ) ) {
4875 vp.part().enabled = false;
4876 }
4877
4878 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_enabled_parts( VPFLAG_ENABLED_DRAINS_EPOWER ) ) {
4879 vehicle_part &pt = vp.part();
4880 if( pt.info().epower < 0 ) {
4881 pt.enabled = false;
4882 }
4883 }
4884
4885 is_alarm_on = false;
4886 camera_on = false;
4887 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4888 add_msg( _( "The %s's battery dies!" ), name );
4889 }
4890 if( engine_epower < 0 ) {
4891 // Not enough epower to run gas engine ignition system
4892 engine_on = false;
4893 if( player_in_control( g->u ) || g->u.sees( global_pos3() ) ) {
4894 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine dies!" ), name );
4895 }
4896 }
4897 }
4898}

◆ power_to_energy_bat()

int vehicle::power_to_energy_bat ( int  power_w,
const time_duration &  d 
) const
private

Definition at line 1217 of file vehicle.cpp.

1218{
1219 // Integrate constant epower (watts) over time to get units of battery energy
1220 // Thousands of watts over millions of seconds can happen, so 32-bit int
1221 // insufficient.
1222 int64_t energy_j = power_w * to_seconds<int64_t>( d );
1223 int energy_bat = energy_j / bat_energy_j;
1224 int sign = power_w >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
1225 // energy_bat remainder results in chance at additional charge/discharge
1226 energy_bat += x_in_y( std::abs( energy_j % bat_energy_j ), bat_energy_j ) ? sign : 0;
1227 return energy_bat;
1228}
sign

sign
constexpr T sign(T x)

410{
411 const char fsyms[5] = { 'E', '\\', '|', '/', 'F' };

416 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-text-style): not an ellipsis

418 int amnt = cap > 0 ? f_left * 99 / cap : 0;
419 int indf = ( amnt / 20 ) % 5;
420 mvwprintz( win, p + point( indf, 0 ), f_color, "%c", fsyms[indf] );

431 }

433 auto fuel_data = fuel_usages.find( fuel_type );
434 int rate = 0;
435 std::string units;
436 if( fuel_data != fuel_usages.end() ) {
437 rate = -consumption_per_hour( fuel_type, fuel_data->second );
438 units = _( "mL" );
439 }
440 if( fuel_type == itype_id( "battery" ) ) {
441 rate += power_to_energy_bat( net_battery_charge_rate_w(), 1_hours );
442 units = _( "kJ" );
443 }
444 if( rate != 0 ) {
445 int tank_use = 0;
446 nc_color tank_color = c_light_green;
447 std::string tank_goal = _( "full" );
448 if( rate > 0 ) {
449 tank_use = cap - f_left;
450 if( !tank_use ) {
451 return;
452 }
453 } else {
454 if( !f_left ) {
455 return;
456 }
457 tank_use = f_left;
458 tank_color = c_light_red;
459 tank_goal = _( "empty" );
460 }
461
462 item fitem( fuel_type );
463 int charges_per_L = fitem.charges_per_volume( 1_liter );
464 if( charges_per_L == 0 || charges_per_L == item::INFINITE_CHARGES ) {
465 return;
466 }
467 float charges_per_mL = charges_per_L / 1000.0f;
468 tank_use = tank_use / charges_per_mL;
469
470 // promote to double so esimate doesn't overflow for high fuel values
471 // 3600 * tank_use overflows signed 32 bit when tank_use is over ~596523
472 double turns = to_turns<double>( 60_minutes );
473 time_duration estimate = time_duration::from_turns( turns * tank_use / std::abs( rate ) );
474
475 if( debug_mode ) {
476 wprintz( win, tank_color, _( ", %d %s(%4.2f%%)/hour, %s until %s" ),
477 rate, units, 100.0 * rate / cap, to_string_clipped( estimate ), tank_goal );
478 } else {
479 wprintz( win, tank_color, _( ", %3.1f%% / hour, %s until %s" ),
480 100.0 * rate / cap, to_string_clipped( estimate ), tank_goal );
481 }
482 }
483 }

◆ print_vparts_descs()

void vehicle::print_vparts_descs ( const catacurses::window &  win,
int  max_y,
int  width,
int  p,
int &  start_at,
int &  start_limit 
) const

Prints a list of descriptions for all parts to the screen inside of a boxed window.

Parameters
winThe window to draw in.
max_yDraw no further than this y-coordinate.
widthThe width of the window.
pThe index of the part being examined.
start_atWhich vehicle part to start printing at.
start_limitthe part index beyond which the display is full

Definition at line 250 of file vehicle_display.cpp.

252{
253 if( p < 0 || p >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
254 return;
255 }
256
257 std::vector<int> pl = this->parts_at_relative( parts[p].mount, true );
258 std::string msg;
259
260 int lines = 0;
261 /*
262 * start_at and start_limit interaction is little tricky
263 * start_at and start_limit start at 0 when moving to a new frame
264 * if all the descriptions are displayed in the window, start_limit stays at 0 and
265 * start_at is capped at 0 - so no scrolling at all.
266 * if all the descriptions aren't displayed, start_limit jumps to the last displayed part
267 * and the next scrollthrough can start there - so scrolling down happens.
268 * when the scroll reaches the point where all the remaining descriptions are displayed in
269 * the window, start_limit is set to start_at again.
270 * on the next attempted scrolldown, start_limit is set to the nth item, and start_at is
271 * capped to the nth item, so no more scrolling down.
272 * start_at can always go down, but never below 0, so scrolling up is only possible after
273 * some scrolling down has occurred.
274 * important! the calling function needs to track p, start_at, and start_limit, and set
275 * start_limit to 0 if p changes.
276 */
277 start_at = std::max( 0, std::min( start_at, start_limit ) );
278 if( start_at ) {
279 msg += std::string( "<color_yellow>" ) + "< " + _( "More parts here" ) + "</color>\n";
280 lines += 1;
281 }
282 for( size_t i = start_at; i < pl.size(); i++ ) {
283 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ pl [ i ] ];
284 std::string possible_msg;
285 const nc_color name_color = vp.is_broken() ? c_dark_gray : c_light_green;
286 possible_msg += colorize( vp.name(), name_color ) + "\n";
287 const nc_color desc_color = vp.is_broken() ? c_dark_gray : c_light_gray;
288 // -4 = -2 for left & right padding + -2 for "> "
289 int new_lines = 2 + vp.info().format_description( possible_msg, desc_color, width - 4 );
290 if( vp.has_flag( vehicle_part::carrying_flag ) ) {
291 possible_msg += " Carrying a vehicle on a rack.\n";
292 new_lines += 1;
293 }
294 if( vp.has_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag ) ) {
295 possible_msg += string_format( " Part of a %s carried on a rack.\n",
296 vp.carried_name() );
297 new_lines += 1;
298 }
299
300 possible_msg += "</color>\n";
301 if( lines + new_lines <= max_y ) {
302 msg += possible_msg;
303 lines += new_lines;
304 start_limit = start_at;
305 } else {
306 msg += std::string( "<color_yellow>" ) + _( "More parts here" ) + " >" + "</color>\n";
307 start_limit = i;
308 break;
309 }
310 }
311 werase( win );
312 // -2 for left & right padding
313 // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-use-named-point-constants)
314 fold_and_print( win, point( 1, 0 ), width - 2, c_light_gray, msg );
315 wnoutrefresh( win );
316}
vpart_info::format_description

◆ refresh()

void vehicle::refresh ( )
private

Refreshes all caches and refinds all parts.

Used after the vehicle has had a part added or removed. Makes indices of different part types so they're easy to find. Also calculates power drain.

Definition at line 5656 of file vehicle.cpp.

5687 return veh->part_info( p1 ).list_order < veh->part_info( p2 ).list_order;
5688 }
5689 } svpv = { this };
5690
5691 mount_min.x = 123;
5692 mount_min.y = 123;
5693 mount_max.x = -123;

5699 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {

5703 continue;
5704 }
5705 refresh_done = true;
5706

5708 const point pt = vp.mount();
5709 mount_min.x = std::min( mount_min.x, pt.x );

5711 mount_max.x = std::max( mount_max.x, pt.x );
5712 mount_max.y = std::max( mount_max.y, pt.y );

5716 relative_parts[pt].end(),
5717 static_cast<int>( p ), svpv );
5718 relative_parts[pt].insert( vii, p );
5719
5720 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_FLOATS ) ) {
5721 floating.push_back( p );
5722 }
5723
5724 if( vp.part().is_unavailable() ) {
5725 continue;
5726 }
5727 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ALTERNATOR ) ) {
5728 alternators.push_back( p );
5729 }
5730 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ENGINE ) ) {
5731 engines.push_back( p );
5732 }
5733 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_REACTOR ) ) {
5734 reactors.push_back( p );
5735 }

5737 solar_panels.push_back( p );
5738 }
5739 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_ROTOR ) ) {
5740 rotors.push_back( p );
5741 }
5742 if( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_TURBINE" ) ) {
5743 wind_turbines.push_back( p );
5744 }
5745 if( vpi.has_flag( "WIND_POWERED" ) ) {
5746 sails.push_back( p );
5747 }
5748 if( vpi.has_flag( "WATER_WHEEL" ) ) {
5749 water_wheels.push_back( p );
5750 }
5751 if( vpi.has_flag( "FUNNEL" ) ) {
5752 funnels.push_back( p );
5753 }
5754 if( vpi.has_flag( "UNMOUNT_ON_MOVE" ) ) {
5755 loose_parts.push_back( p );
5756 }
5757 if( vpi.has_flag( "EMITTER" ) ) {
5758 emitters.push_back( p );
5759 }
5760 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_WHEEL ) ) {
5761 wheelcache.push_back( p );
5762 }
5763 if( vpi.has_flag( VPFLAG_RAIL ) ) {
5764 rail_wheelcache.push_back( p );

5767 const auto it = std::find( rail_profile.cbegin(), rail_profile.cend(), rail_pos );
5768 if( it == rail_profile.cend() ) {
5769 rail_profile.push_back( rail_pos );
5770 }

5773 vpi.has_flag( "TRACKED" ) ) {
5774 // TRACKED contributes to steering effectiveness but
5775 // (a) doesn't count as a steering axle for install difficulty
5776 // (b) still contributes to drag for the center of steering calculation
5777 steering.push_back( p );
5778 }

5780 speciality.push_back( p );

5783 extra_drag += vpi.power;
5784 }

5786 vpi.has_flag( "WATER_WHEEL" ) ) ) {
5787 extra_drag += vpi.power;
5788 }

5790 vp.part().enabled = true;
5791 } else if( !camera_on && vpi.has_flag( "CAMERA" ) ) {
5792 vp.part().enabled = false;
5793 }
5794 if( vpi.has_flag( "TURRET" ) && !has_part( global_part_pos3( vp.part() ), "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
5795 vp.part().enabled = false;
5796 }
5797 }
5798
5799 front_left.x = mount_max.x;
5800 front_left.y = mount_min.y;
5801 front_right = mount_max;
5802
5803 if( !refresh_done ) {
5804 mount_min = mount_max = point_zero;
5805 }

5807 refresh_position();

◆ refresh_insides()

void vehicle::refresh_insides ( )

Definition at line 6296 of file vehicle.cpp.

6297{
6298 if( !insides_dirty ) {
6299 return;
6300 }
6301 insides_dirty = false;
6302 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6303 const size_t p = vp.part_index();
6304 if( vp.part().removed ) {
6305 continue;
6306 }
6307 /* If there's no roof, or there is a roof but it's broken, it's outside.
6308 * (Use short-circuiting && so broken frames don't screw this up) */
6309 if( !( part_with_feature( p, "ROOF", true ) >= 0 && vp.part().is_available() ) ) {
6310 vp.part().inside = false;
6311 continue;
6312 }
6313
6314 // inside if not otherwise
6315 parts[p].inside = true;
6316 // let's check four neighbor parts
6317 for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
6318 point near_mount = parts[ p ].mount + offset;
6319 std::vector<int> parts_n3ar = parts_at_relative( near_mount, true );
6320 // if we aren't covered from sides, the roof at p won't save us
6321 bool cover = false;
6322 for( auto &j : parts_n3ar ) {
6323 // another roof -- cover
6324 if( part_flag( j, "ROOF" ) && parts[ j ].is_available() ) {
6325 cover = true;
6326 break;
6327 } else if( part_flag( j, "OBSTACLE" ) && parts[ j ].is_available() ) {
6328 // found an obstacle, like board or windshield or door
6329 if( parts[j].inside || ( part_flag( j, "OPENABLE" ) && parts[j].open ) ) {
6330 // door and it's open -- can't cover
6331 continue;
6332 }
6333 cover = true;
6334 break;
6335 }
6336 //Otherwise keep looking, there might be another part in that square
6337 }
6338 if( !cover ) {
6339 vp.part().inside = false;
6340 break;
6341 }
6342 }
6343 }
6344}

◆ refresh_pivot()

void vehicle::refresh_pivot ( ) const
private

Definition at line 5835 of file vehicle.cpp.

5836{
5837 // Const method, but messes with mutable fields
5838 pivot_dirty = false;
5839
5840 if( wheelcache.empty() || !valid_wheel_config() ) {
5841 // No usable wheels, use CoM (dragging)
5842 pivot_cache = local_center_of_mass();
5843 return;
5844 }
5845
5846 // The model here is:
5847 //
5848 // We are trying to rotate around some point (xc,yc)
5849 // This produces a friction force / moment from each wheel resisting the
5850 // rotation. We want to find the point that minimizes that resistance.
5851 //
5852 // For a given wheel w at (xw,yw), find:
5853 // weight(w): a scaling factor for the friction force based on wheel
5854 // size, brokenness, steerability/orientation
5855 // center_dist: the distance from (xw,yw) to (xc,yc)
5856 // centerline_angle: the angle between the X axis and a line through
5857 // (xw,yw) and (xc,yc)
5858 //
5859 // Decompose the force into two components, assuming that the wheel is
5860 // aligned along the X axis and we want to apply different weightings to
5861 // the in-line vs perpendicular parts of the force:
5862 //
5863 // Resistance force in line with the wheel (X axis)
5864 // Fi = weightI(w) * center_dist * sin(centerline_angle)
5865 // Resistance force perpendicular to the wheel (Y axis):
5866 // Fp = weightP(w) * center_dist * cos(centerline_angle);
5867 //
5868 // Then find the moment that these two forces would apply around (xc,yc)
5869 // moment(w) = center_dist * cos(centerline_angle) * Fi +
5870 // center_dist * sin(centerline_angle) * Fp
5871 //
5872 // Note that:
5873 // cos(centerline_angle) = (xw-xc) / center_dist
5874 // sin(centerline_angle) = (yw-yc) / center_dist
5875 // -> moment(w) = weightP(w)*(xw-xc)^2 + weightI(w)*(yw-yc)^2
5876 // = weightP(w)*xc^2 - 2*weightP(w)*xc*xw + weightP(w)*xw^2 +
5877 // weightI(w)*yc^2 - 2*weightI(w)*yc*yw + weightI(w)*yw^2
5878 //
5879 // which happily means that the X and Y axes can be handled independently.
5880 // We want to minimize sum(moment(w)) due to wheels w=0,1,..., which
5881 // occurs when:
5882 //
5883 // sum( 2*xc*weightP(w) - 2*weightP(w)*xw ) = 0
5884 // -> xc = (weightP(0)*x0 + weightP(1)*x1 + ...) /
5885 // (weightP(0) + weightP(1) + ...)
5886 // sum( 2*yc*weightI(w) - 2*weightI(w)*yw ) = 0
5887 // -> yc = (weightI(0)*y0 + weightI(1)*y1 + ...) /
5888 // (weightI(0) + weightI(1) + ...)
5889 //
5890 // so it turns into a fairly simple weighted average of the wheel positions.
5891
5892 float xc_numerator = 0;
5893 float xc_denominator = 0;
5894 float yc_numerator = 0;
5895 float yc_denominator = 0;
5896
5897 for( int p : wheelcache ) {
5898 const auto &wheel = parts[p];
5899
5900 // TODO: load on tire?
5901 int contact_area = wheel.wheel_area();
5902 float weight_i; // weighting for the in-line part
5903 float weight_p; // weighting for the perpendicular part
5904 if( wheel.is_broken() ) {
5905 // broken wheels don't roll on either axis
5906 weight_i = contact_area * 2.0;
5907 weight_p = contact_area * 2.0;
5908 } else if( part_with_feature( wheel.mount, "STEERABLE", true ) != -1 ) {
5909 // Unbroken steerable wheels can handle motion on both axes
5910 // (but roll a little more easily inline)
5911 weight_i = contact_area * 0.1;
5912 weight_p = contact_area * 0.2;
5913 } else {
5914 // Regular wheels resist perpendicular motion
5915 weight_i = contact_area * 0.1;
5916 weight_p = contact_area;
5917 }
5918
5919 xc_numerator += weight_p * wheel.mount.x;
5920 yc_numerator += weight_i * wheel.mount.y;
5921 xc_denominator += weight_p;
5922 yc_denominator += weight_i;
5923 }
5924
5925 if( xc_denominator < 0.1 || yc_denominator < 0.1 ) {
5926 debugmsg( "vehicle::refresh_pivot had a bad weight: xc=%.3f/%.3f yc=%.3f/%.3f",
5927 xc_numerator, xc_denominator, yc_numerator, yc_denominator );
5928 pivot_cache = local_center_of_mass();
5929 } else {
5930 pivot_cache.x = std::round( xc_numerator / xc_denominator );
5931 pivot_cache.y = std::round( yc_numerator / yc_denominator );
5932 }
5933}

References debugmsg, local_center_of_mass(), part_with_feature(), parts, pivot_cache, pivot_dirty, valid_wheel_config(), wheelcache, point::x, and point::y.

Referenced by pivot_point().

7121 zone_data zone = z.second;
7122 //Get the global position of the first cargo part at the relative coordinate
7123
7124 const int part_idx = part_with_feature( z.first, "CARGO", false );
7125 if( part_idx == -1 ) {
7126 debugmsg( "Could not find cargo part at %d,%d on vehicle %s for loot zone. Removing loot zone.",
7127 z.first.x, z.first.y, this->name );
7128
7129 // If this loot zone refers to a part that no longer exists at this location, then its unattached somehow.
7130 // By continuing here and not adding to new_zones, we effectively remove it
7131 continue;
7132 }
7133 tripoint zone_pos = global_part_pos3( part_idx );
7134 zone_pos = g->m.getabs( zone_pos );
7135 //Set the position of the zone to that part
7136 zone.set_position( std::pair<tripoint, tripoint>( zone_pos, zone_pos ), false );
7137 new_zones.emplace( z.first, zone );
7138 }
7139 loot_zones = new_zones;
7140 zones_dirty = false;

1211 } );

1215
1216 int seed_index = iexamine::query_seed( seed_entries );

1219 const int count = std::get<2>( seed_entries[seed_index] );
1220 int amount = 0;
1221 const std::string popupmsg = string_format( _( "Move how many? [Have %d] (0 to cancel)" ), count );
1222
1223 amount = string_input_popup()
1224 .title( popupmsg )
1225 .width( 5 )
1226 .only_digits( true )
1227 .query_int();

1235 } else {

1237 }
1238 used_seed.front().set_age( 0_turns );

1241 }
1242 }

2015 //check if selected part carries tracking flag
2016 if( parts[carried_part].has_flag(
2017 vehicle_part::tracked_flag ) ) { //this should only need to run once

2019 }

2023 if( id_string == "X" || id_string == "Y" ) {
2024 veh_record = carry_names.top();

2026 x_aligned = id_string == "X";

2036 units::angle host_dir = normalize( face.dir(), 180_degrees );
2037 // if the host is skewed N/S, and the carried vehicle is going to come at an angle,
2038 // force it to east/west instead
2039 if( host_dir >= 45_degrees && host_dir <= 135_degrees ) {
2040 if( new_dir <= 45_degrees || new_dir >= 315_degrees ) {
2041 new_dir = 0_degrees;
2042 } else if( new_dir >= 135_degrees && new_dir <= 225_degrees ) {
2043 new_dir = 180_degrees;
2044 }
2045 }

2049 to_degrees( face.dir() ), to_degrees( new_dir ) );

2057 std::string mount_str;

2059 // the mount string should be something like "X 0 0" for ex. We get the first number out of it.
2060 mount_str = parts[carried_part].carry_names.top().substr( 1, 3 );
2061 } else {
2062 // FIX #28712; if we get here it means that a part was added to the bike while the latter was a carried vehicle.
2063 // This part didn't get a carry_names because those are assigned when the carried vehicle is loaded.
2064 // We can't be sure to which vehicle it really belongs to, so it will be detached from the vehicle.
2065 // We can at least inform the player that there's something wrong.
2066 add_msg( m_warning,
2067 _( "A part of the vehicle ('%s') has no containing vehicle's name. It will be detached from the %s vehicle." ),
2068 parts[carried_part].name(), new_vehicle->name );
2069
2070 // check if any other parts at the same location have a valid carry name so we can still have a valid mount location.
2071 for( auto &local_part : parts_at_relative( parts[carried_part].mount, true ) ) {
2072 if( !parts[local_part].carry_names.empty() ) {
2073 mount_str = parts[local_part].carry_names.top().substr( 1, 3 );
2074 break;
2075 }
2076 }
2077 }
2078 if( mount_str.empty() ) {
2079 add_msg( m_bad,
2080 _( "There's not viable mount location on this vehicle: %s. It can't be unloaded from the rack." ),
2081 new_vehicle->name );
2082 return false;
2083 }
2084 if( x_aligned ) {
2085 new_mount.x = std::stoi( mount_str );
2086 } else {
2087 new_mount.y = std::stoi( mount_str );
2088 }
2089 new_mounts.push_back( new_mount );
2090 }
2091
2092 std::vector<vehicle *> new_vehicles;
2093 new_vehicles.push_back( new_vehicle );
2094 std::vector<std::vector<int>> carried_vehicles;
2095 carried_vehicles.push_back( carried_parts );
2096 std::vector<std::vector<point>> carried_mounts;
2097 carried_mounts.push_back( new_mounts );
2098 const bool success = split_vehicles( carried_vehicles, new_vehicles, carried_mounts );
2099 if( success ) {
2100 //~ %s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
2101 add_msg( _( "You unload the %s from the bike rack." ), new_vehicle->name );
2102 new_vehicle->remove_carried_flag();
2103 if( tracked_parts ) {
2104 new_vehicle->toggle_tracking(); //turn on tracking for our newly created vehicle
2105 new_vehicle->remove_tracked_flag(); //remove our tracking flags now that the vehicle isn't carried
2106 }
2107 g->m.dirty_vehicle_list.insert( this );
2108 part_removal_cleanup();
2109 } else {
2110 //~ %s is the vehicle being loaded onto the bicycle rack
2111 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You can't unload the %s from the bike rack." ), new_vehicle->name );

◆ remove_part() [2/2]

bool vehicle::remove_part ( int  p,
RemovePartHandler &  handler 
)
Parameters
handlerA class that receives various callbacks, e.g. for placing items. This handler is different when called during mapgen (when items need to be placed on the temporary mapgen map), and when called during normal game play (when items go on the main map g->m).

Definition at line 1820 of file vehicle.cpp.

1821{
1822 // NOTE: Don't access g or g->m or anything from it directly here.
1823 // Forward all access to the handler.
1824 // There are currently two implementations of it:
1825 // - one for normal game play (vehicle is on the main map g->m),
1826 // - one for mapgen (vehicle is on a temporary map used only during mapgen).
1827 if( p >= static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) ) {
1828 debugmsg( "Tried to remove part %d but only %d parts!", p, parts.size() );
1829 return false;
1830 }
1831 if( parts[p].removed ) {
1832 /* This happens only when we had to remove part, because it was depending on
1833 * other part (using recursive remove_part() call) - currently curtain
1834 * depending on presence of window and seatbelt depending on presence of seat.
1835 */
1836 return false;
1837 }
1838
1839 const tripoint part_loc = global_part_pos3( p );
1840
1841 // Unboard any entities standing on removed boardable parts
1842 if( part_flag( p, "BOARDABLE" ) && parts[p].has_flag( vehicle_part::passenger_flag ) ) {
1843 handler.unboard( part_loc );
1844 }
1845
1846 // If `p` has flag `parent_flag`, remove child with flag `child_flag`
1847 // Returns true if removal occurs
1848 const auto remove_dependent_part = [&]( const std::string & parent_flag,
1849 const std::string & child_flag ) {
1850 if( part_flag( p, parent_flag ) ) {
1851 int dep = part_with_feature( p, child_flag, false );
1852 if( dep >= 0 && !magic ) {
1853 handler.add_item_or_charges( part_loc, parts[dep].properties_to_item(), false );
1854 remove_part( dep, handler );
1855 return true;
1856 }
1857 }
1858 return false;
1859 };
1860
1861 // if a windshield is removed (usually destroyed) also remove curtains
1862 // attached to it.
1863 if( remove_dependent_part( "WINDOW", "CURTAIN" ) || part_flag( p, VPFLAG_OPAQUE ) ) {
1864 handler.set_transparency_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z );
1865 }
1866
1867 if( part_flag( p, VPFLAG_ROOF ) || part_flag( p, VPFLAG_OPAQUE ) ) {
1868 handler.set_floor_cache_dirty( sm_pos.z + 1 );
1869 }
1870
1871 remove_dependent_part( "SEAT", "SEATBELT" );

1873

1878 parts[p].set_base( base );
1879 parts[p].remove_flag( vehicle_part::animal_flag );

1881
1882 // Update current engine configuration if needed

1884 bool any_engine_on = false;
1885
1886 for( auto &e : engines ) {
1887 if( e != p && is_part_on( e ) ) {
1888 any_engine_on = true;
1889 break;
1890 }
1891 }
1892

1894 engine_on = false;

1896 toggle_specific_part( e, true );
1897 }
1898 }
1899 }
1900
1901 //Remove loot zone if Cargo was removed.
1902 const auto lz_iter = loot_zones.find( parts[p].mount );
1903 const bool no_zone = lz_iter != loot_zones.end();

1905 if( no_zone && part_flag( p, "CARGO" ) ) {
1906 // Using the key here (instead of the iterator) will remove all zones on
1907 // this mount points regardless of how many there are
1908 loot_zones.erase( parts[p].mount );
1909 zones_dirty = true;

1919 labels.erase( iter );
1920 }
1921
1922 for( auto &i : get_items( p ) ) {
1923 // Note: this can spawn items on the other side of the wall!
1924 // TODO: fix this ^^
1925 tripoint dest( part_loc + point( rng( -3, 3 ), rng( -3, 3 ) ) );
1926 if( !magic ) {
1927 // This new point might be out of the map bounds. It's not
1928 // reasonable to try to spawn it outside the currently valid map,
1929 // so we pass true here to cause such points to be clamped to the
1930 // valid bounds without printing an error (as would normally

437{
438 uilist tmenu;
439 tmenu.text = _( "Toggle which?" );
440
441 const auto is_engine_active = [this]( size_t x, const itype_id & fuel_id ) -> bool {
442 const int e = engines[ x ];
443 return parts[ e ].enabled && parts[ e ].fuel_current() == fuel_id;
444 };
445 const auto is_engine_available = [this]( size_t x, const itype_id & fuel_id ) -> bool {
446 const int e = engines[x];
447 return parts[ e ].is_available() &&
448 ( is_perpetual_type( x ) || fuel_id == fuel_type_muscle || fuel_left( fuel_id ) > 0 );
449 };
450
451 const auto get_title = []( const std::string & s ) -> uilist_entry {
452 auto title = uilist_entry( s )
453 .with_enabled( false )
454 .with_txt_color( c_cyan );
455 title.force_color = true; // ui.h does not have force_color, adding it would recompile everything
456 return title;
457 };
458
459 const auto get_opt = [&]( size_t x, const itype_id & fuel_id ) -> uilist_entry {
460 const bool is_active = is_engine_active( x, fuel_id );
461 const bool is_available = is_engine_available( x, fuel_id );
462
463 return uilist_entry( item::nname( fuel_id ) + ( is_active ? _( " (active)" ) : "" ) )
464 .with_enabled( is_available )
465 .with_txt_color( is_active ? c_light_green : c_light_gray );
466 };
467
468 int i = 0;
469 const auto entry_alt_fuels = [ &, this]( size_t x ) {
470 int engine_id = engines[ x ];
471 const std::string &part_name = parts[ engine_id ].name();
472
473 tmenu.entries.emplace_back( get_title( part_name ) );
474 for( const auto &fuel_id : part_info( engine_id ).engine_fuel_opts() ) {
475 auto opt = get_opt( x, fuel_id );
476 opt.retval = i++;
477 tmenu.entries.emplace_back( opt );
478 }
479 };
480
481 for( size_t x = 0; x < engines.size(); x++ ) {
482 entry_alt_fuels( x );
483 }
484
485 tmenu.query();
486 return tmenu.ret;

935{
936 if( !is_towed() && !magic ) {

938 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ e ];
939 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
940 monster *mon = get_pet( e );
941 if( !mon || !mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) || !mon->has_effect( effect_pet ) ) {
942 is_following = false;
943 return;
944 }
945 }
946 }
947 }
948 units::angle turn_delta = 15_degrees * p.x;
949 const float handling_diff = handling_difficulty();
950 if( turn_delta != 0_degrees ) {
951 float eff = steering_effectiveness();
952 if( eff == -2 ) {
953 return;
954 }
955
956 if( eff < 0 ) {
957 return;
958 }
959
960 if( eff == 0 ) {
961 return;
962 }
963 turn( turn_delta );
964 }
965 if( p.y != 0 ) {
966 int thr_amount = 100 * ( std::abs( velocity ) < 2000 ? 4 : 5 );
967 if( cruise_on ) {
968 cruise_thrust( -p.y * thr_amount );
969 } else {
970 thrust( -p.y );
971 }
972 }

976
977 ///\EFFECT_DRIVING increases chance of regaining control of a vehicle

979 velocity = static_cast<int>( forward_velocity() );
980 skidding = false;
981 move.init( turn_dir );
982 }
983 }
984}

◆ set_submap_moved()

void vehicle::set_submap_moved ( const tripoint &  p)

Update the submap coordinates and update the tracker info in the overmap (if enabled).

This should be called only when the vehicle has actually been moved, not when the map is just shifted (in the later case simply set smx/smy directly).

6097{
6098 const int length = mount_max.x - mount_min.x + 1;

6100 const point normalized_tow_mount = point( std::abs( mount_of_tow.x - mount_min.x ),
6101 std::abs( mount_of_tow.y - mount_min.y ) );
6102 if( length >= 3 ) {
6103 const int trisect = length / 3;
6104 if( normalized_tow_mount.x <= trisect ) {
6105 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_BACK;
6106 } else if( normalized_tow_mount.x > trisect && normalized_tow_mount.x <= trisect * 2 ) {
6107 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_SIDE;
6108 } else {
6109 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_FRONT;
6110 }
6111 } else {
6112 // its a small vehicle, no danger if it flips around.
6113 tow_data.tow_direction = TOW_FRONT;
6114 }
6115}

◆ shift_if_needed()

bool vehicle::shift_if_needed ( )

Detect if the vehicle is currently missing a 0,0 part, and adjust if necessary.

Returns
bool true if the shift was needed.

Definition at line 6500 of file vehicle.cpp.

6501{
6502 std::vector<int> vehicle_origin = parts_at_relative( point_zero, true );
6503 if( !vehicle_origin.empty() && !parts[ vehicle_origin[ 0 ] ].removed ) {
6504 // Shifting is not needed.
6505 return false;
6506 }
6507 //Find a frame, any frame, to shift to
6508 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6509 if( vp.info().location == "structure"
6510 && !vp.has_feature( "PROTRUSION" )
6511 && !vp.part().removed ) {
6512 shift_parts( vp.mount() );
6513 refresh();
6514 return true;
6515 }
6516 }
6517 // There are only parts with PROTRUSION left, choose one of them.
6518 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_all_parts() ) {
6519 if( !vp.part().removed ) {
6520 shift_parts( vp.mount() );
6521 refresh();
6522 return true;
6523 }
6524 }
6525 return false;
6526}

References get_all_parts(), parts, parts_at_relative(), point_zero, refresh(), and shift_parts().

Referenced by part_removal_cleanup(), and remove_part().

◆ shift_parts()

void vehicle::shift_parts ( const point &  delta)

Shifts all parts of the vehicle by the given amounts, and then shifts the vehicle itself in the opposite direction.

The end result is that the vehicle appears to have not moved. Useful for re-zeroing a vehicle to ensure that a (0, 0) part is always present.

Parameters
deltaHow much to shift along each axis

Definition at line 6469 of file vehicle.cpp.

6470{
6471 // Don't invalidate the active item cache's location!
6472 active_items.subtract_locations( delta );
6473 for( auto &elem : parts ) {
6474 elem.mount -= delta;
6475 }
6476
6477 decltype( labels ) new_labels;
6478 for( auto &l : labels ) {
6479 new_labels.insert( label( l - delta, l.text ) );
6480 }
6481 labels = new_labels;
6482
6483 decltype( loot_zones ) new_zones;
6484 for( auto const &z : loot_zones ) {
6485 new_zones.emplace( z.first - delta, z.second );
6486 }
6487 loot_zones = new_zones;
6488
6489 pivot_anchor[0] -= delta;
6490 refresh();
6491 //Need to also update the map after this
6492 g->m.reset_vehicle_cache( );
6493}

1423
1424 int z_shift = 0;
1425 if( center == -1 ) {

1427 auto global_center = mount_to_tripoint( point_zero );

◆ slow_leak()

void vehicle::slow_leak ( )

Definition at line 5294 of file vehicle.cpp.

5295{
5296 // for each badly damaged tanks (lower than 50% health), leak a small amount
5297 for( auto &p : parts ) {
5298 auto health = p.health_percent();
5299 if( !p.is_leaking() || p.ammo_remaining() <= 0 ) {
5300 continue;
5301 }
5302
5303 auto fuel = p.ammo_current();
5304 int qty = std::max( ( 0.5 - health ) * ( 0.5 - health ) * p.ammo_remaining() / 10, 1.0 );
5305 point q = coord_translate( p.mount );
5306 const tripoint dest = global_pos3() + tripoint( q, 0 );
5307
5308 if( fuel != fuel_type_battery && !g->m.inbounds( dest ) ) {
5309 // Don't try to leak off the edge of the world
5310 continue;
5311 }
5312
5313 // damaged batteries self-discharge without leaking, plutonium leaks slurry
5314 if( fuel != fuel_type_battery && fuel != fuel_type_plutonium_cell ) {
5315 item leak( fuel, calendar::turn, qty );
5316 g->m.add_item_or_charges( dest, leak );
5317 p.ammo_consume( qty, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5318 } else if( fuel == fuel_type_plutonium_cell ) {
5319 if( p.ammo_remaining() >= PLUTONIUM_CHARGES / 10 ) {
5320 item leak( "plut_slurry_dense", calendar::turn, qty );
5321 g->m.add_item_or_charges( dest, leak );
5322 p.ammo_consume( qty * PLUTONIUM_CHARGES / 10, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5323 } else {
5324 p.ammo_consume( p.ammo_remaining(), global_part_pos3( p ) );
5325 }
5326 } else {
5327 p.ammo_consume( qty, global_part_pos3( p ) );
5328 }
5329 }
5330}

◆ slowdown()

int vehicle::slowdown ( int  velocity) const

Definition at line 88 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

89{
90 double mps = vmiph_to_mps( std::abs( at_velocity ) );
91
92 // slowdown due to air resistance is proportional to square of speed
93 double f_total_drag = coeff_air_drag() * mps * mps;
94 if( is_watercraft() ) {
95 // same with water resistance
96 f_total_drag += coeff_water_drag() * mps * mps;
97 } else if( !is_falling && !is_flying ) {
98 double f_rolling_drag = coeff_rolling_drag() * ( vehicles::rolling_constant_to_variable + mps );
99 if( vehicle_movement::is_on_rails( get_map(), *this ) ) {
100 // vehicles on rails don't skid
101 f_total_drag += f_rolling_drag;
102 } else {
103 // increase rolling resistance by up to 25x if the vehicle is skidding at right angle to facing
104 const double skid_factor = 1.0 + 24.0 * std::abs( units::sin( face.dir() - move.dir() ) );
105 f_total_drag += f_rolling_drag * skid_factor;
106 }
107 }
108 double accel_slowdown = f_total_drag / to_kilogram( total_mass() );
109 // converting m/s^2 to vmiph/s
110 int slowdown = mps_to_vmiph( accel_slowdown );
111 if( is_towing() ) {
112 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
113 if( other_veh ) {
114 slowdown += other_veh->slowdown( at_velocity );
115 }
116 }
117 if( slowdown < 0 ) {
118 debugmsg( "vehicle %s has negative drag slowdown %d\n", name, slowdown );
119 }
120 add_msg( m_debug, "%s at %d vimph, f_drag %3.2f, drag accel %d vmiph - extra drag %d",
121 name, at_velocity, f_total_drag, slowdown, static_drag() );
122 // plows slow rolling vehicles, but not falling or floating vehicles
123 if( !( is_falling || is_floating || is_flying ) ) {
124 slowdown -= static_drag();
125 }
126
127 return std::max( 1, slowdown );
128}
vehicle::static_drag
int static_drag(bool actual=true) const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:4301

References add_msg(), coeff_air_drag(), coeff_rolling_drag(), coeff_water_drag(), debugmsg, tileray::dir(), face, get_map(), towing_data::get_towed(), is_falling, is_floating, is_flying, vehicle_movement::is_on_rails(), is_towing(), is_watercraft(), m_debug, move, mps_to_vmiph(), name, vehicles::rolling_constant_to_variable, units::sin(), slowdown(), static_drag(), units::to_kilogram(), total_mass(), tow_data, and vmiph_to_mps().

◆ smash()

void vehicle::smash ( map &  m,
float  hp_percent_loss_min = 0.1f,
float  hp_percent_loss_max = 1.2f,
float  percent_of_parts_to_affect = 1.0f,
point  damage_origin = point_zero,
float  damage_size = 0 
)

Smashes up a vehicle that has already been placed; used for generating very damaged vehicles.

Additionally, any spot where two vehicles overlapped (i.e., any spot with multiple frames) will be completely destroyed, as that was the collision point.

Definition at line 936 of file vehicle.cpp.

938{
939 for( auto &part : parts ) {
940 //Skip any parts already mashed up or removed.
941 if( part.is_broken() || part.removed ) {
942 continue;
943 }
944
945 std::vector<int> parts_in_square = parts_at_relative( part.mount, true );
946 int structures_found = 0;
947 for( auto &square_part_index : parts_in_square ) {
948 if( part_info( square_part_index ).location == part_location_structure ) {
949 structures_found++;
950 }
951 }
952
953 if( structures_found > 1 ) {
954 //Destroy everything in the square
955 for( int idx : parts_in_square ) {
956 mod_hp( parts[ idx ], 0 - parts[ idx ].hp(), DT_BASH );
957 parts[ idx ].ammo_unset();
958 }
959 continue;
960 }
961
962 int roll = dice( 1, 1000 );
963 int pct_af = ( percent_of_parts_to_affect * 1000.0f );
964 if( roll < pct_af ) {
965 double dist = damage_size == 0.0f ? 1.0f :
966 clamp( 1.0f - trig_dist( damage_origin, part.precalc[0].xy() ) /
967 damage_size, 0.0f, 1.0f );
968 //Everywhere else, drop by 10-120% of max HP (anything over 100 = broken)
969 if( mod_hp( part, 0 - ( rng_float( hp_percent_loss_min * dist,
970 hp_percent_loss_max * dist ) *
971 part.info().durability ), DT_BASH ) ) {
972 part.ammo_unset();
973 }
974 }
975 }
976
977 std::unique_ptr<RemovePartHandler> handler_ptr;
978 // clear out any duplicated locations
979 for( int p = static_cast<int>( parts.size() ) - 1; p >= 0; p-- ) {
980 vehicle_part &part = parts[ p ];
981 if( part.removed ) {
982 continue;
983 }
984 std::vector<int> parts_here = parts_at_relative( part.mount, true );
985 for( int other_i = static_cast<int>( parts_here.size() ) - 1; other_i >= 0; other_i -- ) {
986 int other_p = parts_here[ other_i ];
987 if( p == other_p ) {
988 continue;
989 }
990 const vpart_info &p_info = part_info( p );
991 const vpart_info &other_p_info = part_info( other_p );
992
993 if( p_info.get_id() == other_p_info.get_id() ||
994 ( !p_info.location.empty() && p_info.location == other_p_info.location ) ) {
995 // Deferred creation of the handler to here so it is only created when actually needed.
996 if( !handler_ptr ) {
997 // This is a heuristic: we just assume the default handler is good enough when called
998 // on the main game map. And assume that we run from some mapgen code if called on
999 // another instance.
1000 if( g && &g->m == &m ) {
1001 handler_ptr = std::make_unique<DefaultRemovePartHandler>();
1002 } else {
1003 handler_ptr = std::make_unique<MapgenRemovePartHandler>( m );
1004 }
1005 }
1006 remove_part( other_p, *handler_ptr );
1007 }
1008 }
1009 }
1010}

◆ smash_security_system()

void vehicle::smash_security_system ( )
private
Mechanics reduces chance of damaging controls when smashing security system

Definition at line 527 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

528{
529
530 //get security and controls location
531 int s = -1;
532 int c = -1;
533 for( int p : speciality ) {
534 if( part_flag( p, "SECURITY" ) && !parts[ p ].is_broken() ) {
535 s = p;
536 c = part_with_feature( s, "CONTROLS", true );
537 break;
538 }
539 }
540 //controls and security must both be valid
541 if( c >= 0 && s >= 0 ) {
542 ///\EFFECT_MECHANICS reduces chance of damaging controls when smashing security system
543 int skill = g->u.get_skill_level( skill_mechanics );
544 int percent_controls = 70 / ( 1 + skill );
545 int percent_alarm = ( skill + 3 ) * 10;
546 int rand = rng( 1, 100 );
547
548 if( percent_controls > rand ) {
549 damage_direct( c, part_info( c ).durability / 4 );
550
551 if( parts[ c ].removed || parts[ c ].is_broken() ) {
552 g->u.controlling_vehicle = false;
553 is_alarm_on = false;
554 add_msg( _( "You destroy the controls" ) );
555 } else {
556 add_msg( _( "You damage the controls." ) );
557 }
558 }
559 if( percent_alarm > rand ) {
560 damage_direct( s, part_info( s ).durability / 5 );
561 // chance to disable alarm immediately, or disable on destruction
562 if( percent_alarm / 4 > rand || parts[ s ].is_broken() ) {
563 is_alarm_on = false;
564 }
565 }
566 add_msg( ( is_alarm_on ) ? _( "The alarm keeps going." ) : _( "The alarm stops." ) );
567 } else {
568 debugmsg( "No security system found on vehicle." );
569 }
570}

2336 }
2337 // indicate the part needs to be removed from the old vehicle
2338 parts[ mov_part].removed = true;
2339 removed_part_count++;
2340 }
2341
2342 // We want to create the vehicle zones after we've setup the parts
2343 // because we need only to move the zone once per mount, not per part. If we move per
2344 // part, we will end up with duplicates of the zone per part on the same mount
2345 for( std::pair<point, zone_data> zone : new_zones ) {
2346 zone_manager::get_manager().create_vehicle_loot_zone( *new_vehicle, zone.first, zone.second );
2347 }
2348

2350 // in an unknown state from the previous vehicle, we need to let the cache rebuild next
2351 // time we interact with them
2352 new_vehicle->zones_dirty = true;

2357 here.set_seen_cache_dirty( tripoint_zero );

2359 new_vehicle->labels = new_labels;
2360 }
2361
2362 if( split_mounts.empty() ) {
2363 new_vehicle->refresh();
2364 } else {
2365 // include refresh
2366 new_vehicle->shift_parts( point_zero - mnt_offset );
2367 }
2368
2369 // update the precalc points
2370 new_vehicle->precalc_mounts( 1, new_vehicle->skidding ?
2371 new_vehicle->turn_dir : new_vehicle->face.dir(),
2372 new_vehicle->pivot_point() );
2373 new_vehicle->adjust_zlevel( 1, tripoint_zero );

2377 }
2378 }

◆ start_engine()

bool vehicle::start_engine ( int  e)

967{
968 if( !is_engine_on( e ) ) {
969 return false;
970 }
971
972 const vpart_info &einfo = part_info( engines[e] );
973 vehicle_part &eng = parts[ engines[ e ] ];
974
975 const bool out_of_fuel = [&] {
976 if( einfo.fuel_type == fuel_type_none || engine_fuel_left( e ) > 0 )
977 {
978 return false;
979 }
980 for( const itype_id &fuel_id : einfo.engine_fuel_opts() )
981 {
982 if( fuel_left( fuel_id ) > 0 ) {
983 eng.fuel_set( fuel_id );
984 return false;
985 }
986 }

988 }();

990 if( out_of_fuel ) {
991 if( einfo.fuel_type == fuel_type_muscle ) {
992 // Muscle engines cannot start with broken limbs
993 if( einfo.has_flag( "MUSCLE_ARMS" ) &&
994 ( get_player_character().get_working_arm_count() < 2 ) ) {
995 add_msg( _( "You cannot use %s with a broken arm." ), eng.name() );
996 return false;
997 } else if( einfo.has_flag( "MUSCLE_LEGS" ) &&
998 ( get_player_character().get_working_leg_count() < 2 ) ) {
999 add_msg( _( "You cannot use %s with a broken leg." ), eng.name() );
1000 return false;
1001 }
1002 } else {
1003 add_msg( _( "Looks like the %1$s is out of %2$s." ), eng.name(),
1004 item::nname( einfo.fuel_type ) );
1005 return false;
1006 }
1007 }
1008
1009 const double dmg = eng.damage_percent();
1010 const int engine_power = std::abs( part_epower_w( engines[e] ) );
1011 const double cold_factor = engine_cold_factor( e );
1012 const int start_moves = engine_start_time( e );
1013 const int noise = einfo.engine_noise_factor();
1014
1015 const tripoint pos = global_part_pos3( engines[e] );
1016 if( einfo.engine_backfire_threshold() ) {
1017 if( ( 1 - dmg ) < einfo.engine_backfire_threshold() && one_in( einfo.engine_backfire_freq() ) ) {
1018 backfire( e );
1019 } else {
1020 sounds::sound( pos, start_moves / 10, sounds::sound_t::movement,
1021 string_format( _( "the %s bang as it starts" ), eng.name() ), true, "vehicle",
1022 "engine_bangs_start" );
1023 }
1024 }
1025
1026 // Immobilizers need removing before the vehicle can be started
1027 if( eng.faults().count( fault_immobiliser ) ) {
1028 sounds::sound( pos, 5, sounds::sound_t::alarm,
1029 string_format( _( "the %s making a long beep" ), eng.name() ), true, "vehicle",
1030 "fault_immobiliser_beep" );
1031 return false;
1032 }
1033
1034 // Engine with starter motors can fail on both battery and starter motor
1035 if( eng.faults_potential().count( fault_starter ) ) {
1036 if( eng.faults().count( fault_starter ) ) {
1037 sounds::sound( pos, noise, sounds::sound_t::alarm,
1038 string_format( _( "the %s clicking once" ), eng.name() ), true, "vehicle",
1039 "engine_single_click_fail" );
1040 return false;
1041 }
1042 // TODO: start_moves is in moves, but it's an integer, convert it to some time class
1043 const int start_draw_bat = power_to_energy_bat( engine_power *
1044 ( 1.0 + dmg / 2 + cold_factor / 5 ) * 10,
1045 1_turns * start_moves / 100 );
1046 if( discharge_battery( start_draw_bat, true ) != 0 ) {
1047 sounds::sound( pos, noise, sounds::sound_t::alarm,
1048 string_format( _( "the %s rapidly clicking" ), eng.name() ), true, "vehicle",
1049 "engine_multi_click_fail" );
1050 return false;
1051 }
1052 }
1053
1054 // Engines always fail to start with faulty fuel pumps
1055 if( eng.faults().count( fault_pump ) || eng.faults().count( fault_diesel ) ) {
1056 sounds::sound( pos, noise, sounds::sound_t::movement,
1057 string_format( _( "the %s quickly stuttering out." ), eng.name() ), true, "vehicle",
1058 "engine_stutter_fail" );
1059 return false;
1060 }
1061
1062 // Damaged non-electric engines have a chance of failing to start
1063 if( !is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_battery ) && x_in_y( dmg * 100, 120 ) ) {
1064 sounds::sound( pos, noise, sounds::sound_t::movement,
1065 string_format( _( "the %s clanking and grinding" ), eng.name() ), true, "vehicle",
1066 "engine_clanking_fail" );
1067 return false;
1068 }
1069 sounds::sound( pos, noise, sounds::sound_t::movement,
1070 string_format( _( "the %s starting" ), eng.name() ) );
1071
1072 if( sfx::has_variant_sound( "engine_start", einfo.get_id().str() ) ) {
1073 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_start", einfo.get_id().str(), noise );
1074 } else if( is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_muscle ) ) {
1075 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_start", "muscle", noise );
1076 } else if( is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_wind ) ) {
1077 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_start", "wind", noise );
1078 } else if( is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_battery ) ) {
1079 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_start", "electric", noise );
1080 } else {
1081 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_start", "combustion", noise );
1082 }
1083 return true;
1084}
Character::get_working_arm_count
int get_working_arm_count() const
Returns the number of functioning arms.

int engine_start_time(int e) const

void vehicle::start_engines ( bool  take_control = false,

1110{
1111 bool has_engine = std::any_of( engines.begin(), engines.end(), [&]( int idx ) {
1112 return parts[ idx ].enabled && !parts[ idx ].is_broken();
1113 } );
1114
1115 // if no engines enabled then enable all before trying to start the vehicle
1116 if( !has_engine ) {
1117 for( auto idx : engines ) {
1118 if( !parts[ idx ].is_broken() ) {
1119 parts[ idx ].enabled = true;
1120 }
1121 }
1122 }
1123
1124 int start_time = 0;
1125 // record the first usable engine as the referenced position checked at the end of the engine starting activity
1126 bool has_starting_engine_position = false;
1127 tripoint starting_engine_position;
1128 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
1129 if( !has_starting_engine_position && !parts[ engines[ e ] ].is_broken() &&
1130 parts[ engines[ e ] ].enabled ) {
1131 starting_engine_position = global_part_pos3( engines[ e ] );
1132 has_starting_engine_position = true;
1133 }
1134 has_engine = has_engine || is_engine_on( e );
1135 start_time = std::max( start_time, engine_start_time( e ) );
1136 }
1137
1138 if( !has_starting_engine_position ) {
1139 starting_engine_position = global_pos3();
1140 }
1141
1142 if( !has_engine ) {
1143 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s doesn't have an engine!" ), name );
1144 return;
1145 }
1146
1147 if( take_control && !g->u.controlling_vehicle ) {
1148 g->u.controlling_vehicle = true;
1149 add_msg( _( "You take control of the %s." ), name );
1150 }
1151 if( !autodrive ) {
1152 g->u.assign_activity( ACT_START_ENGINES, start_time );
1153 g->u.activity.placement = starting_engine_position - g->u.pos();
1154 g->u.activity.values.push_back( take_control );
1155 }

◆ steering_effectiveness()

float vehicle::steering_effectiveness ( ) const

Definition at line 4464 of file vehicle.cpp.

4465{
4466 if( is_floating ) {
4467 // I'M ON A BOAT
4468 return can_float() ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
4469 }
4470 if( is_flying ) {
4471 // I'M IN THE AIR
4472 return is_rotorcraft() ? 1.0f : 0.0f;
4473 }
4474 // irksome special case for boats in shallow water
4475 if( is_watercraft() && can_float() ) {
4476 return 1.0f;
4477 }
4478
4479 if( steering.empty() ) {
4480 return -1.0f; // No steering installed
4481 }
4482 // If the only steering part is an animal harness, with no animal in, it
4483 // is not steerable.
4484 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ steering[0] ];
4485 if( steering.size() == 1 && vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal ) {
4486 monster *mon = get_pet( steering[0] );
4487 if( mon == nullptr || !mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
4488 return -2.0f;
4489 }
4490 }
4491 // For now, you just need one wheel working for 100% effective steering.
4492 // TODO: return something less than 1.0 if the steering isn't so good
4493 // (unbalanced, long wheelbase, back-heavy vehicle with front wheel steering,
4494 // etc)
4495 for( int p : steering ) {
4496 if( parts[ p ].is_available() ) {
4497 return 1.0f;
4498 }
4499 }
4500
4501 // We have steering, but it's all broken.
4502 return 0.0f;
4503}

◆ strain()

float vehicle::strain ( ) const

Definition at line 4306 of file vehicle.cpp.

4307{
4308 int mv = max_velocity();
4309 int sv = safe_velocity();
4310 if( mv <= sv ) {
4311 mv = sv + 1;
4312 }
4313 if( velocity < sv && velocity > -sv ) {
4314 return 0;
4315 } else {
4316 return static_cast<float>( std::abs( velocity ) - sv ) / static_cast<float>( mv - sv );
4317 }
4318}
