◆ thrust()

void vehicle::thrust ( int  thd,
int  z = 0 
)

Definition at line 130 of file vehicle_move.cpp.

131{
132 //if vehicle is stopped, set target direction to forward.
133 //ensure it is not skidding. Set turns used to 0.
134 if( !is_moving() && z == 0 ) {
135 turn_dir = face.dir();
136 stop();
137 }
138 bool pl_ctrl = player_in_control( get_player_character() );
139
140 // No need to change velocity if there are no wheels
141 if( ( in_water && can_float() ) || ( is_rotorcraft() && ( z != 0 || is_flying ) ) ) {
142 // we're good
143 } else if( is_floating && !can_float() ) {
144 stop();
145 if( pl_ctrl ) {
146 add_msg( _( "The %s is too leaky!" ), name );
147 }
148 return;
149 } else if( !valid_wheel_config() && z == 0 ) {
150 stop();
151 if( pl_ctrl ) {
152 add_msg( _( "The %s doesn't have enough wheels to move!" ), name );
153 }
154 return;
155 }
156 // Accelerate (true) or brake (false)
157 bool thrusting = true;
158 if( velocity ) {
159 int sgn = ( velocity < 0 ) ? -1 : 1;
160 thrusting = ( sgn == thd );
161 }
162
163 // TODO: Pass this as an argument to avoid recalculating
164 float traction = k_traction( get_map().vehicle_wheel_traction( *this ) );
165 int accel = current_acceleration() * traction;
166 if( accel < 200 && velocity > 0 && is_towing() ) {
167 if( pl_ctrl ) {
168 add_msg( _( "The %s struggles to pull the %s on this surface!" ), name,
169 tow_data.get_towed()->name );
170 }
171 return;
172 }
173 if( thrusting && accel == 0 ) {
174 if( pl_ctrl ) {
175 add_msg( _( "The %s is too heavy for its engine(s)!" ), name );
176 }
177 return;
178 }
179 const int max_vel = traction * max_velocity();
180 // maximum braking is 20 mph/s, assumes high friction tires
181 const int max_brake = 20 * 100;
182 //pos or neg if accelerator or brake
183 int vel_inc = ( accel + ( thrusting ? 0 : max_brake ) ) * thd;
184 // Reverse is only 60% acceleration, unless an electric motor is in use
185 if( thd == -1 && thrusting && !has_engine_type( fuel_type_battery, true ) ) {
186 vel_inc = .6 * vel_inc;
187 }
188
189 //find ratio of used acceleration to maximum available, returned in tenths of a percent
190 //so 1000 = 100% and 453 = 45.3%
191 int load;
192 // Keep exact cruise control speed
193 if( cruise_on && accel != 0 ) {
194 int effective_cruise = std::min( cruise_velocity, max_vel );
195 if( thd > 0 ) {
196 vel_inc = std::min( vel_inc, effective_cruise - velocity );
197 } else {
198 vel_inc = std::max( vel_inc, effective_cruise - velocity );
199 }
200 if( thrusting ) {
201 load = 1000 * std::abs( vel_inc ) / accel;
202 } else {
203 // brakes provide 20 mph/s of slowdown and the rest is engine braking
204 // TODO: braking depends on wheels, traction, driver skill
205 load = 1000 * std::max( 0, std::abs( vel_inc ) - max_brake ) / accel;
206 }
207 } else {
208 load = ( thrusting ? 1000 : 0 );
209 }
210 // rotorcraft need to spend +5% (in addition to idle) of load to fly, +20% (in addition to idle) to ascend
211 if( is_rotorcraft() && ( z > 0 || is_flying_in_air() ) ) {
212 load = std::max( load, z > 0 ? 200 : 50 );
213 thrusting = true;
214 }
215
216 // only consume resources if engine accelerating
217 if( load >= 1 && thrusting ) {
218 //abort if engines not operational
219 if( total_power_w() <= 0 || !engine_on || ( z == 0 && accel == 0 ) ) {
220 if( pl_ctrl ) {
221 if( total_power_w( false ) <= 0 ) {
222 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s doesn't have an engine!" ), name );
223 } else if( has_engine_type( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
224 add_msg( m_info, _( "The %s's mechanism is out of reach!" ), name );
225 } else if( !engine_on ) {
226 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine isn't on!" ), name );
227 } else if( traction < 0.01f ) {
228 add_msg( _( "The %s is stuck." ), name );
229 } else {
230 add_msg( _( "The %s's engine emits a sneezing sound." ), name );
231 }
232 }
233 cruise_velocity = 0;
234 return;
235 }
236 //make noise and consume fuel
237 noise_and_smoke( load );
238 consume_fuel( load, 1 );
239 if( z != 0 && is_rotorcraft() ) {
240 requested_z_change = z;
241 }
242 //break the engines a bit, if going too fast.
243 int strn = static_cast<int>( strain() * strain() * 100 );
244 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
245 do_engine_damage( e, strn );
246 }
247 }
248
249 //wheels aren't facing the right way to change velocity properly
250 //lower down, since engines should be getting damaged anyway
251 if( skidding ) {
252 return;
253 }
254
255 //change vehicles velocity
256 if( ( velocity > 0 && velocity + vel_inc < 0 ) || ( velocity < 0 && velocity + vel_inc > 0 ) ) {
257 //velocity within braking distance of 0
258 stop();
259 } else {
260 // Increase velocity up to max_vel or min_vel, but not above.
261 const int min_vel = max_reverse_velocity();
262 if( vel_inc > 0 ) {
263 // Don't allow braking by accelerating (could happen with damaged engines)
264 velocity = std::max( velocity, std::min( velocity + vel_inc, max_vel ) );
265 } else {
266 velocity = std::min( velocity, std::max( velocity + vel_inc, min_vel ) );
267 }
268 }
269 // If you are going faster than the animal can handle, harness is damaged
270 // Animal may come free ( and possibly hit by vehicle )
271 for( size_t e = 0; e < parts.size(); e++ ) {
272 const vehicle_part &vp = parts[ e ];
273 if( vp.info().fuel_type == fuel_type_animal && engines.size() != 1 ) {
274 monster *mon = get_pet( e );
275 if( mon != nullptr && mon->has_effect( effect_harnessed ) ) {
276 if( velocity > mon->get_speed() * 12 ) {
277 add_msg( m_bad, _( "Your %s is not fast enough to keep up with the %s" ), mon->get_name(), name );
278 int dmg = rng( 0, 10 );
279 damage_direct( e, dmg );
280 }
281 }
282 }
283 }
284}
monster::get_name
std::string get_name() const override
Definition: monster.cpp:488
vehicle::current_acceleration
int current_acceleration(bool fueled=true) const
Definition: vehicle.cpp:3652
vehicle::do_engine_damage
void do_engine_damage(size_t e, int strain)
Definition: vehicle.cpp:5198
fuel_type_battery
static const itype_id fuel_type_battery("battery")

◆ toggle_autopilot()

void vehicle::toggle_autopilot ( )

Definition at line 587 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

588{
589 uilist smenu;
590 enum autopilot_option : int {
591 PATROL,
592 FOLLOW,
593 STOP
594 };
595 smenu.desc_enabled = true;
596 smenu.text = _( "Choose action for the autopilot" );
597 smenu.addentry_col( PATROL, true, 'P', _( "Patrol" ),
598 "", string_format( _( "Program the autopilot to patrol a nearby vehicle patrol zone. "
599 "If no zones are nearby, you will be prompted to create one." ) ) );
600 smenu.addentry_col( FOLLOW, true, 'F', _( "Follow" ),
601 "", string_format(
602 _( "Program the autopilot to follow you. It might be a good idea to have a remote control available to tell it to stop, too." ) ) );
603 smenu.addentry_col( STOP, true, 'S', _( "Stop" ),
604 "", string_format( _( "Stop all autopilot related activities." ) ) );
605 smenu.query();
606 switch( smenu.ret ) {
607 case PATROL:
608 autopilot_patrol_check();
609 break;
610 case STOP:
611 autopilot_on = false;
612 is_patrolling = false;
613 is_following = false;
614 autodrive_local_target = tripoint_zero;
615 stop_engines();
616 break;
617 case FOLLOW:
618 autopilot_on = true;
619 is_following = true;
620 is_patrolling = false;
621 start_engines();
622 refresh();
623 default:
624 return;
625 }
626}

4678 int epower = 0;
4679
4680 // Engines: can both produce (plasma) or consume (gas, diesel) epower.

4682 // Electric motor consumption not included, see @ref vpart_info::energy_consumption

◆ total_power_w()

int vehicle::total_power_w ( bool  fueled = true,
bool  safe = false 
) const

Definition at line 3513 of file vehicle.cpp.

3514{
3515 int pwr = 0;
3516 int cnt = 0;
3517
3518 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); e++ ) {
3519 int p = engines[e];
3520 if( is_engine_on( e ) && ( !fueled || engine_fuel_left( e ) ) ) {
3521 int m2c = safe ? part_info( engines[e] ).engine_m2c() : 100;
3522 if( parts[ engines[e] ].faults().count( fault_filter_fuel ) ) {
3523 m2c *= 0.6;
3524 }
3525 pwr += part_vpower_w( p ) * m2c / 100;
3526 cnt++;
3527 }
3528 }
3529
3530 for( size_t a = 0; a < alternators.size(); a++ ) {
3531 int p = alternators[a];
3532 if( is_alternator_on( a ) ) {
3533 pwr += part_vpower_w( p ); // alternators have negative power
3534 }
3535 }
3536 pwr = std::max( 0, pwr );
3537
3538 if( cnt > 1 ) {
3539 pwr = pwr * 4 / ( 4 + cnt - 1 );
3540 }
3541 return pwr;
3542}

6164{
6165 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by() ) {
6166 debugmsg( "checking tow cable length on a vehicle that has no towing vehicle" );
6167 return false;
6168 }
6169 int index = get_tow_part();
6170 if( index == -1 ) {
6171 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6172 return false;
6173 }
6174 tripoint towing_point = g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( index ) );
6175 if( !tow_data.get_towed_by()->tow_data.get_towed() ) {
6176 debugmsg( "vehicle %s has data for a towing vehicle, but that towing vehicle does not have %s listed as towed",
6177 disp_name(), disp_name() );
6178 return false;
6179 }
6180 int other_index = tow_data.get_towed_by()->get_tow_part();
6181 if( other_index == -1 ) {
6182 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6183 return false;
6184 }
6185 tripoint towed_point = g->m.getabs( tow_data.get_towed_by()->global_part_pos3( other_index ) );
6186 if( towing_point == tripoint_zero || towed_point == tripoint_zero ) {
6187 debugmsg( "towing data exists but no towing part" );
6188 return false;
6189 }
6190 return rl_dist( towing_point, towed_point ) >= 25;
6191}

1625 std::vector<vehicle *> carry_vehs;
1626 carry_vehs.assign( 4, nullptr );
1627 vehicle *test_veh = nullptr;
1628 std::set<tripoint> veh_partial_match;
1629 std::vector<std::set<tripoint>> partial_matches;
1630 partial_matches.assign( 4, veh_partial_match );
1631 for( auto rack_part : this_bike_rack ) {
1632 tripoint rack_pos = global_part_pos3( rack_part );
1633 int i = 0;
1634 for( const point &offset : four_cardinal_directions ) {
1635 tripoint search_pos( rack_pos + offset );
1636 test_veh = veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at( search_pos ) );
1637 if( test_veh == nullptr || test_veh == this ) {
1638 continue;
1639 } else if( test_veh != carry_vehs[ i ] ) {
1640 carry_vehs[ i ] = test_veh;
1641 partial_matches[ i ].clear();
1642 }
1643 partial_matches[ i ].insert( search_pos );
1644 if( partial_matches[ i ] == test_veh->get_points() ) {
1645 return merge_rackable_vehicle( test_veh, this_bike_rack );
1646 }
1647 ++i;
1648 }
1649 }
1650 }
1651 return false;

◆ turrets_aim()

bool vehicle::turrets_aim ( std::vector< vehicle_part * > &  turrets)
private
Intelligence speeds up aiming of vehicle turrets

Definition at line 382 of file turret.cpp.

383{
384 // Clear existing targets
385 for( vehicle_part *t : turrets ) {
386 if( !turret_query( *t ) ) {
387 debugmsg( "Expected a valid vehicle turret" );
388 return false;
389 }
390 t->reset_target( global_part_pos3( *t ) );
391 }
392
393 // Get target
394 target_handler::trajectory trajectory = target_handler::mode_turrets( g->u, *this, turrets );
395
396 bool got_target = !trajectory.empty();
397 if( got_target ) {
398 tripoint target = trajectory.back();
399 // Set target for any turret in range
400 for( vehicle_part *t : turrets ) {
401 if( turret_query( *t ).in_range( target ) ) {
402 t->target.second = target;
403 }
404 }
405
406 ///\EFFECT_INT speeds up aiming of vehicle turrets
407 g->u.moves = std::min( 0, g->u.moves - 100 + ( 5 * g->u.int_cur ) );
408 }
409 return got_target;
410}

void vehicle::turrets_aim_and_fire_single ( )

Select a single ready turret, aim it using the aiming UI and fire.

Definition at line 306 of file turret.cpp.

307{
308 std::vector<std::string> option_names;
309 std::vector<vehicle_part *> options;
310
311 // Find all turrets that are ready to fire
312 for( auto &t : turrets() ) {
313 turret_data data = turret_query( *t );
314 if( data.query() == turret_data::status::ready ) {
315 option_names.push_back( t->name() );
316 options.push_back( t );
317 }
318 }
319
320 // Select one
321 if( options.empty() ) {
322 add_msg( m_warning, _( "None of the turrets are ready to fire." ) );
323 return;
324 }
325 const int idx = uilist( _( "Aim which turret?" ), option_names );
326 if( idx < 0 ) {
327 return;
328 }
329 vehicle_part *turret = options[idx];
330
331 std::vector<vehicle_part *> turrets;
332 turrets.push_back( turret );
333 turrets_aim_and_fire( turrets );
334}

void vehicle::turrets_set_targeting ( )

Set targeting mode for specific turrets.

Definition at line 425 of file turret.cpp.

426{
427 std::vector<vehicle_part *> turrets;
428 std::vector<tripoint> locations;
429
430 for( auto &p : parts ) {
431 if( p.is_turret() ) {
432 turrets.push_back( &p );

434 }
435 }
436
437 pointmenu_cb callback( locations );
438
439 int sel = 0;
440 while( true ) {
441 uilist menu;
442 menu.text = _( "Set turret targeting" );
443 menu.callback = &callback;
444 menu.selected = sel;
445 menu.fselected = sel;
446 menu.w_y_setup = 2;
447
448 for( auto &p : turrets ) {
449 menu.addentry( -1, has_part( global_part_pos3( *p ), "TURRET_CONTROLS" ), MENU_AUTOASSIGN,
450 "%s [%s]", p->name(), p->enabled ?
451 _( "auto -> manual" ) : has_part( global_part_pos3( *p ), "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ?
452 _( "manual -> auto" ) :
453 _( "manual (turret control unit required for auto mode)" ) );
454 }
455
456 menu.query();
457 if( menu.ret < 0 || static_cast<size_t>( menu.ret ) >= turrets.size() ) {
458 break;
459 }
460
461 sel = menu.ret;
462 if( has_part( locations[ sel ], "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
463 turrets[sel]->enabled = !turrets[sel]->enabled;
464 } else {
465 turrets[sel]->enabled = false;
466 }
467
468 for( const vpart_reference &vp : get_avail_parts( "TURRET_CONTROLS" ) ) {
469 vehicle_part &e = vp.part();
470 if( e.mount == turrets[sel]->mount ) {
471 e.enabled = turrets[sel]->enabled;
472 }
473 }
474
475 // clear the turret's current targets to prevent unwanted auto-firing
476 tripoint pos = locations[ sel ];
477 turrets[ sel ]->reset_target( pos );
478 }
479}

void vehicle::update_alternator_load ( )

4775{
4776 // Update alternator load
4777 if( engine_on ) {
4778 int engine_vpower = 0;
4779 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e ) {
4780 if( is_engine_on( e ) && parts[engines[e]].info().has_flag( "E_ALTERNATOR" ) ) {
4781 engine_vpower += part_vpower_w( engines[e] );
4782 }
4783 }
4784 int alternators_power = 0;
4785 for( size_t p = 0; p < alternators.size(); ++p ) {
4786 if( is_alternator_on( p ) ) {
4787 alternators_power += part_vpower_w( alternators[p] );
4788 }
4789 }
4790 alternator_load =
4791 engine_vpower
4792 ? 1000 * ( std::abs( alternators_power ) + std::abs( extra_drag ) ) / engine_vpower
4793 : 0;
4794 } else {
4795 alternator_load = 0;
4796 }
4797}

◆ update_time()

void vehicle::update_time ( const time_point &  update_to)

Definition at line 6847 of file vehicle.cpp.

6848{
6849 const time_point update_from = last_update;
6850 if( update_to < update_from ) {
6851 // Special case going backwards in time - that happens
6852 last_update = update_to;
6853 return;
6854 }
6855
6856 if( update_to >= update_from && update_to - update_from < 1_minutes ) {
6857 // We don't need to check every turn
6858 return;
6859 }
6860 time_duration elapsed = update_to - last_update;
6861 last_update = update_to;
6862
6863 if( sm_pos.z < 0 ) {
6864 return;
6865 }
6866
6867 // Weather stuff, only for z-levels >= 0
6868 // TODO: Have it wash cars from blood?
6869 if( funnels.empty() && solar_panels.empty() && wind_turbines.empty() && water_wheels.empty() ) {
6870 return;
6871 }
6872 // Get one weather data set per vehicle, they don't differ much across vehicle area
6873 const weather_sum accum_weather = sum_conditions( update_from, update_to,
6874 global_square_location().raw() );
6875 // make some reference objects to use to check for reload
6876 const item water( "water" );
6877 const item water_clean( "water_clean" );
6878
6879 for( int idx : funnels ) {
6880 const auto &pt = parts[idx];
6881
6882 // we need an unbroken funnel mounted on the exterior of the vehicle
6883 if( pt.is_unavailable() || !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( pt ) ) ) ) {
6884 continue;
6885 }
6886
6887 // we need an empty tank (or one already containing water) below the funnel
6888 auto tank = std::find_if( parts.begin(), parts.end(), [&]( const vehicle_part & e ) {
6889 return pt.mount == e.mount && e.is_tank() &&
6890 ( e.can_reload( water ) || e.can_reload( water_clean ) );
6891 } );
6892
6893 if( tank == parts.end() ) {
6894 continue;
6895 }
6896
6897 double area = std::pow( pt.info().size / units::legacy_volume_factor, 2 ) * M_PI;
6898 int qty = roll_remainder( funnel_charges_per_turn( area, accum_weather.rain_amount ) );
6899 int c_qty = qty + ( tank->can_reload( water_clean ) ? tank->ammo_remaining() : 0 );
6900 int cost_to_purify = c_qty * itype_water_purifier->charges_to_use();
6901
6902 if( qty > 0 ) {
6903 if( has_part( global_part_pos3( pt ), "WATER_PURIFIER", true ) &&
6904 ( fuel_left( itype_battery, true ) > cost_to_purify ) ) {
6905 tank->ammo_set( itype_water_clean, c_qty );
6906 discharge_battery( cost_to_purify );
6907 } else {
6908 tank->ammo_set( itype_water, tank->ammo_remaining() + qty );
6909 }
6910 invalidate_mass();
6911 }
6912 }
6913
6914 if( !solar_panels.empty() ) {
6915 int epower_w = 0;
6916 for( int part : solar_panels ) {
6917 if( parts[ part ].is_unavailable() ) {
6918 continue;
6919 }
6920
6921 if( !is_sm_tile_outside( g->m.getabs( global_part_pos3( part ) ) ) ) {
6922 continue;
6923 }
6924
6925 epower_w += part_epower_w( part );
6926 }
6927 double intensity = accum_weather.sunlight / default_daylight_level() / to_turns<double>( elapsed );
6928 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w * intensity, elapsed );
6929 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6930 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from solar panels", name, energy_bat );
6931 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6932 }
6933 }
6934 if( !wind_turbines.empty() ) {
6935 // TODO: use accum_weather wind data to backfill wind turbine
6936 // generation capacity.
6937 int epower_w = total_wind_epower_w();
6938 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w, elapsed );
6939 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6940 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from wind turbines", name, energy_bat );
6941 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6942 }
6943 }
6944 if( !water_wheels.empty() ) {
6945 int epower_w = total_water_wheel_epower_w();
6946 int energy_bat = power_to_energy_bat( epower_w, elapsed );
6947 if( energy_bat > 0 ) {
6948 add_msg( m_debug, "%s got %d kJ energy from water wheels", name, energy_bat );
6949 charge_battery( energy_bat );
6950 }
6951 }
6952}

◆ use_bike_rack()

void vehicle::use_bike_rack ( int  part)

Definition at line 1827 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

1828{
1829 if( parts[part].is_unavailable() || parts[part].removed ) {
1830 return;
1831 }
1832 std::vector<std::vector <int>> racks_parts = find_lines_of_parts( part, "BIKE_RACK_VEH" );
1833 if( racks_parts.empty() ) {
1834 return;
1835 }
1836
1837 // check if we're storing a vehicle on this rack
1838 std::vector<std::vector<int>> carried_vehicles;
1839 std::vector<std::vector<int>> carrying_racks;
1840 bool found_vehicle = false;
1841 bool full_rack = true;
1842 for( const std::vector<int> &rack_parts : racks_parts ) {
1843 std::vector<int> carried_parts;
1844 std::vector<int> carry_rack;
1845 size_t carry_size = 0;
1846 std::string cur_vehicle;
1847
1848 const auto add_vehicle = []( std::vector<int> &carried_parts,
1849 std::vector<std::vector<int>> &carried_vehicles,
1850 std::vector<int> &carry_rack,
1851 std::vector<std::vector<int>> &carrying_racks ) {
1852 if( !carry_rack.empty() ) {
1853 carrying_racks.emplace_back( carry_rack );
1854 carried_vehicles.emplace_back( carried_parts );
1855 carry_rack.clear();
1856 carried_parts.clear();
1857 }
1858 };
1859
1860 for( const int &rack_part : rack_parts ) {
1861 // skip parts that aren't carrying anything
1862 if( !parts[ rack_part ].has_flag( vehicle_part::carrying_flag ) ) {
1863 add_vehicle( carried_parts, carried_vehicles, carry_rack, carrying_racks );
1864 cur_vehicle.clear();
1865 continue;
1866 }
1867 for( const point &mount_dir : five_cardinal_directions ) {
1868 point near_loc = parts[ rack_part ].mount + mount_dir;
1869 std::vector<int> near_parts = parts_at_relative( near_loc, true );
1870 if( near_parts.empty() ) {
1871 continue;
1872 }
1873 if( parts[ near_parts[ 0 ] ].has_flag( vehicle_part::carried_flag ) ) {
1874 carry_size += 1;
1875 found_vehicle = true;
1876 // found a carried vehicle part
1877 if( parts[ near_parts[ 0 ] ].carried_name() != cur_vehicle ) {
1878 add_vehicle( carried_parts, carried_vehicles, carry_rack, carrying_racks );
1879 cur_vehicle = parts[ near_parts[ 0 ] ].carried_name();
1880 }
1881 for( const int &carried_part : near_parts ) {
1882 carried_parts.push_back( carried_part );
1883 }
1884 carry_rack.push_back( rack_part );
1885 // we're not adjacent to another carried vehicle on this rack
1886 break;
1887 }
1888 }
1889 }
1890
1891 add_vehicle( carried_parts, carried_vehicles, carry_rack, carrying_racks );
1892 full_rack &= carry_size == rack_parts.size();
1893 }
1894 int unload_carried = full_rack ? 0 : -1;
1895 bool success = false;
1896 if( found_vehicle && !full_rack ) {
1897 uilist rack_menu;
1898 rack_menu.addentry( 0, true, '0', _( "Load a vehicle on the rack" ) );
1899 for( size_t i = 0; i < carried_vehicles.size(); i++ ) {
1900 rack_menu.addentry( i + 1, true, '1' + i,
1901 string_format( _( "Remove the %s from the rack" ),
1902 parts[ carried_vehicles[i].front() ].carried_name() ) );
1903 }
1904 rack_menu.query();
1905 unload_carried = rack_menu.ret - 1;
1906 }
1907 if( unload_carried > -1 ) {
1908 success = remove_carried_vehicle( carried_vehicles[unload_carried] );
1909 if( success ) {
1910 for( const int &rack_part : carrying_racks[unload_carried] ) {
1911 parts[ rack_part ].remove_flag( vehicle_part::carrying_flag );
1912 parts[rack_part].remove_flag( vehicle_part::tracked_flag );
1913 }
1914 }
1915 } else {
1916 success = try_to_rack_nearby_vehicle( racks_parts );
1917 }
1918 if( success ) {
1919 get_map().invalidate_map_cache( g->get_levz() );
1920 get_map().reset_vehicle_cache( );
1921 }
1922}

642{

648 Character &character = get_player_character();
649 const auto confirm_stop_driving = [this] {
650 return !is_flying_in_air() || query_yn(
651 _( "Really let go of controls while flying? This will result in a crash." ) );
652 };
653
654 if( remote ) {
655 options.emplace_back( _( "Stop controlling" ), keybind( "RELEASE_CONTROLS" ) );
656 actions.push_back( [&] {
657 if( confirm_stop_driving() )
658 {
659 character.controlling_vehicle = false;
660 g->setremoteveh( nullptr );
661 add_msg( _( "You stop controlling the vehicle." ) );
662 refresh();
663 }
664 } );
665
666 has_electronic_controls = has_part( "CTRL_ELECTRONIC" ) || has_part( "REMOTE_CONTROLS" );
667
668 } else if( veh_pointer_or_null( g->m.veh_at( pos ) ) == this ) {
669 if( character.controlling_vehicle ) {
670 options.emplace_back( _( "Let go of controls" ), keybind( "RELEASE_CONTROLS" ) );
671 actions.push_back( [&] {
672 if( confirm_stop_driving() )
673 {
674 character.controlling_vehicle = false;
675 add_msg( _( "You let go of the controls." ) );
676 refresh();
677 }
678 } );
679 }
680 has_electronic_controls = !get_parts_at( pos, "CTRL_ELECTRONIC",
681 part_status_flag::any ).empty();
682 }
683
684 if( get_parts_at( pos, "CONTROLS", part_status_flag::any ).empty() && !has_electronic_controls ) {
685 add_msg( m_info, _( "No controls there" ) );
686 return;
687 }
688
689 // exit early if you can't control the vehicle
690 if( !interact_vehicle_locked() ) {
691 return;
692 }
693
694 if( has_part( "ENGINE" ) ) {
695 if( character.controlling_vehicle || ( remote && engine_on ) ) {
696 options.emplace_back( _( "Stop driving" ), keybind( "TOGGLE_ENGINE" ) );
697 actions.push_back( [&] {
698 if( !confirm_stop_driving() )
699 {
700 return;
701 } else if( engine_on && has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) )
702 {
703 add_msg( _( "You turn the engine off and let go of the controls." ) );
704 sounds::sound( pos, 2, sounds::sound_t::movement,
705 _( "the engine go silent" ) );
706 } else
707 {
708 add_msg( _( "You let go of the controls." ) );
709 }
710
711 for( size_t e = 0; e < engines.size(); ++e )
712 {
713 if( is_engine_on( e ) ) {
714 const vpart_info &einfo = part_info( e );
715 const std::string &engine_id = einfo.get_id().str();
716 const int noise = einfo.engine_noise_factor();
717
718 if( sfx::has_variant_sound( "engine_stop", engine_id ) ) {
719 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_stop", engine_id, noise );
720 } else if( is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_muscle ) ) {
721 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_stop", "muscle", noise );
722 } else if( is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_wind ) ) {
723 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_stop", "wind", noise );
724 } else if( is_engine_type( e, fuel_type_battery ) ) {
725 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_stop", "electric", noise );
726 } else {
727 sfx::play_variant_sound( "engine_stop", "combustion", noise );
728 }
729 }
730 }
731 vehicle_noise = 0;
732 engine_on = false;
733 character.controlling_vehicle = false;
734 g->setremoteveh( nullptr );
735 sfx::do_vehicle_engine_sfx();
736 refresh();
737 } );
738
739 } else if( has_engine_type_not( fuel_type_muscle, true ) ) {
740 options.emplace_back( engine_on ? _( "Turn off the engine" ) : _( "Turn on the engine" ),
741 keybind( "TOGGLE_ENGINE" ) );
742 actions.push_back( [&] {
743 if( engine_on )
744 {
745 engine_on = false;
746 sounds::sound( pos, 2, sounds::sound_t::movement,
747 _( "the engine go silent" ) );
748 stop_engines();
749 } else
750 {
751 start_engines();
752 }
753 refresh();
754 } );
755 }
756 }
757
758 if( has_part( "HORN" ) ) {
759 options.emplace_back( _( "Honk horn" ), keybind( "SOUND_HORN" ) );
760 actions.push_back( [&] { honk_horn(); refresh(); } );
761 }
762 if( has_part( "AUTOPILOT" ) && ( has_part( "CTRL_ELECTRONIC" ) ||
763 has_part( "REMOTE_CONTROLS" ) ) ) {
764 options.emplace_back( _( "Control autopilot" ),
765 keybind( "CONTROL_AUTOPILOT" ) );
766 actions.push_back( [&] { toggle_autopilot(); refresh(); } );
767 }
768
769 options.emplace_back( cruise_on ? _( "Disable cruise control" ) : _( "Enable cruise control" ),
770 keybind( "TOGGLE_CRUISE_CONTROL" ) );
771 actions.emplace_back( [&] {
772 cruise_on = !cruise_on;
773 add_msg( cruise_on ? _( "Cruise control turned on" ) : _( "Cruise control turned off" ) );
774 refresh();
775 } );
776
777 if( has_electronic_controls ) {
778 set_electronics_menu_options( options, actions );
779 options.emplace_back( _( "Control multiple electronics" ), keybind( "CONTROL_MANY_ELECTRONICS" ) );
780 actions.push_back( [&] { control_electronics(); refresh(); } );
781 }
782
783 options.emplace_back( tracking_on ? _( "Forget vehicle position" ) :
784 _( "Remember vehicle position" ),
785 keybind( "TOGGLE_TRACKING" ) );
786 actions.push_back( [&] { toggle_tracking(); } );
787
788 if( ( is_foldable() || tags.count( "convertible" ) ) && !remote ) {
789 options.emplace_back( string_format( _( "Fold %s" ), name ), keybind( "FOLD_VEHICLE" ) );
790 actions.push_back( [&] { fold_up(); } );
791 }
792
793 if( has_part( "ENGINE" ) ) {
794 options.emplace_back( _( "Control individual engines" ), keybind( "CONTROL_ENGINES" ) );
795 actions.push_back( [&] { control_engines(); refresh(); } );
796 }
797
798 if( is_alarm_on ) {
799 if( velocity == 0 && !remote ) {
800 options.emplace_back( _( "Try to disarm alarm." ), keybind( "TOGGLE_ALARM" ) );
801 actions.push_back( [&] { smash_security_system(); refresh(); } );
802
803 } else if( has_electronic_controls && has_part( "SECURITY" ) ) {
804 options.emplace_back( _( "Trigger alarm" ), keybind( "TOGGLE_ALARM" ) );
805 actions.push_back( [&] {
806 is_alarm_on = true;
807 add_msg( _( "You trigger the alarm" ) );
808 refresh();
809 } );
810 }
811 }
812
813 if( has_part( "TURRET" ) ) {
814 options.emplace_back( _( "Set turret targeting modes" ), keybind( "TURRET_TARGET_MODE" ) );
815 actions.push_back( [&] { turrets_set_targeting(); refresh(); } );
816
817 options.emplace_back( _( "Set turret firing modes" ), keybind( "TURRET_FIRE_MODE" ) );
818 actions.push_back( [&] { turrets_set_mode(); refresh(); } );
819
820 // We can also fire manual turrets with ACTION_FIRE while standing at the controls.
821 options.emplace_back( _( "Aim turrets manually" ), keybind( "TURRET_MANUAL_AIM" ) );
822 actions.push_back( [&] { turrets_aim_and_fire_all_manual( true ); refresh(); } );
823
824 // This lets us manually override and set the target for the automatic turrets instead.
825 options.emplace_back( _( "Aim automatic turrets" ), keybind( "TURRET_MANUAL_OVERRIDE" ) );
826 actions.push_back( [&] { turrets_override_automatic_aim(); refresh(); } );
827
828 options.emplace_back( _( "Aim individual turret" ), keybind( "TURRET_SINGLE_FIRE" ) );
829 actions.push_back( [&] { turrets_aim_and_fire_single(); refresh(); } );
830 }
831
832 uilist menu;
833 menu.text = _( "Vehicle controls" );
834 menu.entries = options;
835 menu.query();
836 if( menu.ret >= 0 ) {
837 // allow player to turn off engine without triggering another warning
838 if( menu.ret != 0 && menu.ret != 1 && menu.ret != 2 && menu.ret != 3 ) {
839 if( !handle_potential_theft( dynamic_cast<player &>( character ) ) ) {
840 return;
841 }
842 }
843 actions[menu.ret]();
844 // Don't access `this` from here on, one of the actions above is to call
845 // fold_up(), which may have deleted `this` object.
846 }
847}

◆ use_washing_machine()

void vehicle::use_washing_machine ( int  p)

Definition at line 1610 of file vehicle_use.cpp.

1611{
1612 // Get all the items that can be used as detergent
1613 const inventory &inv = g->u.crafting_inventory();
1614 std::vector<const item *> detergents = inv.items_with( [inv]( const item & it ) {
1615 return it.has_flag( "DETERGENT" ) && inv.has_charges( it.typeId(), 5 );
1616 } );
1617
1618 auto items = get_items( p );
1619 static const std::string filthy( "FILTHY" );
1620 bool filthy_items = std::all_of( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & i ) {
1621 return i.has_flag( filthy );
1622 } );
1623
1624 bool cbms = std::any_of( items.begin(), items.end(), []( const item & i ) {
1625 return i.is_bionic();
1626 } );
1627
1628 if( parts[p].enabled ) {
1629 parts[p].enabled = false;
1630 add_msg( m_bad,
1631 _( "You turn the washing machine off before it's finished the program, and open its lid." ) );
1632 } else if( items.empty() ) {
1633 add_msg( m_bad,
1634 _( "The washing machine is empty, there's no point in starting it." ) );
1635 } else if( fuel_left( itype_water ) < 24 && fuel_left( itype_water_clean ) < 24 ) {
1636 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You need 24 charges of water in tanks of the %s to fill the washing machine." ),
1637 name );
1638 } else if( detergents.empty() ) {
1639 add_msg( m_bad, _( "You need 5 charges of a detergent for the washing machine." ) );
1640 } else if( !filthy_items ) {
1641 add_msg( m_bad,
1642 _( "You need to remove all non-filthy items from the washing machine to start the washing program." ) );
1643 } else if( cbms ) {
1644 add_msg( m_bad,
1645 _( "CBMs can't be cleaned in a washing machine. You need to remove them." ) );
1646 } else {
1647 uilist detergent_selector;
1648 detergent_selector.text = _( "Use what detergent?" );
1649
1650 std::vector<itype_id> det_types;
1651 for( const item *it : detergents ) {
1652 itype_id det_type = it->typeId();
1653 // If the vector does not contain the detergent type, add it
1654 if( std::find( det_types.begin(), det_types.end(), det_type ) == det_types.end() ) {
1655 det_types.emplace_back( det_type );
1656 }
1657
1658 }
1659 int chosen_detergent = 0;
1660 // If there's a choice to be made on what detergent to use, ask the player
1661 if( det_types.size() > 1 ) {
1662 for( size_t i = 0; i < det_types.size(); ++i ) {
1663 detergent_selector.addentry( i, true, 0, item::nname( det_types[i] ) );
1664 }
1665 detergent_selector.addentry( UILIST_CANCEL, true, 0, _( "Cancel" ) );
1666 detergent_selector.query();
1667 chosen_detergent = detergent_selector.ret;
1668 }
1669
1670 // If the player exits the menu, don't do anything else
1671 if( chosen_detergent == UILIST_CANCEL ) {
1672 return;
1673 }
1674
1675 parts[p].enabled = true;
1676 for( auto &n : items ) {
1677 n.set_age( 0_turns );
1678 }
1679
1680 if( fuel_left( itype_water ) >= 24 ) {
1681 drain( itype_water, 24 );
1682 } else {
1683 drain( itype_water_clean, 24 );
1684 }
1685
1686 std::vector<item_comp> detergent;
1687 detergent.push_back( item_comp( det_types[chosen_detergent], 5 ) );
1688 g->u.consume_items( detergent, 1, is_crafting_component );
1689
1690 add_msg( m_good,
1691 _( "You pour some detergent into the washing machine, close its lid, and turn it on. The washing machine is being filled with water from vehicle tanks." ) );
1692 }
1693}

1231{
1232 // Convert vhp units (0.5 HP ) to watts
1233 // Used primarily for calculating battery charge/discharge
1234 // TODO: convert batteries to use energy units based on watts (watt-ticks?)
1235 constexpr int conversion_factor = 373; // 373 watts == 1 power_vhp == 0.5 HP

1237}

◆ water_acceleration()

int vehicle::water_acceleration ( bool  fueled = true,
int  at_vel_in_vmi = -1 
) const

Definition at line 3586 of file vehicle.cpp.

3587{
3588 if( !( engine_on || skidding ) ) {
3589 return 0;
3590 }
3591 int target_vmiph = std::max( at_vel_in_vmi, std::max( 1000,
3592 max_water_velocity( fueled ) / 4 ) );
3593 int cmps = vmiph_to_cmps( target_vmiph );
3594 double weight = to_kilogram( total_mass() );
3595 if( is_towing() ) {
3596 vehicle *other_veh = tow_data.get_towed();
3597 if( other_veh ) {
3598 weight = weight + to_kilogram( other_veh->total_mass() );
3599 }
3600 }
3601 int engine_power_ratio = total_power_w( fueled ) / weight;
3602 int accel_at_vel = 100 * 100 * engine_power_ratio / cmps;
3603 add_msg( m_debug, "%s: water accel at %d vimph is %d", name, target_vmiph,
3604 cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel ) );
3605 return cmps_to_vmiph( accel_at_vel );
3606}

◆ pos

point vehicle::pos

Position of the vehicle inside the submap that contains the vehicle.

This will (nearly) always be in the range (0...SEEX-1). Note that vehicles are "moved" by map::displace_vehicle. You should not set them directly, except when initializing the vehicle or during mapgen.

Definition at line 1916 of file vehicle.h.

Referenced by map::add_vehicle_to_map(), advance_precalc_mounts(), automatic_fire_turret(), backfire(), break_off(), vehicle::autodrive_controller::compute_profile(), enclosed_at(), find_vehicle(), get_items(), get_parts_at(), global_pos3(), has_part(), interact_with(), obstacle_at_position(), opaque_at_position(), open_or_close(), game::place_vehicle_nearby(), reload_seeds(), start_engine(), turret_query(), turrets_set_targeting(), use_controls(), use_harness(), and use_monster_capture().

◆ rail_profile

std::vector<int> vehicle::rail_profile

Rail profile of the vehicle.

Describes where the vehicle would expect rails to be on its y axis relative to its pivot point in its own coordinate space.

For example, for 2-seated draisine (drawn as facing north): 

  +x

..:...:.. ..:...:.. - and | draisine frame ..0—0.. 0 railwheels -y ..|—|.. +y p pivot point ..0-p-0.. . ground ..:...:.. : expected rail ..:...:.. -x

The rail profile would take the value of { -2, 2 }.

Definition at line 1846 of file vehicle.h.

Referenced by refresh(), and vehicle_movement::scan_rails_from_veh_internal().

◆ sm_pos

tripoint vehicle::sm_pos

Submap coordinates of the currently loaded submap (see game::m) that contains this vehicle.

These values are changed when the map shifts (but the vehicle is not actually moved than, it also stays on the same submap, only the relative coordinates in map::grid have changed). These coordinates must always refer to the submap in map::grid that contains this vehicle. When the vehicle is really moved (by map::displace_vehicle), set_submap_moved is called and updates these values, when the map is only shifted or when a submap is loaded into the map the values are directly set. The vehicles position does not change therefor no call to set_submap_moved is required.

Definition at line 1901 of file vehicle.h.

Referenced by act_on_map(), map::add_vehicle(), map::add_vehicle_to_map(), map::detach_vehicle(), drive_to_local_target(), global_pos3(), map::loadn(), merge_rackable_vehicle(), map::move_vehicle(), open_or_close(), part_collision(), game::place_vehicle_nearby(), remove_part(), set_submap_moved(), split_vehicles(), update_time(), vehicle(), and map::vehicle_vehicle_collision().

◆ type

vproto_id vehicle::type

Type of the vehicle as it was spawned.

This will never change, but it can be an invalid type (e.g. if the definition of the prototype has been removed from json or if it has been spawned with the default constructor).

Definition at line 1855 of file vehicle.h.

Referenced by map::add_vehicle_to_map(), damage(), damage_all(), damage_direct(), explode_fuel(), init_state(), place_spawn_items(), spew_field(), and vehicle().
